zHSgsfmTtR3OueZDEHYPbQ.text: Service and location are great but Americano pizza tasted so bad I cannot recommend anyone coming back here when there is great pizza places all over to Phx.

PYsZj8HGzXEPsbHA2_7bag.text: absolutely no no. staffs lost their manner,  not even a hip place. not recommend for non white people, since they are racists.

d96edhq4IfDJMlQUaebszA.text: Very nice atmosphere, great service and a gorgonzola steak that melts in your mouth; cooked to order so give yourself time for Chef to perfect it.  The mushroom appitizer board was bomb!

gnm9zO-JJ_T4NvXu8fxdMA.text: My boyfriend loves coming here for the absinthe but I'm more of a wine person which they have a great wine, absinthe and craft cocktail list. I love the vibe it very romantic definitely a great date place. There are some weird quarks to they place like the basement and bathrooms.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pinot Grigio

bi65DwdsOj-mbDNTZXIhAQ.text: Hanny's felt to me like an establishment stuck in the 80s. The decor is all super modern with lots of white marble. We came here on a Saturday night for drinks. The music was bumping from a DJ box up on the second floor and it was pretty crowded. The drinks where ok, a little expensive for what are basically just classic cocktails. All in all my experience at Hanny's was fine. Like I said it felt like a bar stuck in the 80s, which just isn't really my scene.

inDx5Lhua6647VNY0J74Pg.text: Great downtown eatery.  Nightclub lighting, comfortable seating and great sounds make for an exceptional experience.  Great drink selection and menu choices.  Service has been consistently outstanding on previous visits.  Hanny's market salad is the best; dijon vinaigrette dressing and served with everything separated on a large plate.

T2v5Mg7DqwObB6o55CkbTA.text: You never know what kind of service you'll get on a night like New Year's Eve. As the rain stopped, temporarily, we decided to venture out into downtown to find a place to get a bite and have a drink. We found Hanny's and were most impressed. From Rene taking care of us the moment we walked in the door, to Russell continuing to deliver outstanding customer service until the end of our meal, these two gentleman showed us what truly was attention to detail delivered in the form of excellent service. We will definitely be back to enjoy quality food and excellent service again.

mNA79WwyWHDL-v5vrtyyZg.text: I love hanny's! I've never had a bad experience.....but tonight I went in at around midnight yes, but just wanted some dessert and a martini to finish the night right! The host told us they were just about closed and that we could come back tomorrow because half of the staff didn't show up! I'm sorry but I've never been disappointed here so I guess that's why this is so upsetting to me as a customer. I love hanny's but tonight they were slacking ,

yoLwCYILH3X1S6peHEkokw.text: I've been coming here for years, and Hanny's has yet to disappoint. My go-to is the Aviation martini, although there are many great choices.   Lately, though, I've been bringing my nieces and nephew here, and boy do they love it...they're older, 10, 11 & 12, but they can't get enough of the 4 cheese pizza, the Italian sodas and the desserts. I secretly think they like it because of the crazy bathrooms!  Although I wouldn't necessarily call this a "kid friendly" venue, the servers are always so nice and welcoming, and as long as your kids are mature and well-behaved, they'll do great!  Whether it's late night or early dinner, Hanny's has a little something for everyone! (Don't forget to tour the basement!!)

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Italian style Shirley Temples with delightful dark cherries!

gOujpKzavmdZulA5s6LM2Q.text: Stopped by Hanny's because it was one of the few restaurants open late night in the Downtown Phoenix area after the recent Cheez-It bowl. I was excited to see the vegetarian options so this was our spot. I ordered the portobello sandwich, the hubby got some asparagus and onion strings and I order 2 margherita pizzas for the kids to share. After spending $50, most of the food went to the trash.   The onion strings are solid...A+. Everything else was meh. The kids didn't even eat the pizza. I have the admit that the flavor of it was quite weird. Can't put my finger on it, but it was a very nice sized pizza. The sandwich was less than meh, I ate more of the pizza (which I didn't enjoy) than my sandwich... but I ate all of the onion strings ;-).  The sandwich lacked flavor. No seasoning, no burst of brightness, no acidity, no sauce. It tasted like sauteed mushrooms and bread. And my bread was mush because of the abundance of mushroom juice.   Hey chef! Are you tasting the food that leaves your kitchen?!

Rx0AzhQOh-ZBxJ-mHkmz2A.text: (Lyrics - Mariah Carey - Honey)  Hanny got me hooked on you  Think I can have you  When I want you I'll simply yelp all my way there And you're the only one In Phoenix that makes me come running  Because what you got Is far beyond compare And it's right at Hanny's When your drinks comes over me Oh baby, I love your atmosphere Always ready For another round at Hanny's  Hanny's a little hot spot in downtown PHX.  This place is always packing every time I attend.  The place can get loud especially if the DJ is mixing things up in here.  I usually sit at the bar since seating can be tough to get around here.  I order my whiskey and shared a snack plate with my buddy; cured meats, olives, pistachio nuts, and ciabatta bread.  So far a decent start, but nothing too crazy to rave about.  For our entree we shot for the Carne pizza, Italian sausage, pepperoni, cheese blend, and tomato sauce.  I have to say it might not sound too exciting, but rather enjoyed this pizza.  I would really taste the tomato sauce on such a thin crust which I appreciate.  Sometimes I order a thin crust pizza and everything else along with it is thin including the ingredients, but not here!    In the end, Hanny's a go to spot which I generally come downtown.  It's a great atmosphere for drinks and kicks.  I'm can't say the food here is phenomenal, but it'll do the job! - Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bn2H6NmWZBpHgQnZzkU-qA.text: I love this place. It has such a cool vibe and the cocktails and pizzas are amazing. The setup is really unique and the staff are very friendly. I also love that it's open late every night. Definitely recommend

7SVPc7RVSLlyI6mdd_mlSw.text: Excellent meal. Cheap drinks, spectacular food. Recommended: the pork Milanese. Among the best I've ever had, and on a random Wednesday evening in December!

p3Niv8_lmFg8G9rmFkw4bQ.text: The place is interesting with hidden treasures. The food is not super big. Its basically like eating happy hour food and I feel the price for the food is too much with the quality I get. For example, the pizzas felt low quality with their crust.

RflHNGg5SfbqfGjV_SPbIA.text: Well we had a pretty bad experience here last night. I don't think we've ever been treated so poorly by a waitress ever in our entire lives. The waitress (short black hair with bangs) was so completely horrific we couldn't believe it and we tell this sorry to everyone now lol. So she wasn't very warm to begin with which is fine but literally took about 40 minutes to come back to us to grab our order. When she brought the check to us she LITERALLY told us, "I'm not splitting the check. Here's a pencil you do the math". We GLADLY gave her a horrible tip and left. Never ever again will we come in. The food was ok but insanely overpriced. We won't come in here even if you paid us.

T8QUn9eV1dYY1FyzCfkOhg.text: Looking for the perfect first date night atmosphere Hannys is the way to go. Meet up with a bumble date here and it was amazing. The service was great, the pizza was delicious and the music with a live dj with beyond words. Definitely a great go to spot.

6aixtJVh37W15qZU7GGYGg.text: One of my favorite spots in Phoenix!  Great drink menu, with tons of options and small plates to choose from on the menu. It gets packed after 11pm so seating will be limited. Just post up at the bar or take a visit down to the dungeon or up to the colorful coed bathrooms lol. The best thing about Hanny's is the unique feel that you get throughout the venue. Service is friendly, crowd is a mix of trendy young professionals and regulars. I usually try to go back here whenever i'm in town, and the prices are right in line with the atmosphere you walk into.   4 STARS.

CiPTk4gU_I1Dq7YhO0OZlw.text: Typically when I'm in town for a concert, I always go to the same place. A friend of mine not only suggested Hanny's but the Prosciutto Arugula Pizza as well. The food was amazing! I love the thin crust of the pizza and the sweet flavor of the sauce. I sat at the bar. The bartenders were attentive and provided great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EGOafcIvYDkl4QQTrtWKSA.text: The place is awesome in my point of view. It is artistic. Check out the upstair and basement. Food looks delicious and so they are.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hanny&#39;s steak

dZSPzGQXw3h0BhRTx6JB6g.text: Always one of my favorite spots. Tonight we sat at the bar. Kevin was great! Attentive even with the hustle of a Sat night. We will be back next week and will request Kevin.

rjtTgywC7AUbVkW5JJvcAA.text: We came here for a birthday dinner party we reserve the table for 12 at 6 PM at 7:15 we were  seated we then requested for another table since we had more guest show up they said that wasn't a problem we waited for our server for about 15 minutes after we were seated and then., When I Asked our  server that we were ready to order he said that he wasn't sure what was going on because we were seated in a section that was for 4 groups. He said he had to go get two more waiters in order for us to put in orders. The waitress came we put in our orders everybody else got their orders before us. We never got silverware. When we asked for water he told us that they had ran out of water glasses. Our other servers got us water.We flagged him down for more water and silverware and he never came back one of our friends  ordered a salad she got her salad five minutes before we left. She had to hurry up and eat her salad so that we can all be together. The food was good but the service was terrible specially from our waiter he has long curly hair we never got his name because he never told us. He can't even have the excuse that he had a big party because he only took six of our orders and our party was probably around 20 people. This is ridiculous.

zFTYgVai_oDUBOMv56ofkw.text: I've heard so much about this place, both on Yelp and from colleagues & clients. So, I couldn't say no when a client setup a mid-afternoon meeting here. It was a Friday around 2 pm and the place was dead when I arrived. I think there were 2 tables of people and a couple sitting at the bar. I saddled up to one of the high top tables near the bar. When they arrived, we decided to order food: Cauliflower Calabrese, $7.50 yelp.com/biz_photos/hann... Pepperoni & Onion Pizza, $12 yelp.com/biz_photos/hann... yelp.com/biz_photos/hann... Panino (Prosciutto di Parma, Sopressata, Fontina Cheese, Arugula, Ciabatta Bread, Italian Vinaigrette), $10.50 yelp.com/biz_photos/hann... Strawberry Longcake yelp.com/biz_photos/hann... The Cauliflower Calabrese was very interesting....it was like a stir fry dish. The Cauliflower was pretty good and flavorful...I like the texture of it. The rest of it was *meh*. The Pepperoni Pizza was pretty good. It's very thin and while the portion looks large, it's not too bad if 1 person had it as their entree. We split it up. One of my clients had the Panino. She said it was very good. We all tried the Strawberry Longcake...which is divine! It's a Strawberry Cake fused with Ice Cream and Strawberries and topped with Strawberry Drizzle, fresh Strawberries, and Whipped Cream. Wow, this surprised us and blew us away. What a nice surprise! Overall, it's a pretty cool joint. I hear they have DJ's on the weekend and it turns into a pretty cool spot. We'll have to come back and try that sometime. Return Factor - 90%

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uivSslgCeOXo_yiWJXev9A.text: Let's talk about Hanny's. 1. They've had four priority health dept. violations between Februrary 9th, 2015 and May 6th, 2015. Maricopa County Environmental Services defines a "Priority Violation" as "a major violation that directly contributes to increasing the risk of food borne illness or injury. " Yum! You can find this information by going to maricopa.gov/EnvSvc, restaurant ratings, business name, Hannys 2. Their service is notoriously awful. At about 8PM last night (I was one of maybe, ten people in the whole place) I was met with the status-quo, smug, aloof, demeanor of one entitled, crabby bartender. My salad order was incorrect, then I had to flag him down to place my pizza order, interrupting his annoyingly long conversation with a buddy, less than five feet from where I was sitting. 3. After acknowledging the incorrect order, and being pulled away from his hipster gabfest with the inconvenience of taking my order, I received zero concession on the cost of my botched salad. I did, however, get the privilege of being up-charged $2.00 for extra sauce on my pizza! Yay! 4. Today I called the restaurant and spoke to the manager, Alex, to obtain his email address. Though he's been GM there for some time, he must have a bit of a memory problem because he gave me the wrong address. Poor guy. Luckily for both of us, I'm rather resourceful and figured out the right one. I sent him a message detailing both my experience last night, as well as previous unpleasant experiences. I've also learned that the he is (or was) the significant other of the owner's daughter, apparently not a recipe for over-achievement (see number 5) 5. Here is the email reply I received from Alex. "Liz thank you for the email. First let me say I am sorry for the lack of service you experienced on Sunday. While the goal is to provide excellent service all of the time to everyone, it is not always achievable. Cody did mention your complaint and was truly sorry he said to me that he was unaware of any problem until you mentioned your experience just before you left. We would love the opportunity to serve you again and hopefully make up for your visit this past Sunday. Please give us the chance and please introduce yourself next time you stop by. Sincerely Alex." Too bad there isn't an abundance of really amazing restaurants in the Phoenix area from which to choose in the future. Oh, wait...

NvLsgkxWdC4s72ntpldm8w.text: LOVE Hannys... or, I did. I've been a few times and loved every time, until tonight.   My wife and I had a rare opportunity of a night off together. We bought tickets to the ballet, and decided on one of our favorite places before hand, Hanny's.  We sat at the bar to find two disheveled bartenders and one young man in training.  After waiting several minutes to receive menus and an offer for a drink, we decided on our cocktails. When the bartender heard which type of liquor I requested, she said I wouldn't be able to tell the difference between that and their well, trying to down-sell me. This has never happened to me before. You'd think I would be happy to spend less money, however I do not appreciate the bartender arguing with me about my preferences.   Though I ordered it up, my cocktail came on the rocks. I asked for a glass that I could pour it into and she seemed inconvenienced to correct her own mistake.  Then, we overheard another bartender training the young man. She said, "you are supposed to just do a rinse of absinthe however, I just put a little bit in the shaker instead. It's easier." WTF? Now I'm hearing training staff telling the new guy to take short cuts?!   The food arrived, meh. The snack board could use EVOO but I felt like asking for it would have seemed high maintenance to our less than enthusiastic staff.   The salads were nearly naked and required extra dressing. (We are usually people who order light dressing.)   After our meal, when I asked which Amaros they carried, the bartender looked confused and said, "Um... we don't have any of that."   I review their cocktail list and found a comprehensive list of all amari.   I mentioned, "Oh! Fernet Branca is an amaro." To which she quickly rebutted, "We're out."   Okay. Check please. Really? This used to be one of the most happnin places with knowledgeable staff and now...? I'll stay home and shake own martini.

etwWUZSIuE8UfUBEJAbO9A.text: From the time I walked in the door..I was a happy customer. Service was outstanding. Jordan you rocked it...food was nicely prepared. My GF and I had the ribeye ++++ and pizza was great too. My only criticism was there could have been a few more potatoes with the steak. Other than that. GREAT!! I'll be back

maJ9C8yisrc3dAefe16pdw.text: Cool vibe in the heart of downtown. Drinks are really overpriced and the pizza wasn't quite right. I should have ordered one of the salads, which looks amazing. Next time...

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Little crispy on this edge, raw on the other side.

bYwjiy9ZK8lLfm98XCkqxg.text: Odd place. Was not expecting to see weird dolls or have a circus carnival vibe near the bathrooms. We grabbed dinner, the food was pretty good. BLT supremo and pizza were both great.

svjFb6MTP4-Hfd5ONEkRyA.text: Great hot spot in Phoenix... younger crowd with Comicon going on across the street.  Centrally located with easy parking. We were there early but the restaurant was packed.  The noise level was high and a few more plants or sound barriers would help.  It was quieter on the second floor.  The bathrooms are a must see so I will leave it out of the review, but be sure to check them out.  The food was great for the most part.  The Tuscan steak was a large portion and so two of us split it.  Cooked perfectly with a great Gorgonzola butter on top served with onion strings.  Our friends had a beautiful, large beet salad with goat cheese, covered in pistachios, served on a bed of Arugula. It was really flavorful with a light vinaigrette. The beef dip sandwich was dry and flavorless and there was no horseradish sauce that use to spice it up.  Overall we will definitely be back to try the pizzas.

33oCc5XNoZLhyj3zkK0LDQ.text: Pretty good place. I enjoyed the atmosphere & the general area.   Food was pretty good. Their salads are pretty good & so is their pizza. Prices are also pretty good & it was a Saturday night so not even happy hour or anything.   If you're in the downtown Phoenix area, give it a try.

IXrZZ5L0vX6RIJRKZ4pYQA.text: Hanny's is a great time to go anytime of the week!  Weekend's you will likely deal with louderDJ'ed music, not the best for easily had conversations.  Their food and craft cocktails are incredible though!  I typically go with just my fiancee and we will split the Gorgonzola slaw, the Beet Salad and the Quattro Pizza!  They are all delicious.  The Moscow Mule is top-notch and I also recommend the Ginger Creek, if you like bourbon.  The only reason this review isn't 5 stars is because of Parking (you will likely pay $4-$8 during peak times in a nearby garage) and the service.  The servers are the epitome of aging hipsters who either take life & their job too seriously OR they are just miserable with their jobs altogether.  I have had several experiences that leave me wondering why management is unable to either find or retain happy servers but the food, atmosphere & drinks is enough to keep you coming back.  Nobody's perfect!

7ITj2EJ3aSElMiifslT81Q.text: So i stayed next to this restaurant for a convention last weekend . So i decided to invite my cousins that live in arizona to grab a bite to eat so we decided to go to hannys . Worst choice of my life , the atmosphere is okay older women and older men with loud music . The food was the worst part oh my , let me tell you about funky flavors . One of my cousins almost cried when he took the first bite of his sandwhich lol , let me tell you we all got the same sandwhich . It was so hard to eat like it was not good not even satisfying . I had to remove the meat and eat the meat alone after i had wiped it down with a napkin . To top it off the waiter got everyones card and charged us individually when we were done , we didnt even know we were going to pay with only 1 card ( he was tall skinny ) to top it off we told him how we felt about the food and he ignored and answered with a different response saying do you need to go bags lol , No ! The FOOD IS NASTY . What a joke . There was a restaurant in front of hannys who hands down had better service and better tasting food . 1 star for hannys . More options on the MENU ALSO . Please yall have little to no food . No options .

sfQw8CkFi7RtG3jYVIstgQ.text: Hanny's is a restaurant that was converted from a department store. Really good job with the conversion. Mannequins were artfully displayed, if you don't pay attention you will not notice they are mannequins and not statues. The restrooms were previously fitting rooms. Really cool space. Great looking bar in the middle of the restaurant as well.   There was a DJ playing from a sound room from above the bar. He was playing our jams! We had such a great time!   I had a Moscow Mule, it was light and tasty. Very cold, came in the classic copper cup. Love that! We also had a snack plate which was loaded with prosciutto, olives, nuts and cheese.  Really delicious prosciutto.  I also tasted the classic martini, and it is super strong. I had to sit back down.  :)  I will definitely be back to Hanny's, highly recommend.

9hgXpUaDfKJr4CkV-GRMCQ.text: Good use of an old space. I was informed by our server that this was a department store from the 1940"s until the mid 1980's, and then used for the next 20 years as a training facility for the Phoenix Fire Department. After that, it became Hanny's.  We started with a Gray Goose Cosmo and a Stella. Both were on point.  We shared a snack plate. Good stuff.  If you expect a New York style Margherita pizza, don't hold you breath. We got an oblong shaped thin crust pie that struck me as a standard pie (aside from the shape) that you could get in any New York pizzeria. Good, as in edible, but not great.  Finished of with a Tiramisu. Now this was good stuff......

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita pizza

lhFbHtqR9hMJo1gSkEIlyQ.text: Close to the convention center with an interesting vibe and interior. Food didn't seem to match the decor. Salads, pizza and sandwiches. It felt like they were trying for more upscale but the food was so-so. We ordered a variety of salads and pizza's. Pizza's are big with thin crust. Our waitress brought us pizzas then salads midway through eating the pizza. She didn't seem to care. My beet salad never arrived. The waitress had an attitude for our entire experience and took no accountability that the salads came after the pizza and that one wasn't delivered but she was willing to bill us for it. More attitude than quality food or service.

0rC1-okDZKn3q9pv7rRU6Q.text: Took my friend and his mother from out of town here to show them some Phoenix night life.. We will not be back.  The bald bartender threw the receipt at us.. And then served us just straight liquor when we ordered cocktails.  I have never been served by someone who just simply didn't want to be there and serve customers. Then find a new place to work man.

l_tqOSzg8CglzxUGW-mNoQ.text: Went to Hanny's last night. Cool vibes. Had a salad and pizza. It was yummy. Drinks good too.

8T5z8q9dN2jbe8xbYo7gRw.text: It's cool I've been on Friday and Saturday nights and they were both good. The dj was spinning good music, so that helps a lot too!! Love some Hanny's

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZLX-y_wr9uSl7VLKrtTxDw.text: Came here at the end of a night out with my best friend.  We shared the symphony chocolate cake and some drinks.  The cake was delicious! Can't wait to come back for dinner.  The food looked amazing and the service was top-notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Symphony chocolate cake

qdPboRrZ3AbM7omHc35zmg.text: This is my happy place!   Flutes after flutes of French 75 is a must while gorging on a Snack Plate, Prosciutto Solo or Prosciutto di Parma pizza. The cocktail menu is intense and is a pretty solid jump-starter to an interesting night.    Anyone venturing downtown Phoenix sober or inebriated must check this place out. Lounge-y ambiance, no screaming drunk kids (no, I'm not talking about toddlers), hip music, quirky interior, great staff. Really a great place to kick it on a Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday, Monday, Tuesday or a Wednesday night. Oh, wait...

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prosciutto plate + french 75

b2F5GnKMK2ujebXgZy8Z2g.text: The martinis are awesome, the pistachio slaw is AMAZING! and the whole place is full of quirks. Professional service, reasonable prices, and they are right downtown.

9PJYTT5LRiCQ7lxJeWWCtg.text: First time visiting Hanny's Friday Dec 12.  The Venue: Interesting place. Upon walking into the entry the entire bar/restaurant seemed to look up at you.. it was a little awkward while waiting to be seated lol..  The decor was minimal and contemporary.. with the vibe and hints of AZ88 carried over. The elevator was unique.. and the bathrooms were oddly placed upstairs. This place has A LOT of potential. It needs a crowd and some color. It just didn't feel alive like AZ88 does.   The Food: The menu was minimal and easy to read. There was an assortment of appetizers, sandwiches , pizza, salads etc... My friend and I shared a sandwich and pizza.. food was good and reasonably priced.   The Service: Good friendly service. Helpful with recommendations. Fast arrival of food and plenty of refills on water.   Overall, I liked the place and would recommend it!

dDFw-PlOsTqg70j9UtQVVQ.text: You just can't help loving Hanny's.  Great bar, great food, great service, great ambiance.  Highly recommend the Roast Beef Sandwich WITH the egg, bar plate, and the Pimm's Cup.  I am now having a craving!

DEolYKnuPgfic9s3OrAfaQ.text: This place is exactly how everybody described it....casual menu, good food, excellent drinks and a fun vibe with a DJ upstairs.  I was impressed with the service.  We had two great drinks, a sandwich and a pizza..everything was perfect.  The four stars is for the limited menu.

uKs9dHUhyUQ2-QmFC-SQ3Q.text: Love AZ88 and I wish I liked this place more.  Food is okay, space is nice, but is too airy, and the vibe is just not there.  And the mini martinis for $13???  I hope they can find a way to turn this place around.  I'm reviewing this place about 6-months later, so there's a chance this could have already turned around.  But based on two earlier experiences, it just didn't fit the bill.

AAJbIVz8Z5d_cSiPGrIO4Q.text: This restaurant/bar was a bit confusing when we walked in, but ended up as a great experience.  Once we understood the story behind the bar it made great sense....Hanny's was a department store in downtown Phoenix.  The owners of AZ 88 bought the failing store and redesigned it as a posh restaurant/bar/lounge.  The decor was very simple, but worked with the flow of the classic store magnificently.  Also, the food was unexpectedly very good - try the BLT.

2Q9HZdV6YtYqEQ-ozzgLPA.text: Cold.  Bad music (think cheesy nightclub music aimed at the non-hip aging segment of the population). Not a good selection of food.  Not a good selection of wine by the glass.  Overall, I would say this place has an identity crisis going on.  It has great potential, and the owners have obviously sunk some major bucks into the design.  However, it is lacking that certain something something.  Lots of room for improvement.  I wil check back in a few months.

Ogmgj7w5F40lnffKZdyK6Q.text: So we thought that this place would be fun and frolicky on a Light Rail opening kind of night. It was cold and boring. The martini's are stupid small and completely useless, the food was okay but not really worth a second visit. On a good note, the seating is fun, the couches recline.

HvuAkXKxxZaDDe95xShetg.text: I found the place to be really unique and really something new for downtown, there is nothing else downtown that has the feel of Hanny's, it's really a great place. You have to check it out for all the interesting features like the elevator shaft, which everyone got a kick out of as they walked by, to the bathrooms that have a little confused about how to actually get into one of them. It seems they have improved their menu as the Pork Calabrease (or something along those lines) came with onion string side and two slices of cantaloupe and tomatoes halves. My girlfriend got the Bruschetta and we both found our meals to taste great, we both agreed we would go back just for the food alone. I also had a Russin Mule cocktail which was excellent. The music was also great, had a very "big city" sound to it...maybe something you'd hear in San Francisco or the like. A couple of down sides were that the place seems to have a bit of a identity crisis. It's set up as a restaurant, but really there isn't that much food on the menu. It would make a great lounge with the music they have, but there aren't enough lounging seating areas...it's all dining height tables and chairs. The lighting was also too bright, more restaurant then lounge and sort of kills the mood.

hSPARPjiNIlfvnweNCn8bQ.text: Yeah, we caught them at a busy time, but server was over-compensating (with attitude) for lack of competence.  Food was okay, a bit greasy for such a hipster place.   Maybe other servers are less desperate, more efficient.  We came to spend money and have a good  time; they seemed put out because their place of business was crowded.

AMu-1c3J-QnmE7KqAdMf5g.text: Just go!! This restaurant is super chic, fabulous cocktails, and they slice your prosciutto at the bar right in front of you, very fresh, very good. (They had me at meat and chesse platter.) Unfortunately, this place either has not "caught on" or no one knows about it. I was there on a first Friday and it was not very busy. Everyone I have brought loves it and I think you will too. See ya there. :)

PFP0SMZ54PVdEuCKhn2K3Q.text: A million stars to Hanny's! This is the best bar in downtown Phoenix. The music is great, the drinks specials are amazing. I was feeling kinda hungry so I ordered a pizza and it was delicious. Upscale, classy, very 1940s, like I said in my first review, Hanny's is a gem in downtown Phoenix.

3lQKJwf5YDrf1LDxKt_l1Q.text: Hanny's is hands down my favorite place to frequent in downtown Phoenix. I was out late after a concert at the Crescent Ballroom and my friend and I needed some nosh! Everything in the area was closed except HANNY'S! The kitchen cooks until 1am every night, the bar pours till 1:30am. The ambiance of Hanny's is great, a old department store from the 40's-50's renovated into is new found glory today. Multi leveled with twisting stairs, a interesting bathroom area and a great elevator shaft that you can walk over!!! The interior is very sleek and refined, but very comfortable. The bar is beautiful, they have great drinks, even a Moscow Mule that comes in a real copper mug! The have great martini prices, only $5. The food selection is great, amazing salads, appetizers, pizza's &  sandwich's. I had the proscutto pizza with arugula. It was delicous. My friend had the beet salad with onion straws app. Also very good. The server we had was very attentive, professional and knew what he was doing. A wonderful experience and a grat place for a date or night out with friends!!!

dco8o1xBVxmutaD_mlZMHg.text: My first visit to Hanny's was for a late dinner on a Saturday night. The martini's were amazing and the food was awesome, but I can only give it 2 stars because the service was horrible. It took forever just to get the watier to our table the first time, then he forgot about us after our drink order and I had to track him down so we could order dinner.  Food was great, service sucked.

0dZy-zsvwvCz4J19TGxnWQ.text: I really enjoy this place. I have been here twice and it has great music, tasty drinks/wine, yummy pizza, cool atmosphere and interesting bathrooms. I like it a lot and look forward to another date night with my hubbie at Hanny's.

PdTOga4AGe62gQytwaGppA.text: The short and simple is this: I love the food, I hate the ambiance. There something so dark and creepy about this place, almost like a building where someone's been murdered or something. I'm overcome by this awful feeling every time I enter the building and I don't think its just because its an insufferable hipster hangout. The building is a renovated department store that has several of the vestiges of its former iteration, like an old glass bottomed elevator shaft, brand name signs, etc. In theory I love places like this that honer the building's history, but this place just gets under my skin in a bad way. Like I stated up front, the food is great. They have a wonderfully creative menu and fantastic salads (Garden chopped is amazing). They also have an array of really unique cocktails. And even if you don't actually come here for dinner, its worth exploring the upstairs bathrooms which are renovated 'changing rooms.' Just don't expect it to be the most relaxing, enjoyable dinner; at least I've never found it to be.

53CIoIEDcWBnhIPdUC1onA.text: I'll update to 4 stars. I have been back several times, and it's a very good location if you meeting up with a group of people. Variety of drinks, reasonable prices. They have a sampler plate for $4, comes with nuts, cheese, meat, and bread. Very nice little snack! The pizzas are thin, but good & filling.

qHUf1kn4DgATm4KECz_3Og.text: A big group of my friends and I ended up at Hanny's as our final destination for our light rail pub crawl.  Needless to say we were a little intoxicated. Our server Doug took excellent care of us and was also very patient with out drunken demands.  Love the atmosphere and the staff. Thanks Doug!

RkM4TyZF7-5Viu9mF78M6w.text: A friend and I stopped in to Hanny's for lunch and have vowed to return.  The menu is brief but it seems like most of the items have a lot of thought put into them and the quality seems very high.  I ordered a personal pizza, a white version with prosciutto, fontina cheese and thinly sliced apple.  The tartness of the apple was perfect foil to the saltiness of the ham and the lush cheese.  Friend got the porchetta sandwich, pork loin with cheese, olives, onions on a really toothsome artisan bread.  Delicious... I'll get one of those when we go back.  We also enjoyed the long leather sofas with reclining back, and the classical music.   Nice to know that downtown has such an appealing alternative for lunch!

rbvNyRk3SYe6gjTW2UKSEw.text: Hanny's is a pretty cool spot to grab a late-night snack and cocktail.  More of an intimate restaurant vibe than a drinking spot like I was originally expecting, but for a calm night it's a sure bet.  Definitely check out the elevator shaft you can stand in, as well as the bathrooms that kind of make you feel more like you're at a carnival than a classy establishment... but I mean that in a good way.

KNqqtFDAyHcx0KqiTPCF-Q.text: I loved this place! We went for my birthday, with 25 people & the service was excellent! Our drinks never went empty & our server was great. The portions are pretty big so the prices are reasonable. I got the standard BLT & loved the bacon they put on it. The martinis are small but powerful! I would reccomend this place to everyone!!

dW-TWdCSzwBomDbzGyXSWA.text: Went there pre-Suns game last night to check it out. It is definitely a nice place to go before a game for some cocktails. The classic martini is only 5 bucks! Unfortunately, the service was very poor.  We ordered a bruschetta appetizer and two meals.   The meals came and the waitress came over to apologize that she forgot to put in the appetizer. She ended up bringing it when we were 2/3 done with our meal...so, obviously not craving or hungry for it.  Regardless, she still charged us despite admitting to her mistake.  This was annoying and our tip adjusted for this poor decision.  The food was ok- nothing special. I ordered the roast beef sandwich and it was quite bland.  I think I would have rather eaten a burger at hard rock before the game, but the drinks were good.

nVVeiPeb-uXV-1ERtIt3_w.text: Walking through downtown Phoenix, my friend and I walked upon what appeared to be an "OG" of Phoenix buildings.  From a distance the building alone  looked circa 1940's and proudly displayed "Hanny's".  I learned the building was originally a department store.  Valley residents flocked to the building for the newest and greatest of the days fashion.  The era of Hanny's Department store lasted over 30 years.  As I walked closer, large windows displayed the restaurants open floor plan and bar centrally located inside.  The windows were much like a department store displaying and advertising everything inside. As I walked into the restaurant the sound of catchy beats could be hearing prominently inside.  The restaurant decor is very inviting as you enter.  A primarily grey or chrome color dominates the inside with mirrors strategically placed around the walls. Its too bad the reputation as a premiere department store didn't follow as a restaurant.  As the decor felt welcoming the service and attentiveness lacked in substance, speed and quality.  My friend and I walked in a admired the set up, then realized where is the host?  I saw a booth commonly associated with what a host or hostess would stand behind and welcome you, but that post had been deserted.  I saw no "please wait to be seated" or "seat yourself" signs displayed.  I'm not sure how long we stood there but it was long enough for me to begin to feel awkwardly out of place.  We were greeted by, well I don't know if I'd say greeted.  Rather we were hurried to a dirty table by the employee.  Realizing the table was dirty the man apologized and disappeared.  My friend and I stood between several tables with people at them looking at us looking at them.  With the combination of people talking, music playing I wasn't sure if we were suppose to follow the employee or if he was coming back... Having all the patrons eyes staring at me I chose to move and follow the waiter, all be it 30 yards behind his speed walk. As we meandered through people eating and drinking the waiter walked back, cleaned off another table and sat us with menu's.  I literally looked at my watch to keep track of the time.   I peered over the menu which on one side displayed food and on the other displayed drinks.  I wanted a drink unique to the restaurant.  I chose the "Moscow Mule".   A concoction of vodka, ginger beer and sliced cucumbers sounded new and refreshing.   After sitting for about 10 minutes our waitress asked us for our drink selection.  No introduction, no greeting, just what do you want? The menu is limited but had my favorites, pizza, salads and sandwiches.  After plenty of time to look at the menu several times I decided on the Americano Pizza.  A simple combo of italian sausage, grilled mushrooms, onions, three cheese blend and tomato sauce.  After a couple bathroom trips our food arrived prior to the drinks we had ordered twenty minutes earlier. The pizza had a light thin crust with toppings evenly distributed.  The pizza was good and appropriately priced at $13.00.  I do prefer chunks of sausage rather then ground up sausage, but it did the trick for me. My drink that took 20 minutes to make was placed in a small old miners style tin cup.  Not sure how the cup fit the atmosphere or how it made the drink better, but I feel it was overpriced for the amount of liquid I received. In all I think Hanny's attracts the out of towner's staying in a hotel in the area or first time visitors like me.  Based on the sub-par service I received and no effort to show their gratitude for my business I won't be going back.

o3CjYuZa185qaQaWSY85kA.text: Had a very nice New years eve dinner here. We shared 3 pizzas and a bar plate (4 of us). The food was very delicious. The ingredients were fresh and real flavorful. The drinks pretty good and the service excellent. We had a great server named Renee and he was awsome. The place itself is pretty cool but trying to figure out the bathrooms made me a tad uncomfortable. When i got to go I don't want to be put thru a test...just mark the doors and be done. Great spot for a light dinner ,nosh and drinks

Zo9CaiugOzJgZNwE3sr44g.text: Being pretty much unknowledgable about the whole downtown scene, I figured I would check it out. Thanks to Yelp, Hanny's came to mind - so naturally I thought I would check it out. Walking in, I could already see, that thursday are far from their busiest night. Still the wait to be seated seemed to take about 10 mintues before someone even acknowledged my girl and I. But having the time to look at the place, I was somewhat impressed by their modern approach. Looking over their menu I saw it rather limited but roast beef caught my eye, while my gf got the pork seared special.  She had some sort of martini while I stuck with the Stella. I was surprised how small their martini glasses were, especially for the price. But trying to make a night out of this, I wasn't trying to complain.  The roast beef was rather tasteless and greesy and was regretful ordering it, I was rather jealous that my other half had a more enticing meal. But I still am attracted to Hanny's, maybe its the old school beats the DJ's were putting down, or the reclining seats or maybe the maze-like bathroom, or just how happy it made my girl to actually have a night out like this. But i give this place 4 stars not for the service or food, but more for the atmosphere... (and sick beats)

0tguTx0I20-C8lKIYNlElg.text: i gotta tell you i love hannys. if you don't know the story Hanny's used to be a department store about 50 years ago. the city considered the painted sign on the building to be a city land mark so they decided to just keep the name AND all the pierre cardin signs on the wall!  it's gorgeous. from the mirror bottomed elevator shaft to the  stream lined bathrooms, this place is an architectural beauty. and the foods not to bad either. :)  i HIGHLY recommend their pizzas. if you're by yourself they are good as a meal or with someone as an appetizer.  you see the crust is so thin and flakey you don't feel like a total porker if you eat the whole thing.  try the prosciutto but sub basil for the arugula.  my only complaint is the  mar-TINIS  and i mean teeni tiny.  freaking 9 bucks for 5 ounces of vodka? blllllooooowww me.

jEua8fw9QWCqpnzEYkAbXg.text: Part of this high review is just having a wonderful place to walk to in downtown Phoenix - finally - but part of it is also that it genuinely is good.  The pizzas are excellent, the atmosphere fun, the elevator shaft astonishing, and the fact that there's a cool lounge starting the redevelopment of downtown Phoenix - walking distance to the Dodge Theater, stadiums, and light rail - earns it a star just by itself.

4LhFSuZVt0B4-wJZNg6COg.text: Hanny's is my new favorite restaurant/bar in Arizona.    Why it doesn't get five stars across the board is beyond me.   Great ambience, superbly designed, great pizzas, well made drinks, friendly bar-staff, open late, unique cocktail choices, and it's not that expensive!   I wish they had some better appetizers, but that will not stop me from dropping five stars on this place.    Pimm's Cup! Yes.

TeB-uewKk3zOHspGjL1u0g.text: We went to dinner there on a Sunday and we were the only ones in there for most of our dinner. Downtown Phoenix can be somewhat quiet on the weekends, so this was no surprise. The service was great as was the food. I had a pizza and if you like thin, crispy crust you will enjoy the pizza as well. The music was a little loud for a Sunday dinner, especially since we were pretty much the only ones in the restaurant. I will go again, probably during the week so I can get a taste of what it is like when it is busy!! Overall...decent meal!

gYhIRq2kPid3iVdTkITFbQ.text: I find it fitting that right after I reviewed the Roosevelt, I review Hanny's. Hanny's is a spacious and modern space in downtown Phoenix which used to house one of Phoenix's first department stores. The first time we came in here was because The Roosevelt has stopped serving food (a whopping two hours before they were scheduled to stop serving food) and one of their waitresses suggested we mosey on over to Hanny's instead. While the vibe is a little too corporate/ Euro-centric modern chic for me, they do have a great bar and they also have one of my favorite sandwiches in town: their prime rib sandwich with apple-wood smoked bacon, arugula, aioli, and fried egg served with crispy onion straws was delicious, but unfortunately, a little inconsistent. The meat seems to be at its best the earlier you come, but if you walk in around midnight, it can be just a little too dry. 3.5 stars rounded to 4 because of good service, nice big space, and late kitchen hours (rare for downtown).

L6SAHGiZKVVnUHMlCdOmTA.text: The problem with this place is that they hyped it as "THE OWNERS OF AZ88...."  yadda yadda yadda.  Well, if you're going to reference AZ88, they you better have great drinks and (at least) good bar food.   This place has neither.   The drinks are TINY.  The food is average at best.  And the "design" of the place is very boring...and BEIGE.  This space could of been a total knockout, but it misses the mark on so many levels.  The service was ok, the bartenders were HORRIBLE.  As many people have said before.."I WANT to like this place"....but I just can't get myself to do it.

GtEjVu31A3eM46A8VkLYIw.text: I really wanted to come here. Finally, after months of trying to get my husband we came here last Saturday. We got there about midnight but the place serves food till 1 which was awesome since we were at Castles and Coasters with friends and were totally starving. The food, I had the chopped salad, was amazing. It came all separate on the plate and I was really worried that there was no way I could get the salad all mixed up on the plate, but it worked out great and the salad was so so good! My husband and our friends also had some pretty great meals. The decor is just super cool, there is tons of mirrors in the hallways upstairs on your way to the bathroom. It is a great place and I really wish it was busier!!! We will be back because it was so well worth it.

bbwYhvY6VpY8HPtfFT4qVw.text: Hanny's is an amazing interior! It looks very "Oh-I'm-in-LA-or-New-York" inside. However, our dinner did not match up to the tasteful decor of the restaurant, in fact, taste was the problem! Who called the pizza a giant saltine? It's True! Worse, all the ingredients were dumped indifferently onto the top, and the flavors were obscured by each other! Our pizza tasted like an arugula salad slathered in Chef Boy-ar-dee tomato sauce. The drinks were a nice source of amusement. We didn't order alcohol, but when we requested refills, the waiter looked mortified and said "I can only give you ONE!" This place has the potential to be the "go-to" of downtown Phoenix, but they've got to tune up the menu, or they are going to be a big empty men's store once again!

qzrR-SjNKJqOTPVeFQI5lg.text: khittie has changed her tune about hanny's. khittie likes hanny's now. their drinks are yummy. they make an almost perfect cosmo. their onion strings are awesome. meow! go there.

uZuvKlOW7c3O1QO7LJ6nCw.text: I went the night after Christmas, a Friday.  I was suprised to find it so dead.  It's a large place with lots of seating, but there were probably only 10-15 tables taken with a few people at the bar.  The decor and atmosphere is great as is the live DJ.  Drinks are pricey for being so small.  My friend's martini was more like a shot.  We had lots of different things to eat: pizzas, salad, onion strings, and the pork sandwich.  It was all good, not great but definitely good.  We all agreed that the pizza was the best thing we had.  Prices were ok, not too expensive but just on the verge for what you got for it.    I will definitely go again.  It's a great place to go with friends and just hang for a bit.

k7h1cdmxTYsr8S9oJ4Uy_Q.text: and hire some experience staff and a new : ) friendly manager.

f5NJD79z3dg0KAFgSLhIVw.text: My girls and I were going to see a friend in the "Vibrator Play", which I highly recommend if your into plays. We chose Hanny's because we heard it had a cool vibe and it was close to the Herberger Theater. It's an old department store, and I gotta tell you someone needs to work on the window selling because from the outside it didn't grab me. The windows actually needed to be cleaned. From the inside, the music was the best part of the place. The decor and ambiance was stark, modern, steely grey. Our eyes were drawn to the only color in the place which were the exit signs. The crowd was mixed, older and refined earlier in the night, young or young at heart) and hip later. The prosciutto is cut right in the middle of the bar, which was kind of cool to look at. We ordered the bar plate which was perfect. Prosciutto, olives, cantaloupe, bread, parm cheese. We also ordered the Parma Pizza-delicious! I could have folded the thin crust pizza up and shoved the whole thing in my mouth, that's how good it was. But, I shared. We then had a beet and arugula salad which was very lemony and tasty. Because lemon makes everything taste better. I had two glasses of syrah which were nice. My friends ordered dirty martinis which came full to the brim, dirty on the side. They had to take big gulps in order to put the dirty in-oh well. They thought they ordered the five dollar martinis but ended up being ten dollars, so read the fine print. I'd go there again, but not my fave. PS, bathrooms are unique!

M7D2FdZ7ptYyMf9pQXUbLg.text: Let me say this: the bar at Hanny's is one of the best looking bars in Phoenix. This square-shaped sparkly thing gets an A+ on the presentation, and they make some great cocktails. The rest of the place... not so much. I agree with everyone else: Hanny's has a great concept for a place. They left the skeleton of an old department store intact -- complete with a completely unusable second story -- but the results aren't spectacular. The restaurant looks great inside, like it should be a real classy establishment. So why are they serving pizzas here? The pies are decent, yeah, but really? Shouldn't we be getting steak here? Prime rib? A nice grouper fillet perhaps? With such a nice space and a primo location right in the heart of downtown, I'd think Hanny's could step it up in the food department. It's like this place is confused about who it wants to be: a neighborhood fare spot or a classy dining destination.

mVZJEnjoYvxz2-SlXbX-WA.text: Very dissapointing. I went there last night with 3 friends. I waited for 15 minutes without anyone seating us and then we waited another 15 minutes at a table without anyone coming up to us, even to give us menus. We left. I really hope this place gets their act together. I live downtown and I want it to do well.

KofvnPAa2t7xWL_LDHElVw.text: Think "Sex and and the City" meets "Swingers" and you'll get an idea of the vibe at Hanny's.  Now, we went at lunch, so we didn't get the full-on experience that undoubtedly takes place after the sun sets.  The big, old men's store space (the names of a couple of my favorite suit makers still hang on the walls) is kinda cool.  The menu was casual for lunch with a good number of pizzas and sandwiches.  The salads sounded kind of plain.  (Side note: how does anyone in downtown PHX compete with Bianco for pizza??)  I ordered the cabage starter salad, which was really quite good.  My panini sandwich was fine, but nothing special.  It annoyed me that they didn't have fountain sodas available, so everytime I wanted a Diet Coke they had to bring me one of these teeny 10 oz. bottles and charge me a couple bucks each for the privilege.  The server was enthusiastic and friendly, but clearly not a trained professional.  Hanny's was fine, and probably what passes for hip in downtown Phoenix.

tgpEWyVY1oEfQieGQgBe3g.text: Reminds me of a place back when I was cool AS.  Today In midlife - "meh" Seems like a lobby bar at a midscale Hyatt.  No TV's ,David Lynchian music   Cant decide on self hate or regrouping at the the Kettle Black across the street.  Opted easily fir KB.

z_jTE3b04CCBR-Vh-u9EEA.text: AWESOME!!  We were looking for a late night dinner and luckily, this place was right across the street from our hotel. We walked by and peeked inside. Everyone was dressed nice. We decided to go in anyway and see if I could get some food to go. A manager spotted us and said hi. I thought he was going to kick us out for looking like scrubs, but instead he escorted us to some tables. He seated us at a table with a little "occupied" sign and took the sign away. Sweet concept. I felt like a VIP even though I was in sweats at a posh lounge. It was as if, the lounge was whispering to me "we were expecting you, Mr. Elite Yelper".   We ended up ordering the roast beef sandwich and a prosciutto/apple pizza. Both entrees were freakin' awesome. The sandwich had tender slices of roast beef, thick slices of smoked bacon, and a fried egg, blanketed in a soft ciabatta roll. It had a side of onion strings and some sort of phenomenal slaw. The pizza was fantastic as well. It was a white pizza, with Fontina cheese, thin slices of prosciutto, and apples. Odd combination, but it worked really well together.   The thing I like about this place is the character. The building use to be an old department store, but they managed to convert it to a lounge. The crowd here is very trendy/hipster. They had a DJ spinning some techno/hip-hop and some really trippy (but classy) decor. I like the gutted elevator shaft and the high ceilings. What kind of grossed me out is the fitting room, converted bathrooms. They're uni-sexed, but pretty disgusting. Just think about what it's like to take a dump in a fitting room with no ventilation. Yup, it's exactly what you are probably imagining.   Overall, I really liked this place. The kitchen is open pretty late, the food is excellent, there's no cover, and the food/drink prices are reasonable. The wife and I dropped about 50 bucks post tip/tax on roast beef sandwich, pizza, and two cocktails. This a great place to to start your night, but I would recommend using the restrooms at your next stop. I would definitely come back again.   A little about my credentials: I first got into cooking & food when I was in college. After being rejected by numerous girls and getting zero action, I decided it was time for a change. I needed a new makeover to boost my geeky image. I applied for a cooking position at a Mediterranean-Italian Restaurant near my home and learned to cook all sorts of pastas and dishes. I never became a professional chef, but 9 years later and 55 lbs heavier, I continue to enjoy & love food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prosciutto &amp; Apples? who knew!
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome Steak Sandwich!

W9Fy4PCkLRfuQTlf7HobmA.text: I was here this previous weekend and had such a blast! The food is awesome, the staff is dressed to the T and extremely friendly and the dirty martinis (they have awesome blue cheese stuffed olives) are wonderful. Such a great ambiance especially on a Saturday night and awesome for bar hopping because of all the places nearby. Must try!! I'll be back again, that's for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Celebratory drinks!

e7rj9-flNxZB-HVMv9EJ7g.text: Strange that so many people dislike Hanny's so much? I have been here a handful of times each time with a large group (10+) and they have always been incredibly accommodating, the food is good, reasonably priced, portioned, and of good quality, the drinks are strong, and the servers are very attentive. Aside from the general fare, the space is really cool with lots of nooks to explore. The basement is a trip and the bathrooms are a little confusing; I walked in on someone once (oops).  I'm out of the area for a while, but if/when I am back, I will definitely go to Hanny's.

XqH_GWoYqCHbXNdXbr6fxg.text: In town for a concert and this was one of the few things open. Food and drink were both great, our server was nice.... but overall, totally not impressed. The loud music was not impressive to me or my friend, and we spent a lot of time waiting for a table (this was one of the only places open at this hour, so while I don't blame the establishment, it seemed like we were forgotten for a bit). For the price, wasn't wow-ed.   That elevator shaft is pretty cool, though.

wnk1YEfpyaw_Bk26I2TwTg.text: Perfect spot for pre concert/theater food and drink. Great vibe in this former department store space. Had cocktails a wonderful cauliflower appetizer and a super thin crust pizza. I will be back!!  Get some !!

I8YeHAuW87TQJhExCj63Ug.text: Absolutely beautiful swanky bar, with a very classy but laid back vibe.  It was a department store, beautifully restored.  Delicious drinks, great food, great atmosphere, lovely service every time, and generally a relaxed vibe (not at all snooty) .  This is one of my favorite bars ever.  Try a Moscow Mule (they have the copper mugs), or any of their other sophisticated cocktails.  The Asparagus with Egg is outstanding, but the margherita pizza is also tasty, is you're not feeling adventurous.  PS The building has had a colorful history (check out the History link on their website).

NPwhs3P-PxSjiNLT3wYyeg.text: Here's the skinny on Hanny's -   Ambience: It's a darker food-serving lounge that has tons of seating without rubbing elbows with the party next to you... most recently we came here the night before Thanksgiving and were able to comfortably talk and laugh without the place feeling too intimate. They spin some great tunes (look for the deejay booth above the main entrance). The upstairs bathrooms and downstairs are an awesome sight you need to check out firsthand.  Food: All the light bites we've had - pizzas, prosciutto-wrapped prawns, salads - are pretty great and reasonably priced. I consider this less of a dinner place and more a "let's order food so we're not just drinking our meal" place.  Drink: They have a respectable beer and wine selection and make a solid martini. Check out some of the great happy hour deals on cocktails.  tl;dr - comfortable and hip lounge with solid drinks and light bites.  ~  Disclosure: I'm a former Yelp employee.

fFe5a8ulinX8RIbvX0Iz-Q.text: The male bartender was rude and ignored us, (mind you we were 3 girls together and only like 2 couples were at the bar). The lady the seemed to be a manager pointed us out and told him to help us. He then grunted and rudely approached us by just staring not even welcoming or saying hi what may I get for you. He just looked at us waiting for us to tell him what we'd like. Uh, rude! After our round, we got our table. We ordered 4 rounds of drinks each and dinner entrees, so you know our tan was up there. Food was great, our server was this petite gift with glasses (sorry I forgot her name), she was very attentive and nice. Our first time here would have been superb if the first impression wasn't based off this grumpy bartender. Some people should not work at restaurants, it's not for everyone.

RNwtTRH8z3Mu1cn23HTg5g.text: I've been coming to Hannys since it's opening, especially when I lived downtown.   I do have to say though that I was really disappointed with the service last night.  The bartender seemed more interested with liquor inventory tasks than serving customers.  She had a look on her face like Sarah Huckabee Sanders during a press briefing.  She got my martini wrong and instead of pouring me another, she just tried to fix the drink, and gave it back to me. I always had to ask for service, and her poor personality didnt help either,  a shame because I really do like the vibe and style.  You would expect more from an upscale bar/restaurant.  I think the reason why customer service is not important is that Hannys is comfortable with constant regular out of town first time customers, from either neighboring hotels, or feeding off the business crowd for lunches, or trendy places to bring clients.  That being said, not your neighborhood bar, it would be nice to have staff who can complement the cool surroundings.  I give 3 stars for food and surroundings only, management needs to attract bartenders who can match the style, not beer slingers from a sports bar.

QUKsZjMQdron3biLe_fizw.text: Dark...kind of creepy  I am not sure what thy want to be...a bar? restaurant? creep museum?   The food was very bland....sounds so good when you read it. Not so much when it is in your mouth.   So many other choices downtown.

XsQoL5fGnKUcrhGj5h45iw.text: Stopped in for some late dinner with four friends and It was a bad experience from the gate. First the person who sat us puts us in one of their small tables. One of my friends is a linebacker and took most of the table up himself, so we ask for a booth so that we are comfortable during our dinner. The waiter moves us but only after rolling his eyes and giving us the silent treatment. W t f?  Then we order our food and I ask if they can make the blt I planned to eat without bread just lettuce, you know like a bun less sandwhich/burger. The waiter says they cannot do it. So I ask for extra lettuce on my blt so that i can do it myself. Nope. No extra lettuce when it came out. Another friend of mine asked for ketchup for their string onions, never came out.  I've been to Hannys in the past and never dealt with such elitist attitudes from the staff. Needless to say I won't be back, too bad because when they had djs it was a chill spot to sip drinks at, but it isn't the only one!

lUuBcNbzerUIleFaJy_J2g.text: Dark and moody restaurant with lounge-y vibe. The music and bass were almost overwhelming but it's a great place to go when you are one or two drinks in and want food and drinks with friends.   Drinks were pretty good (the peach bellini tasted like canned peach juice with champagne, which made me sad) and the pizzas and salads were great. Pizza is thin with a crispy crackly crust. Be sure to read the menu carefully because the bianco pizza comes with red chili flakes which made it almost inedibly spicy for me. Turns out menu reading after two drinks is a little harder.

0SpgIfKOXoUZP_vSCdD8CA.text: Americano pizza gets the job done on a late Tuesday evening. I LOVE living in downtown Phoenix !!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Americano in downtiwn Phoenix,  on a Tuesday evening gets the job done...DELICIOUS !!

BE62qqxvP1NCEeqqWanouw.text: Oh man.. this establishment is the bomb diggity! Dirty Martinis for $5, and other amazing cocktails, awesome, awesome prosciutto, bomb food, great music (with dj) on the weekends.. love! Our go to place for several years before concerts and events.

RJ9UdJsEPTC5A4yiGpUV9Q.text: A big city feel. Wide open look with a lot of glass. High ceilings with a good use of mirrors.  Came with a group of six and was greeted quickly and given a choice of settings. The waitress was fantastic, patient and professional.  The menu seems small in comparison to other Italian food restaurants. I liked it though, they do what they know very well. The thin crusty pizzas were all uniquely different and delicious. There was one sandwich ordered and is looked well put together. They have daily specials that are different and off the menu.  Things to see when you stretch your legs, the elevator shaft, the bathrooms up stairs and the basement downstairs on the way out...creepy cool. This used to be a men's clothing store turned restaurant, good job. Oh, the dude shack'n the drinks... nice martini, perfect.  Last words... relax, enjoy and savor the moment.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Simple.

_sMtCUfa_mOvl3X5K9gn-w.text: I was in Phoenix 2 years ago for a conference and happened upon Hanny's. I have been dreaming about it ever since.  I was back in town this past weekend and the food was just as good as I remember. The prosciutto Di Parma pizza is AMAZING!  Grilled cauliflower and chopped salad!  Enough for 3 people to share.

AQjaZ3ewHRHQp-mZnq3MWA.text: A very cool space. Good cocktails. I had a Manhattan that was good. Waiter was attentive. My pizza was just so-so. Not much flavor for a pizza that was supposed to have goat cheese, black pepper and pepper flakes. I had asked him to leave the black pepper off and he said they couldn't do that because it was an already blended cheese mixture. Never heard of that. Would I go back. No. There too many places making pizza my way with no cheese slurry.

qddVQyKFmZzsWszpGEPqRw.text: So, upon entering----a cool, hip vibe.... I'd read reviews that said the pizza was good---- so, that's what ordered, along with an iced tea.....would've rather had an ice cold beer--- but, cannot as I have to work soon.  So: here's the skinny--- the pizza was delicious( had the carne @ $13-) the iced tea, $2.25 was in a skinny small glass---and only includes 1 refill. The waitress was not friendly, nor nice---& seemed irritated  or disinterested.

EO2fsnpuW9kMCPKcgRQLJw.text: Food was good. Service was so so, efficient, but server didn't have much of a personality. Ordered two items and I was surprised they charged $2 to split the BLT plate that we didn't ask to split.  Overall the quality of the food is good,  ambiance is trendy, but service could stand to improve.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar plate was great.

01RGRJhUo-J-lZ42-ehAuw.text: Love Hanny`s. Weird quirky place (check out the creepy dolls downstairs) but good food, good cocktails, and good service. Plus it`s reasonably priced and open late.

dRdbWVueGRZY5DTr5uk9uQ.text: It's a nice place, hip, kind of a different vibe. The music is done ny a DJ with good taste and skills. The music is loud, and usually I don't like that but it fits the scene and I got used to it. It has an urban, modern feel. It's cool and a lot less pretentious than Scottsdale. The menu is different, all Italian. The bellini was small but good. The italian steak sandwich was very good, the hanny's steak was nothing to write home about. Service was just ok, no major problems just nothing noteworthy and a bit of apathy. Between ordering a drink and receiving it took a long time. The food was a solid 4, the service a 3, the ambiance a 4.5 (I fake take away half a star for music level).

VuGNGkMw3x0JqpiX5ICb1A.text: Came here for the absinthe, stayed for the atmosphere. So apparently they have a second floor now which has a gigantic unisex bathroom which is beyond beautiful. It's a large, open, white, glossy room with seperate rooms surrounding it, it almost feels like a fun house. The locks show vacant or occupied like in an airplane's bathroom. Beyond this massive open bathroom is a hallway with more fun. LED lit mirrors with narrow couches paralleling them. Quite a fun area you definitely have to explore if you come here.  Anyways to the absinthe! We ordered the Grand Absente Absinthe (138 proof) from France for $11. They properly poured it using the sugar cube and water method which was lovely to see! The staff was also very kind and patient throughout our order and questions. Also, I love that the mixologists wear white lab coats! Gives off the impression that they're scientists. The absinthe was given to us in beautiful crystal goblets and it tasted just as divine, like soft and light licorice gumdrops! If you like lemon drop shots or something similar to those then this is for you, it really tasted like candy. Now we didn't hallucinate,  just had a light buzz as you do with most hard liquors. Will definitely be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The interesting LED lit hallway upstairs past the unisex bathroom.
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our absinthe being beautifully made.
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The gigantic and beautiful LED lit unisex bathroom.

u0t9ZAQfk-8TzKHa70RLsA.text: The ambiance of the restaurant is great! We loved the feel and energy- however the service completely deteriorated the overall perspective of Hanny's. Upon being sat we received the menus, the server came over about 10 minutes later offering to bring us water while we waited for our guests to arrive. We waited an additional 10 minutes to receive water and without hesitation were immediately rushed into "are we ready to order." Unfortunately, that set the tone for the rest of the evening. The most memorable part of the evening was sitting for 20 minutes with an empty water glass. Service as a whole was extraordinarily slow, and completely in-personable. The food was delicious, hence the 2 star rating. Overall, I do not feel any inclination to come back or refer friends and business associates to Hanny's- especially with so many vibrant and fun restaurants in the neighborhood that offer immeasurably better service.

qjMEj-mxvgoRyTdUd6OZiw.text: Love this place! So fun! After an event at The Vanburen we had to, of course have some Hanny's pizza! If you never have, you're missing out! I personally love the margarita pizza. It's a great night spot & the service is always prompt even when it's crazy busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IFzMf-6Tk6nkuQ9A8Vb-IQ.text: Four stars or maybe three   Atmosphere is unique.   The lighting and modern feel is awesome.  The music is awful; it was very stressful and I found I couldn't even relax throughout our entire experience here.     Drinks and food.  Drinks were very good.   Ordered three margaritas very tasty and strong.   Ordered an ice tea and it was very flavorful however it was never refilled.  Food was soooo tasty.   Ordered the shrimp appetizer and it was very very good.  4 pieces for 15.00.  Orders the Marx salad and a carne pizza.   It created smiles all around our table.  Very tasty.    Servers.  Very short attitude not very personable at all.  Asked what he recommended and he said uh well the pizza is good I mean I don't know what do you want to drink beside water.   Seemed like he would rather go back to the bar which is the main attraction and socialize with the rest of the employees.  So many people work here!   So I started this review as a four and it dropped to three stars.   Service is huge!     Up your service and you get 4 stars.   Food and drinks awesome.  Change the creepy music and get a 5 star.  I will not be back.

9b_eaJn8YM2vvJGlbsAeOg.text: Hanny's is most definitely a hit or miss kind of place.  I've been only twice in my 4 years here.  My first time, 3 years ago it was a compete miss.  My second go 'round it was a hit.  On my most recent visit I went with about 11 other people from my meetup group.  We did not have reservations but were able to sit directly next to each other with 2 tables.  It was pretty busy on this Saturday night and the service wasn't the best.  We saw our server 3 times.  Once to take our drink orders, once to take our food orders and once to bring us our checks once we flagged her down.  Again, it was pretty busy but that was my issue the first time I tried Hanny's. It was busy then, but I was a party of one severely neglected.  No difference this time.   I, along with 3 other people sitting at my table ordered the BLT.  Nothing to brag about here .... It's a super regular BLT.  The bacon was cold, hard and old. The sandwich had maybe 4 pieces of bacon on it.  The bread was toasted but cold.  We think the food may have sat back there for a while before our server was able to bring it out to us.  I don't remember what kind of sanwhich everyone else ordered but again, nothing to brag about.  The drinks however were really good.  A few of us went with the Classic Manhattan.  I'm a Manhattan and Old fashioned drinking girl.  It was GOOD!  Hanny's seems like more of a place for drinks with friends before catching a show, party or concert downtown.  That's what we did.  I do not think it's a place to visit just because you're hungry and want something good.  I really don't think it's that kind of place.

WpcUER_X77VXrsQYATvdVg.text: Definitely a spot you have to check out from the architecture to the pizza. P.S. won't spoil any surprises.

hKYYPZWkVVb_GojJYOypng.text: Hanny's downtown - may be one of the cutest trendy places especially reusing building in the downtown district. The restaurant was super clean, and initial entrance everyone was super friendly.   A group of Five of us came in before John Mayer concert - we were lead to The Hanny for the $5 Martini by one of the concert goers in our group  - and it was the best $5 Martini I've ever had.  The price was right. Also tried from the Menu had the Bianco Pizza which was pretty darn delicious perfect amount of spices and heat. Reminder the Pizza is a thin crust - very thin crust.   Service- Service was slow I'm not sure if it was because it was busy for an event downtown or not - but hard to order additional drinks and trying to get our check to leave was a bit challenging.    Will definitely try again just for ambiance and $5 Martini

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best $5 Martini

QfiUTq_7Ra7iT2xM8qNg1Q.text: I just called Hanny's to make a birthday reservation for a party of 25. The manager said they don't take reservations, nor do they rent out their mezzanine on Saturdays!! He said it would be a really long wait, and encouraged us to dine elsewhere. Well Hanny's that was one rather large check your inflexibility cost you!!

hfPh18mZbcyrJSI35o1SAw.text: Stumbled upon this spot on a fri night - it was across our hotel.  Cool atmostphere, dj (josh) played amazing music which is hard to find.  Bartender seemed like he didnt want to be there but dj compensated for the attitude.  Cool place to go.

Lw6l8BYI7CdQOt6GhSrJbA.text: We stopped into Hannys before a concert and having heard rave reviews, was excited to check it out.   I don't know that after my experience I would come back.  Understandably, the place was busy. We waited in line to speak to the host. The two men in front of us clearly put their name on the list and we overheard the host  telling them they could hang out at the bar while they waited.  As soon as we approached the host, he was clearly very overwhelmed. We told him it would be just the two of us. He began to explain their was a concert (we knew) and the place would not clear out until after the concert started and he already had 13 or so people on his list. He didn't offer to take our name or suggest sitting at he bar, he really just seemed to be saying, no, you can't eat here.  It was one of the most awkward and rude situations I've encountered in the service industry. I hope that's not how Hannys operates, but I doubt I will go back to find out.

lse9vgjOlGNxKZ4v3Yg4Wg.text: Went in tonight  (Sat) with 2 other people,  we all ordered food I ordered ADAMS STREET CHOP, with specific instructions NO CHEESE I'M ALLERGIC,  simple instructions one would think, place wasn't too busy plenty of tables still free, it comes LATHERED IN CHEESE  the waiter apologies as says he can replace the meal, trouble now is my guests now have there meal.ALL I NEEDED YOU TO DO WAS BE ATTENTIVE BEFORE YOU BROUGHT THE MEAL OUT, AND CHECKED THE ORDER. What was so difficult with that. ??????????

UuZF9Czpgpk4BBsQlgr8FQ.text: This place was ok. I was pretty hungry and wanted a good and hearty meal. Nothing in the menu seemed to fit that. The food looked like fancy bar food. My friend loves the place and suggested the Honey Hot pizza. It wasn't bad. Pepperoni with red pepper and honey drizzle on a thin crust. I got a bowl of noodles on my walk back to the hotel.

WjOkajTZeKmX_yNwsc2Ulw.text: This place is the bomb! I come here very often and it's always busy (people know a good place when they experience it). The thin crust pizzas are incredible and I always enjoy their martinis. I haven't had one bad thing off the menu, and I have tried a lot, but always come back for that divine margherita pizza. This place is a favorite among my friends and I and we love ending our night here. There's always great music and the staff is efficient and quick most of the time. The host was great this past weekend. We stopped by around 10pm on Saturday and they couldn't accommodate a 9-top so we split into two groups. It was too bad we couldn't sit together but we opted for the split so we could all enjoy the great food and drinks then head out to another bar to dance. Definitely will be back and every time I recommend this place to someone, they become an addict themselves.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I come here all the time and absolutely love this place!

Sg4m5phvNLB57Hs007-KOQ.text: My bf and I came here for dinner and drinks with some friends and it is a beautiful restaurant. The ambiance is great, the music level and lighting are perfect and the overall decor is very elegant. The bathrooms are a bit wild but in a fun way (I won't ruin the surprise for anyone though). The food and drinks were delicious. I highly recommend the prosciutto wrapped shrimp appetizer. The only complaint we all had was about the service. It was very very slow. We not only waited for what we ordered but we waited quite a bit just to order. Also, a side note, they add in the gratuity with no warning so make sure to look at your tab.

gbCjSJnMI8wQgk5rCoQtKw.text: Stiff drinks, good food, great people watching, and wayyyyyy over served!!! I paid for it literally and figuratively.

ACwfbVru7Yb8qq3kRXbl8A.text: The ambience is kind of hipster. Cool if you're looking for a night out. We requested a table and only had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated at 11 PM. When we sat down we waited at least 10 minutes for anyone to come and check on us and decide at that point it was time to leave

0czObY7mn2bskO34DrBCtw.text: This is my 12-year-old's favorite restaurant, Hanny's steak sandwich every time and she doesn't share! When we venture downtown to Phoenix it's where we always eat. The service is always fabulous especially with Russell. Nice variety of choices and everything is always hot and delicious.  Oh I forgot to mention how much fun it is it's so eclectic an old department store from the 1940s to the 1980s with the creepy basement full of old dolls, pink lighted bathrooms, a jeweled mannequin and a glass bottom elevator shaft!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak sandwich
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza half Bianco half giardiniera
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Milanese pork, couldn&#39;t wait
