The place itself is also tons of fun... they have a DJ and the crowd is live! It reminds me of a lounge in New York or Los Angeles.  However, the service is just awful. The bartenders are rude and the waiters aren't pleasant either. Granted, it is unbelievably packed and I'm sure they're up to their neck in orders... but that doesn't excuse impolite behavior.   I would definitely recommend everyone to give this place a chance; if you happen to have friendly service that night, you'll fall in love with Hanny's.

XpoA9u-JQpHt99Y1_jQZrg.text: I have frequented Hanny's over the last 4 years. It used to be my "go to" place, but that has changed dramatically of late.  Hanny's definitely has the interior vive going. It's a very open and eclectic design with some very unusual sculptures and basement "dolls". The old elevator shaft with the glass floor is also very cool.  What frustrates me about this establishment is the service. It's spotty at best with a 50% chance that when you walk in, you will not be greeted and seated in a reasonable amount of time. The wait staff is average and you just never feel like you're too welcome here - and that includes the rather snotty bartenders. I would classify it as a rather "cold" experience.  I'm sorry Hanny's, I have spent a lot of my hard earned $$ here but no more.

hhT8qOMDTO3vCDm1ZKZbeg.text: Delicious food in a great refurbished, downtown building. The servers are always nice. Nice place to stop and have a drink or a meal after work.

0CmgdxLxJBR4mgKdI3rQuQ.text: The most amazing BLT I've ever experienced! I know it may sound over exaggerated but I can't wait to get back again! Great atmosphere with the live DJ...

2f1uEgYqLrhAfr9TQOiuiQ.text: I have been coming to this place since it opened....  It is downtown cool, with a simple, tasty menu, and reasonably priced cocktails...   My favorite meal is to split a pizza and a BLT supremo with a friend.  Also the asparagus with an egg is interesting and good.    When you visit, be sure to stand in the elevator shaft, and use the bathroom, yes the bathrooms are cool!  Cheers,  David

ChM20aioNZy68C7ThUcPMQ.text: Enjoyed a good dinner here with a friend. We are fans of the roast beef sandwich with bacon and egg on top. Had a delicious cocktail. When I asked what one of the ingredients was in the drink, they even brought me a small sample to try first. Chris was our waiter and he was fabulous.  I dream of owning that meat slicer at the bar....

FuY-2lCk9qKOh1qKLCiK4A.text: This place is great. Classy, chill, centrally located and open late. The service was terrific, the pizza margherita was wonderful and the drinks were stiff without being obnoxious. I had the pomegranate julep and the $5 gin martini, both great.  If you're by yourself, you will feel comfortable here. This is so not a meat market. It's not a cafe, but it's also not a skeezy bar.  I did dock one star for the guy who "greeted" me when I walked in. I was by myself, not looking terribly put together, with a backpack and casual clothes. He didn't seem too hyped to seat me and that left a bad taste in my mouth, until the very sweet server (Jeanett, I think) took over. Then it was all good from there. Hanny's, why are you not in the Bay Area?

vIuAWmQKpYMh0cYB1PPwKw.text: I've been to Hanny's several times but only for drinks so I was recently able to actually eat a meal here! My girl and I left an event next door at the Wyndham or Renaissance I think it's now called and since it was around 11PM on a Sunday we wanted to find a decent place nearby that still served food. So Hanny's was close and had people inside that were eating so we walked on in. I love that this place was at one time a department store it gives it a modern and unique flair. My friend and I were seated right away and since I had been drinking wine earlier in the night all I wanted was water and some delicious food!   I was just going to settle on the onion straws but our server insisted on the roast beef sandwich, he said it's what he was having later. So on the menu the sandwich sounds pretty tasty, roast beef, bacon, arugula, and even a fried egg! So when it came out it looked yummy, it even came with a side of the onion straws that I was going to order so I decided to put them on the sammy to add some flavor. I took a bite and...I was kinda bummed...I expected all of these flavors to explode in my mouth but that didn't happen..it was just ok the roast beef was pretty bland but the bacon and onion straws seemed to help it out a bit. My friend had one of their pizza's and she said it was just ok as well.  The service was decent and the place has pretty good drinks so I may stop in again to give something off of their menu another try.

BR5kcZ893lMo4xkrefZMvQ.text: Hmph...  Well the atmosphere is beautiful, a little quirky... And the service was...well...average...  But I did not care for the menu whatsoever.  Very unusual items, but no healthy options actually.  I think I ordered the only healthy item on the menu: a Portobello mushroom sandwich.  It was good.  The Gorgonzola slaw side item was good and unusual.  I would have really liked it, if only it weren't so salty.  :-(  What we noticed was the everything we ordered came with pistachios.  Now, I loves me my pistachios but really?  The appetizer, meal, and dessert?  Really?  The AZ88 restaurant theme seems to be their niche; they should stick with it.

A4XsmTlmt3Yz5anOYkJd-Q.text: What a disappointment this place is!! I wanted my significant other to see about this place as it reminded me of the bars in Manhattan. They stopped serving at 1 o'clock although it says 130 on their menu and online. When we asked why the bartender responded 'talk to the management'. We went to another bar nearby and it was a blast.

7yh5v7ZGBGKwJeqU3rX4bQ.text: Great, gorgeous bar with plenty of room and great service. They're $5 martinis and the upscale atmosphere make Hanny's hard to beat. It's a perfect place to sit back and enjoy drinks with friends. Because of the ample space, it's also a great place for groups.

7IB1x1fHgYwAFaQGDn4Ffw.text: Went here with friend and boy am I glad we chose this place! The decor is awesome. Food is exceptional and the DJ plays great music that is not overpowering. I will definitely back. This place is great for any occasion.

LjWq00bb1eBQhFrlMsALjg.text: The place would be a 5 star if the employees weren't so damn rude, I'd say even racist. Went there for a friend's bday in a group of about 10 and had the worst experience ever. I WOULD NEVER GO BACK AGAIN. They even started cleaning up our area like salt shakers, table decor etc before we even left. They pretty much kicked us out before it was even 1. Does Nit even deserve a 1 star in my opinion

2qbBjQFtcdG2rYut2fsoTg.text: This restaurant is beautiful. It's super open and has great decor. We sat up at the bar to have a couple drinks and some appetizers. Everything was delicious, including some of the bartenders. :] They had a DJ up in the booth upstairs playing some music but it wasn't anything overwhelming. The restrooms are interesting. I was lost the first time I tried to use them but figured it out and ended up helping others who were just as lost. Drinks are kind of expensive, but pretty strong. There is a $7 lot behind the restaurant or you can just meter it. I love that it used to be a department store and is now a chic restaurant.  My only quip with this place? Usually when I have a drink, I like to watch some Sportscenter. But I realize it will kill the ambiance to have televisions in here. I just probably wouldn't go here to have a drink at the bar by myself because of it.

MRuxUcMg8xya-btI3h4dsw.text: Pizza, salad, and onion strings were excellent and they basically delivered it to my job site. I will definitely eat here again

sgW-74ngdBS0oKHyHGGLLw.text: First time at Hanny's.  Cool vibe, great cocktails and the food we had was very good.  Prosciutto pizza and the pork entree both well prepared and fresh. Menu is somewhat limited - expected more entrees.  Menu primarily pizza, salads and sandwiches.  But if it's all as good as our dinner, it's enough.   We'll be back.

s42QavC7N7ZaJdSgiaLB3Q.text: Went to Hanny's at 9:00 p.m. and had drinks and a meal - with a party of seven.  We were seated immediately, but the place filled up and was busy by 9:30 p.m.  Service was slow, but in defense of our waiter, he appeared to be handling about half of the tables.  Food was excellent.  We ordered three pizzas: carne, prosciutto, and blanco.  I love meat, and assumed that the carne pizza would be my favorite.  It was great, but the prosciutto was better.  This pizza is every bit as good as Bianco's, if not better, and you can get in without being made to feel like the object of condescension.  Finally, they have a five dollar martini that was excellent.  (Don't forget to have the donuts for dessert.  They are good - but I think in the past they were better.)  My wife had the beet salad which was a little light on beets and heavy on arugula.  Otherwise, outstanding food, even the "onion strings" that we had as an appetizer.  (Oh, and the atmosphere is very cool, from the elevator shaft, to the lighting to the old signs.)

6D1vakDaHgCvkjwILNlFrw.text: Superb ambiance! Great cocktails. OK Pizza

xx-ZodUKnEvIL_SNLMu5iA.text: Almost smack dowm center of downtown phoenix, hannys a unique upscale bar/restaurant. Walking  into this place and you got this young hip vibe u cant find anywhere  in downtown  phoenix. The staff is amazing the  bar can get pack  pretty  quick but it does not hurt to get a table. The menu  is pack with  great option. As for me, the pizza i order was not only taste but lool quite unique. Have never seen a thin pizza  like this. Next time im down here ill for sure br stoping by again l.

jOaNsxwJEnANQIAXG1O29g.text: why was everything around closed on a saturday night before 10?? Sleek place to grab a drink with some friends if you're looking for a lounge feel. The chairs that lean back were kind of annoying.  House music was chill, but they should turn the lights down if they want to make it a club. creepy mannikins downstairs. make-out chairs with mirrors upstairs.  I don't know, I'm still confused. Maybe it was the absinthe...which they DONT serve with a  cool fire presentation or anything. anticlimactic.

p3YcWbBzO5l4U320hCS3Bw.text: Went here on a weeknight and turned out to be a bad idea. If this is the best downtown Phoenix has to offer, then this city's really fucked. Hanny's is a magnet for hipsters, so don't expect any hot, single women outside of the weekend scene. The interior looks really nice, but has a cold, sterile feel about it.   Maybe the HH specials here are better, but 15.50 for a Stella and a plate of sliced meats is way too much. The service was good, DJ was lame. I can't recommend Hanny's with Bar Smith being so close, and I don't even like that venue very much. Sorry, I just don't see the appeal of this place.

JmKAwPXyM63h8SHhJUghZA.text: For a Thursday night, I'm happy to find a place that serves food after midnight. HOWEVER, I've never had such terrible service, not just from an individual server but from everyone working there my first (and last) night in. Our server looked at us with a blank stare and lacked social skills, which wasn't the worst part and can be totally excusable. What shocked me was that we went from one rude bartender to another. The blonde bartender spoke in an insulting tone and was not happy when we ordered waters, after previously ordering drinks and attempting to order more. After her rudeness she passed us along to a different bartender who was equally as bland. Hanny's has the appeal of a really cool, urban spot, but don't let the appeal fool you. You'll get terrible service and pretty much pass out trying to use the restroom because it is beyond disgusting. Hanny's invest in better employees and adapt to this century's sense of hygiene.

U_se8LDn50uEU68qrU-GGw.text: Fun place. The drinks are on the expensive side so I usually stick with the classic martini. $5 and the bartenders always make them well. The Moscow mule seems to have a cult following with a certain segment...  The bartenders are skilled and fun to talk to. There never seems to be that much interaction between patrons, everyone kind of stays in their parties. In fact, on the right night you could bring your drinks upstairs and have a whole floor to yourselves. Great place for a date or catching up with old friends or for groups.  I've heard the food is good, and worth the price, though I've only eaten a slice of prosciutto...the kitchen is open late...The atmosphere is clean and modern. A DJ plays downtempo or some other appropriate lounge music. Definitely a place to check out if you're downtown.

3hQrUxWOVwLouzRlbNBfZA.text: Don't come here if you're looking for good service. Or really, any service at all.  On my first visit, we were seated for 20 minutes but never served, as we watched the single waitress hurriedly run around the place. Since we were somewhat hungry/thirsty, we left.  Last night was an improvement (at least we were served), but not by much. I had called a week in advance to avoid my first experience and was told they didn't accept reservations but they'd at least make a note to try to keep two tables ready for my party of 10.  No such tables were ready. No host greeted us, and when I explained the situation to the waiter who was also hurriedly running around, he responded: "Guess what? Tonight we're short-staffed, too."  Guess what? Maybe you should hire more people.   The abruptness continued. We were yelled at to get our IDs ready in advance if we wanted to drink, and when my friend didn't have hers out because she came late, the waiter was visibly annoyed. They didn't bring out my other friend's order with the rest of the dinners (to be fair, they comped her meal after she brought this to their attention). I never got a refill on my water or was asked if I wanted a second drink (also to be fair, their $5 martini is pretty decent). The pizza was greasy and unremarkable, and their fried onion strings were really fried batter strings, leaving the onion to the imagination.   Perhaps I happened to come on the worst, short-staffed nights. But I wouldn't risk making that mistake again.

RNL6Fx99SuJt9waYIWDY5A.text: Cool restaurant that seems like it has been here forever.  I think it was a converted men's shop that is now a plush lounge with a great menu. Relatively inexpensive with uber-cool decor, Hanny's is a great place to get the night started.  We started with interesting cocktails that have really cool sounding ingredients and loved all of them!  Some classics and new takes on old favorites.  Absinthe for the daring...It should be noted that there is a heavy dose of fried egg on the menu.  Knowing that fried eggs are good for defeating and preventing hangovers, I decided on the roast beef sandwich - 4/5 stars. The coleslaw with pistachios was MONEY, super good; everyone was stealing mine.  And our friend who was splurging got the bacon wrapped prawns: killer combo, chow down on these and thank me later. Probably the highlight for me.  Mysterious restroom setup and the elevator shaft? Super fun conversation pieces. Reclining sofas at the dinner table? Don't-mind-if-I-do! (Careful, this bedeviling machine caused wine to be spilled on my jeans!)  Give it a shot before dancing in downtown Phoenix and you'll have a delicious time and feel very hip while doing so.

WFsMWxmN4K1JU4vMkPsmHA.text: I have been coming to Hanny's for years so surprisingly this is my first review for them. Hanny's uncorks a stylized, evocative urban design in a old building with great bones, refreshing the increasingly lively downtown. The food matches the style. It's location is a great spot to start your evening or to finish the night. It has a coolish vibe with chill decor. Appetizers like Asperges & Egg or Shrimp Prosciutto will get the evening started right. Cocktails  like a classic Martini or the Ginger Creek surely a great way to set the tone for a fun night. The missing star is for the somewhat diminishing customer service, it can be a roll of the dice depending on the night.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot Honey Pepperoni

1tEZyer19B55HdG7LQEvIQ.text: I really like the place... Great deep base sounds and fantastic music. I really love the pepperoni pizza! Very very this crust and amazing flavors. The Gorgonzola slaw salad is a real treat, nothing quite like it!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-DHtvTK9jX6aCd8cXLjmKQ.text: I had the Margherita pizza and it was terrible. I even tried to get my kids to eat the leftovers the next day, because they will eat any pizza and they hated it. Our service was mediocre. The vibe was cool, but not worth coming back for.

lD9iyjJXHtwxwRzfklUJXQ.text: This food was great! The drinks are strong which is good. Make sure you go upstairs to check out the cool bathroom area that makes you feel like your in a raved out spaceship. Also, go downstairs and see the creepy dolls!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

txo8isZuvUPsxiGmg3mgaA.text: This review is my 100% authentic opinion, not swayed by anything offered by Hanny's.   Hanny's is a True experience! I'm excited to return and try out something new! I had the grilled cheese with tomato sauce, slaw and shoestring onions. It was honestly some of the best food I have had in awhile. The grilled cheese was flavorful; the tomato sauce complimented nicely. The slaw was incredible. I wanted a whole bowl of it. The shoestring onions were good but I thought they would be better if it was paired with a dipping sauce. Regardless, still pretty good. My boyfriend got the spicy honey pepperoni pizza. It was also delicious. Best for someone who enjoys spicy food. ;) I loved the relaxing vibe mixed with the wild artwork. Hanny's is a fun and affordable restaurant style experience with a great History. When you visit, be sure to visit upstairs and the basement. It's a must. I will return soon.

jphXH__KwMnGkNKCsd2FDA.text: I ordered the Carne Pizza and it was WONDERFUL! The crust was thin and perfectly crisp and the meat was cooked to perfection. I will definitely order again.

ZHdcvyEpUcvbli_GdEJc7w.text: Nice ambiance.  Good service sitting at the bar.  Really enjoyed the choices of cocktails and how they were prepared.  The bar board was also good.  Fun watching them shave the prosciutto at the bar.  The bread was good and was accommodated with butter when I asked.

otxAUw0GVlHqTM8mZHkSdw.text: This has to be one of the coolest venues in downtown Phoenix. Good food, nice ambiance and friendly staff. We had the bar plate which is a charcuterie board it was yummy. Aaliyah was our bartender/server she was awesome! She was very knowledgeable about the food and the liquor. I love this place! The music, the lighting and the artistic ambiance. One night I came in and they were playing Curtis Mayfield and Betty Davis. I had never heard Betty Davis' (not the actress, the rocker aka Miles Davis' ex-wife) music being played anywhere but in my car or back in Atlanta when local bands would cover her. That is when I knew this place was dope. The first time I went I was afraid to go down to the basement and look at the dolls. The post cards show the dolls looking kind of spooky. But when I went down it wasn't that bad. They bring you your check attached to a post card. You can address it and write a little message to someone, they will send it out when they collect enough. What a cool concept. I have done it twice so far, totally going to do it every time! This place never disappoints.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bruschetta and the small bar plate in the background.
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bathroom vibes...

df7S_FHyUQ8PV0aK9BKcJA.text: All I can say is yummmm!! I love love love the pizza here! The garden salad is also very delicious. This place is very cool and a different concept! Definitely have to go check out the basement for some fun! Perfect for a spot before a game downtown or a night out!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QntgiGoySJFxToFqSb11hg.text: Let's be clear I absolutely LOVE the Hanny's  staff..... they are some of the best in business however there is one bartender named Miss Jennifer who is MEAN.  Let me tell you I moved to Phoenix one year ago and she is the MEANEST person I met in Phoenix. My first experience with the unpleasant Miss Jennifer was last Tuesday and I hope to never see her again in Hanny's or a dark alley because she is very intimidating and scary.....and im not the only person with this feeling because as I sat by the bar among other customers I could hear them complaining about Miss Jennifer's poor customer service. I think it's far for me to say I speak for a lot of customers at this point .... Hanny's we love you but please put Miss Jennifer ithe Dish Pit away from us happy customers until she cools off and if she doesn't cool off throw her out with the trash and let her take that sour attitude to a hole in the wall kind of establishment because she definitely brings down Hanny's

P7zpgm5BfzK-MnAKo5o9MA.text: I love this place. It is a cool historical building that used to be an old department store. There is a lot to explore. The ambiance is always stellar, the drinks are great and the food is just good.  I recommend the $7 Martinis. They used to be $5, which was insane, but it's still a pretty good deal for downtown. I also recommend the bar plates because they slice the prosciutto fresh. It is great for something to munch on as you down a martini or three (:

ZDFu3qE_HEtylLV34dGBCA.text: The service SUCKS!    I've been coming here since they opened, and the food is AMAZING, and always has been.  The service has always been OK, but in the last 6 months, it has gone to sh*t.    We were in on 10/17(check 668, server 161), and it took our waiter almost 20 minutes to even say "hi".  There were two ladies seated in the same section who didn't even get a "hi" until well after we got our food.  The couple at the table next to them asked their waitress to serve them, but she literally said "not my table" and left.  As I was walking out, I flagged down a bartender and told him to send the manager over and comp the ladies food because of what they had been through, and he said "I'll see if I can find someone, but I doubt they'll comp them".  On my way out the door, I heard a guy telling people waiting for a table that it's "not worth the wait; service sucks!" (and they followed him out).  Sad to watch the downfall of great restaurants.

2vmKfklvOirz1vAaWrT19Q.text: I'll usually end up at Hanny's whenever I'm staying at the Renaissance across the street.  Downtown is usually pretty dead when there aren't any ball games going on, so there isn't much of a ruckus normally.  From what I've been told, Hanny's used to be a department store.  The wait staff wears these white lab coat looking things but I'm sure it ties in with the theme somehow.  The food and drinks are surprisingly good.  The pizza is great.  This time, we ordered the prosciutto pizza and the margherita pizza.  I had one friend with me that was amazed by the proscuitto pizza and he said it was life changing.  The cocktails must have been great, since a lot of folks that normally wouldn't be drinking cocktails were indulging in them.   The bathrooms on the 2nd floor are set up in a very non conventional way.  There's different symbols on the doors so you can see which one you can use accordingly.   The bottom floor right by the entrance has a very interesting set up with some dolls that's I'll need to find out more about next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LXDBPrH-c733Z9Cj12QtLw.text: Not sure why people don't like this establishment. Great location, good food, and at times confusing bathrooms :).   What I like the most about Hanny's outside the food is the history of the building. I feel like I step back 80 years walking in here. I imagine a swanky type atmosphere even though back then when it was a just a department store.   We've sat at the bar, brought my daughter for a date night and always have a good time.   Try the meat board with fresh sliced prosciutto!!

Ol6jeXQiDW6Q77g-r4clog.text: Recently went on a Tuesday night, had the pepperoni-honey pizza and a tasty Pimms cocktail. Excellent staff and food. Oh yeah, we also had the strawberry long cake, or should I say *I had it, since it was eaten almost entirely by me. Delish. For an early weeknight, there were still plenty of people there, and a good, low-key vibe.

MpTkMjCgmiL4SY8Tzv-a_A.text: Order the Pizza called Bianco. Yummy goat cheese pizza and good drinks. The Martinis are amazing

2-gkH8RHakPTQMyhdSVM3Q.text: This was my husbands and my first visit to this place. We noticed it after leaving a comedy show and decided that we would go there to dinner in the near future. We looked at their menu to decide whether we wanted to try or or not. Upon arriving we were greeted right away and thankfully did not have to wait very long on a Saturday night. Our waitress took our drink order, I ordered the Heckish old fashioned. she asked me a follow up question about my choice of drink to ensure that I would like it (she said most people expect a fruitier/sweeter drink but she told me it tastes more like bourbon) I stuck with my decision since I like bourbon and I'm so glad that I did. It was delicious. We order bruschetta as an appetizer, the prosciutto pizza, and the carne pizza since we husband and I could agree on a pizza. We had plenty of leftovers to take home. We both personally really love our drinks, food, and the experience. There is a live DJ that plays in the restaurant, not loud at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prosciutto  Pizza
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Heckish Old Fashioned

Q4VEo1WrDMj5DEtmOjfQuw.text: Came in around midnight on a Friday. This place was jumpin. Lots of energy. We ordered the Carne with hot honey drizzle ($15 plus $1 for the hot honey drizzle). The pizza was absolutely delicious, but what I loved most was the romantic late night atmosphere. This is the ultimate late night spot in downtown Phoenix. I'll definitely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne with Hot Honey Drizzle
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great view of the Dj up top
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cFG27c8sgEKAJRdMUZBYng.text: Incredible setting - The interior decor and art deco vibes are unbeatable  Fantastic soundtrack - DJ slays with his set  Needs to expand menu - Please, please work on your limited and ultra-outdated menu

s7ZqESKZIXhD6yi_UZ9icQ.text: Came here over the weekend to grab a drink with my bf...loved the vibe ! Tasty drinks and great atmosphere. Perfect for a date night or a group setting.  Will def come back :)

RsUWEvnOY6VnkVwKo492tw.text: If zero stars was an option, I would have picked it. We were there to celebrate my birthday and I normally love this place; nice atmosphere and good drinks but I will never come back. Our waiter got into a fist fight with a drunk patron, and the fight ended up at our table. All of our meals and drinks ended up on the floor and our table was practically flipped over. Instead of being concerned about their customers, the wait staff was more focused on cleaning up the broken plates before the police arrived while we stood around without a table to sit at. A female waitress then took her frustration out on us and said it's not her fault that this situation happened. Of course we understand that it is personally not her doing, but first off she called my stepfather an asshole and secondly, when a dangerous and upsetting situation happens at your establishment and then you don't do anything to make up for it or at least be somewhat attentive to your customers, it is absolutely the staffs concern and they are liable for making up for the damage done. Obviously they don't have much experience in giving good customer service, so if that is what you are looking for then definitely don't come here.

e3fn3DYXpMuKxx7nAxGRAA.text: This is a cool place to have a drink and munch on some decent pizza and killer prosciutto. The waitress was just dreadful however and please please please get rid of those friggin chairs that fall back when you sit on them. That alone made me never want to return. The place is pretty cool to walk around and explore however.  I give it 3 stars for the food but 2 for service.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Summer Cooler...Slurp.

0hPRW3m9wOCB13IMu48dGg.text: The atmosphere seems pretty rocking and everyone inside was looking sweet! I saw many drinks that looked super delicious as well. Good vibe, I must say.  The decor and construction of the place and the furniture makes the place unique. I went to the bathroom and was very confused at first because the doors blended into the wall. And there were some awesome mirrors on the second floor with great lighting. I took pictures of myself. Haha.  But yeah, 4 minute walk from the light rail and pretty cool posh place to hang out on a Friday night. I say worth it!

m1FZDFqliVlI0Fyd_tfVBA.text: Hanny's is a unique spot in Downtown Phoenix. Stumbled upon this place by accident and wandered around the building while sipping a great drink. Really cool spot to hang out at!

WfTDkO911b-BtZLLvo7L1w.text: Pro: - Like the ambient. It has it's own character. Also you can check weird puppet thing downstairs. - Live DJ spinning and for the most part I enjoy the music (more of a lounge music) - Good food. - Good number of crowds especially over the weekend.  I had seen different type of people here/ mixed crowd which is great in my opinion. - Can be considered a romantic place for date. Especially if you get to sit upstairs. Just feel more private.  Cons: - Can be pricey

yKQF9-nVbixYx_YPbP0EWA.text: Overall the visit was pleasant.  Had pizza (which was very thin) but delicious. Also had the jumbo shrimp with bacon omg was the the best ever!  Definitely would recommend this to everyone  Great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EiFQ-0loEiBR2q9xG3_loQ.text: Complete disappointment and a let down!!! I could end it there but I wont. My wife and I came here on Friday night to celebrate with a friend that Just graduated. My first reaction to this place was "wow"!!! It was Incredibly nice, and classy. We found our friends and got to our seats, we hung out for a good 15 min before I started getting antsy since our waitress hadn't come by to get us drinks. Our friends said the waitress had been great all night and give her a few more min, which I hesitantly did. Another 5 min went by and I had enough, I went to the bar to get a drink and as I was walking up to it, my wife called me to come back because the waitress had showed up. I very calmly returned to my seat and ordered overpriced celebratory Don Julio shots and a overpriced Dos Equis and a pepperoni pizza. Awhile went by maybe 10 min and the waitress came back with our shots and a kilt lifter??? She apologized and said she would be right back, at this time I told her to just bring 2 Beers so that I wouldn't have to wait for my second one... At this point I had gone well over 30 min without a beer and I was at my breaking point. The only reason I was still there was because our friends liked this place. I stepped outside to take a call and one of our friends saw I was agitated and just went to the bar and got me a beer... After I finished that one I returned to the bar myself to get another beer... in the meantime the waitress had stopped by to drop off my friends drinks but still had nothing for me. About after a hour and 15 min I found my waitress and told her to cancel my pizza and to just get me our tables tab... I was done with this... She apologized and brought my tab, along with my pizza wrapped in aluminum foil.... I told her I was over the pizza, and that I didn't want it. I wanted to have dinner while relaxing, not take it home (which we were not going that way). She said it was ok, she wrapped it so I could take it with???? WTF?! As I was looking at the tab, she charged me for the Pizza I told her I Didn't want anymore, the 2 beers I never got, shots, and 2 drinks for our friends... At this point I Said  F* it and started eating the Pizza, if I was gonna pay for it I may as well eat it hot. When she came back I told her that I never got the beers and why were they on my tab? She walked off to get it taken care of and mid stride turned around and came back, She asked if she could just give us cash for the beers... I was confused... This waitress was willing to just give us cash from her tips to correct her error, then to ask the manager to remove the 2 beers that were never delivered.. I told her not to worry about it, since at the end of the day I would rather just cut my losses and leave this place. It sucks I had this experience. Everyone around me had food, drinks and were having a great time...I wish I could have enjoyed this place.   At the end of the night: 1 pepperoni pizza 2 Don Julio Shots  2 Dos Equis (I never got) friends 2 mixed drinks Equaled a 75 dollar tab= Like I said overpriced...   (This doesn't include the 2 beers I paid cash for at the bar)

gZITaUSvzBUijZvNGXO_Cg.text: The service was terrible. The food was just ok. Dessert was the best part of the whole experience.

xGmOLeiS7WMg0lMB93rQ3Q.text: Very good meal. Good moscow mule.  Adams Street chop.  Also really good shrimp appetizer.

RAJS93Idazp4x9WDP8ST7Q.text: Can't I just show you some pictures of Hanny's, give it six stars, and call it a day?   No? I have to be more descriptive in reviews? Fine.  This place rocks. Shut up and sit down at the bar. Order anything. You'll learn pretty fast. You can't go wrong with the Caiprinaha. I can't pronounce (or spell) it either, but they'll be more than happy to give you an intro to this high-octane Brazilian cocktail. Yes, it's $10 but you don't even know what cachaca is so pipe down and enjoy it. If you're a wuss like me, just stir it up with your nifty stick of rock candy until you can handle it. All cocktails are pricey, but most of them use high-end ingredients. All made by knowledgeable bartenders.  If you want dinner, just go with something that has prosciutto on it. I had it on my pizza and lemme tell you--you can't go wrong with this. If you dine at the right time, you can expect a DJ on the second floor.  But whatever you do, use the restrooms. USE THE RESTROOMS. Tell me you're not amused. I'll try not to ruin the surprise.  Overall, I've only been here a handful of times, but I don't think I could ever get tired of it. Here are some tiny nit-picky criticisms I have:  -It was totally cooler when the bathrooms didn't have labels on them. I think there were more mirrors (oops! spoiler alert!) too. I totally understand why it would need the slight adjustment, and it's still great for conversation.  -Several cocktails stood out because they used Bacardi Rum. At the risk of sounding like a snob, that discouraged me from trying the rum-based beverages.  -Your staff looks a tad worn out and a bit short. When I get carded twice to order a drink, I can tell that a lack of communication may spill into other tasks around the establishment.   -WHEN IS THE BAR ON THE SECOND FLOOR OPEN!? IT'S AMAZING.  I'll shut my trap. Just go here, you won't regret it.

2GlMQBiMJMnEKRW1qQBZEQ.text: Hanny's is a treasure in downtown Phoenix. Within walking distance of many theaters, art and entertainment venues popping into Hanny's is always there for you.  Holding my $5 martini. At all hours of the day.  I'm updating my review to applaud Danielle our server from the other night. A bunch of friends and I were on the prowl for a place to hang out. (Hanny's is right around the corner from CityScape, where we had caught a great StandUp Live comedy show.)   Seated immediately Danielle was quick to take our orders and return with drinks. Her witty and cheery banter was quite the surprise. Why? She's preggers! When you stop in to visit you too can be greeted by smiles.   Hanny's is a place that loves you no matter what. In the mood to eat? Flat breads and snacky food is divine. Worried about parking? They have a lot. Planning to indulge in a deluge of five dollar martinis? They're right off the light rail!  The ambiance is very chill here. Dress up or not, you'll fit right in.The bar is a wonderful place to people watch. Groups are welcome and there is plenty of seating.   Be sure to reserve time to tour the restaurant. The elevator shaft, bathrooms and basement are Instagram heaven. (No, you won't be murdered. Just go!)  Anyhoo, thank you Hanny's for the good times!

vA9uoM_c-WmRo3KIOcckQA.text: On a recent trip to Phoenix, visited Hanny's upon concierge recommendation. The place was spacious, big glass windows and house DJ playing music to provide a hip vibe. We were seated right away and waiting staff was very attending. Saw a number of people on dates so guessing it is a good a date spot for the locals :).   Drinks were normal even though they didn't have my first selection of white wine from the menu.   For vegetarian, plenty of options. Cauliflower Calabrese was spicy and flavorful. The pizza and beet salad lacked the punch and nothing out of the ordinary. Would have liked the food to be as good the ambiance and drinks.

Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beet Salad
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie Pizza (requested no olives)

Ne6bzU8rFgkNhNOSbEPUZg.text: -our waitress was nice, but the other people barely even glanced at us.  -nice, but we rarely saw her. it took like 20 minutes to get the check/back/change -ridiculously slow service/food arrival. two pizzas was about a two hour ordeal.  -food: okay. prosciutto pizza was whatever. carne was slightly better but nothing good.  -extremely..."interesting" decorations. don't bring your kids here. but of course, it's kind of a bar anyway... -that said, the decor is decent. music is probably itunes'd - you can see a macbook on the second floor  HOW did the night take so freaking long!

evtG0fPwRNYF9UXXgDrPMA.text: I love this place! The happy hour is on point plus they have $5 dollar martinis all day! I got the prosciutto pizza and it was one the best pizzas I've ever had! My friends got the pork milanese, asparagus w/egg and onion strings, not a single complaint from any party! We all tried each other's and loved it!! I would definitely recommend checking this place out if you're downtown and looking for some food and drinks! They even have a dj spinning while you're enjoying your lounge time. Great atmosphere as well.

xjBowAO3UDy7uIm7k3oRig.text: Really cool bar in down town. It's in an old department store. I like it because the drinks are affordable ($5 martinis) and they were strong. Just what I needed after a Dbacks game

C23hBj6arcVOFJ_fQ3Hytw.text: I can't believe I haven't written a review for our night out here.  We had a blast!  A small group of couple-friends from work and us went on a Friday after work.. it wasn't busy busy yet, so we had our pick of the tables and we had a great, comfortable spot once it did get really busy that night.  The ambiance and decor is a bit cooky mixed with modern sleek.  Our server gal was impressive - she was engaging, genuinely friendly, knowledgeable about the beers and quick with service.  We ordered the Bar Plate with lost of different things on there that was enough for all of us.. there were three different pizzas on the table that we ordered and they were all delicious in their own right (yes, I tried 'em all!).  I really liked that the crust was thin and still chewy and crispy at the same time.  The beet salad also looked delicious from across the table.  What stood out for me was, of course, their passion for cocktails.  I loved that I wanted to try every drink on their menu... well, we practically did.  At our table was Chimay, Huckleberry Lemonade, Classic Manhattan, ... and, of course a couple different types of Absinthe (Mata Hari and Grant Absente) and my Yellow 80 proof Chartreuse.  Great cocktails, is all I can say!  Great ambiance, cool decor, friendly and quick staff, tasty pizzas and a covetable bar menu and you got me at hello.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chartreuse 80 proof and apple, prosciutto, and fontina pizza.

FzYr8mi2gZDADh3uTLNTDA.text: I've been meaning to review this place forever. As far as Phoenix bars go, this one is at the top of the list.  It's trendy atmosphere, live DJ, and interesting art installations inspire conversation, and food/small plates are tasty too. Hanny's transports you to another time and place with its department store history dating back to the 1940s. Great for date night or time out with friends, Hanny's won't disappoint.

F0h124AaZBKgWMWUQZ04_w.text: Always enjoy coming here for a drink in the evening. I do enjoy the contemporary hipster, yet casual ambiance. The elevator shaft and bathroom experience is cool. I do miss the dolls (third story). One of the best downtown late night spots. I have ate here three times and every time was very good as well. I would recommend the Flatbread pizza and the Bruschetta.

dHMPxlC4EMeipmL5qneZiw.text: I've been to Hanny'a many times. They're very enjoyable for lunch, but can get a little crowded at dinner time. I recommend the chop salad. 5/5. The ambience is very hip, and it always has a good crowd. They have good cocktails, and the waitstaff is very helpful. All in all, I recommend you check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The chop salad is a homerun!

zmxjdr9WnA1iTuhkCNwBxA.text: We had a celebration lunch with a party of 9 people yesterday.  The food was good, but the waitress was terrible.  Instead of moving to each person and taking their individual orders she stood at the head of the table and shouted over the table back and forth to take the orders.  Of course she couldn't hear properly, but instead of walking to the person, she just stood there.  Additionally, we were not all served at the same time.  We had to wait an extra 15 minutes for the last person to finally get their sandwich.  She was completely incompetent.

P6U9TgKiip1GhZIBL5QpmQ.text: I went to Hanny's with a friend, I had never been there before. Their food was excellent! I loved the way it was setup, was very nice and modern. They had a great dirty Martini. I had the shrimp prosciutto app which was amazing, and the green apple proschiutto pizza which was great too. The pizza was more of a cheese crisp, so it wasn't too heavy. Two thumbs up!

3mlS-RltNQVNj2KYxtttbQ.text: To be fair, I'm judging Hanny's as a downtown lunch spot, and from that end I wasn't overly impressed. I love AZ88 and when I found out they were bringing a restaurant downtown, I couldn't wait to make it my new favorite lunch spot.  I walked in and was not disappointed - beautiful interior, definitely a more trendy vibe than the other places we have downtown. Then Iooked at the menu.  Pizza, sandwiches, and onion rings.  That about covers it.  Not a very diverse menu, nothing overly exciting.  Food is decent but nothing spectacular (no AZ88 chicken sandwich standout). I went back after work and its an okay place for happy hour.  Drinks are on the pricey side but Hanny's at least feels like the type of restaurant you'd want to hit up for happy hour in a big city downtown. Overall, nothing drawing me back for food and maybe a happy hour every now and then.  I was hoping for more and was disappointed.

02hZYbYz2bP1v21LxXp4BQ.text: My boyfriend and I went here for the first time last weekend and it is our new favorite spot for drinks and people watching. The ambiance is different than anything else I've seen in Phoenix. It actually reminds me of a place we used to go in Chicago. Very cool, very laid back, yet still upscale. Definitiely worth checking out for a change from the same old Scottsdale lounge scene.

PiqrUXsxx9ZDrZgGN7V73Q.text: The worst restraurant experience I have had in years. I was visiting from Chicago with friends. The service from the server and the manager were horrible. The food was not eatable. They could care less. Too bad Phoenix, I really liked the decor, the bar, and the people. Gay's, Straight's, and in between FYI. Bad news unless you are that desperate. No place like home, Sweet Home Chicago!!!!!!

NblVIpebhrejY-ZJP8bftQ.text: We ve been here three times and have had high hopes of it getting better, however its always just okay, and pretty quiet, This place is so large it needs bodies to provide the warmth, It should have kept the Az88 concept, always fun going to that place and the burgers where definately better than a thin not terrific pizza, the sandwiches have been hit or miss, and the drinks on the expensive side, so we ll keep hoping they improve,

j4PnZ7hLIN2Qejw5nwPRsw.text: Really like Hanny's. Feels like a real "big city" restaurant. Pizza is on less typical cracker-type crust, but tasty - the carne pizza is great (though a little greasy from all the meat). Prosciutto wrapped shrimp is delicious. Only complaint is the drink glasses are small.

sMXDdAA9xrntffbMJg8vfg.text: Had the Moscow cocktail and it was surprising, spicy and delicious. I was debating on ordering one of their martini's but when I saw the size of the glasses, relative to the price of the drinks, I thought better of it. My friends and I ordered their Pizza Bianco, which was good, but not great. It was a mix of chesses, diced tomato, and basil leaves on a very flat crunch bread. It was not savory all. Hard to explain. Like the flavors were all there, but somehow didn't come together. And when you reached the "crust" of the pizza, it tasted like burnt popcorn. Ick! The bartenders were cool for the most part but a little stand offish at first. And like some of the other Yelpers have mentioned before, the bathrooms were probably the coolest part of the place. My friends and I were sure we'd see Bowie standing there in the bathroom hall of mirrors telling us how much time we had to get through the Labrynth.

ZgJNbLTDYaI7YvrMUeBs7A.text: HUGE space on 1st St., with nice decor, although a little too drab for my tastes. And the music is offbeat...a little classical, a little New Age, a little jazz. The bathrooms are super weird, as you'd expect from the people behind AZ88. The service is very friendly, if not always the most prompt. The food is...well, it's nothing memorable. Their "bruschetta" is really more like an olive tapenade, with crostini on the side. When I asked a friend how he liked Hanny's, he said, "It's good, but a little oily." I thought, "what?!" but I understood what he meant when I saw and tasted the crostini. And then came the prosciutto pizza. While I loved the thin crust, the nice sauce, the prosciutto, arugala, and fresh shaved parmigiano-reggiano, the cheese was also super oily. Bring the Tums, people. Dessert was the biggest flop of all. The lemon meringue tart had almost no lemon at all. It was basically warm, runny meringue (which the waitress said had just been freshly made...obviously not well) on a crust. It was like it was missing a whole layer of lemon filling. Hanny's will be a cool place to hang out and grab a drink after Suns or D-backs games, but it's not a place to go to for the food.

9APoZAef2tEEzJEHU4OTYg.text: I've seen a few reviews knocking on the service, but it couldn't be further from the truth as far as I'm concerned.  Elena was our server, and she was sweet, friendly, and very accommodating.  The food was outstanding.  I took my mother here for dinner before a show at the Orpheum last night, and we decided to nosh on a bunch of appetizers rather than loading up on heavy entrees.  The standout dishes were the prosciutto shrimp (or were they LOBSTERS... they were so big) and the cauliflower calabrese.  We also had the snack plate and the bruschette, which were both great dishes in their own right.  The food arrived quickly, and everyone with whom we had contact was professional, courteous, and accommodating.  All that being said, you cannot visit this place without taking the "tour":  the original elevator shaft with the clear floor and ceiling; walk around upstairs to get a view of the scene down below, and don't forget to check out the restrooms; then take a look at the funky mannequin in the front window of the restaurant (with the doll faces on her butt); last, but not least, is the creepy doll collection in the basement.  All these things add a great deal of character and personality.  This goes on my list of places to take out-of-towners.  Well done, Hanny's!  P.S. - A special shout-out to Elena, who didn't sing happy birthday to my mother (sparing us, she says), but brought out Tiramisu with a candle.  We told her of our plans for the rest of the night, and wouldn't you know she spotted us walking back to our cars in the garage next door.  She snuck out the door to greet us and ask us about the show, and we chatted up for another few minutes.

LzlzH3VVlnV9Br7A6dBuPw.text: Good food and atmosphere. Perfect for any date occasion, and decent music. Pizza is is great and a thinner crust. Not a shorts-wearing type of place. Still good!

VdRxLPnvLBm9xrjk5mLpcA.text: Awesome atmosphere . So many unique nooks and crannies .  Great DJ, food was perfect. Fun night

LTZOslEPpA6YlZf6GSj5EQ.text: Truly a fun place to hang out and people watch.  I was in last night for a late night glass of wine and a pizza.  The prosciutto pizza is super thin crust and pretty good.  A lot of people from Comicon were in and out wearing their costumes.  What a kick!

XQBHIV326-y-cYDBp2icKQ.text: Just a quick gripe, i usually love this place, but i went in after volunteering at a nearby church (pat on the back) only to have my night ruined by a server who instead of bringing me my pizza, brought me a sandwich, then told me it was my fault, and did not talk to us for the rest of the night.  Me returning is dependent on if i hear back from management or not.

3fma8ty3sVeEtDaRjt2j8g.text: Well Hanny's. Since that first, really, rather awkward first date we had, I'm pleased to say that you have won my heart.   I've been back many times since and have some delicious and playful culinary delights to please my Culinary Comedian palate.  From the bruschetta to your steak and your awesome Manhattan's...you most deservedly earn at least one extra star.   Loving the banquettes with the backs that ever so slightly recline. Think airplane seat recline. But with more leg room. And better food.   Though I must say, the restrooms on an airplane, though small, are more convenient than yours. What is it? The fifth floor? Sixth? I forget.  Loving you Hanny's. Dare I say we are actually dating now? The real deal?   Next time I see you let's hug and I'll give you a little slap on the ass!

WdIwxtsYPC4LtImGkBgCeA.text: Hanny's is a nice place for a date. The food is very good and it is reasonably priced. The pizza and sandwiches here are quite delectable and always seem satisfying. Service is prompt and insightful.  The only bad point of Hanny's is I believe they over price their beers and wine. Other than that this is a pretty cool spot.

GIzsaVeqqpA9WWt9Zh6vyg.text: What do Hanny's and a trumpet player have in common?  Nothing actually, but while I was enjoying a Pimm's cup the Bad Cactus Brass Band spontaneously paraded itself around the dining room to the tune of  When the Saints Go Marching In.    Hanny's was pretty empty for what is normally considered rush hour on a Friday night.  It also gave me the feeling of being in a train station, not sure why exactly.  Maybe it's the color scheme, it's sort of monochromatic with black, grey and a pop of white.  It also feels cold and usually I'm cold when in train stations.  I don't know, that is just the vibe I get.  Don't get me wrong, I liked it.   The service was great, but I think I will only be back for drinks and maybe an appetizer.  The food is really nothing special and I think I'd rather go to AZ88.  The only menu items I've tried are from the sandwich section, so it could be that I need to give Hanny's another shot.  I would like to try the pizza, but didn't on this visit because I swear I'd had pizza three times that week.  I was starting to feel like a college student again.  The delivery guy even said something like, "You sure do like pizza.  I've been here a lot lately."  Hey, don't judge me.

qjNHlKMQdSgQkEB_TjniMg.text: I love hannys so much I come 2 or 3 times a week. I like coming to hannys for my birthday and my half birthdays. The peartini is my favorite. The golfo is is very good my favorite thing to get is Hanny's salad. All the desserts are delish you can't go wrong with any. Love the music they play. I bring my friends and give them tours since the place has history. It is a great asset to the downtown area.

76VKfw2eCWos-Ny38Gns9Q.text: Hanny's is a great place to take company or anyone for that matter that enjoys great cocktails and an atmosphere that is perfect for conversation and picking at one of their amazing pizzas.  You'll hear some of the best old school hip hop being spun from the elevated DJ booth that is tucked into an up stair area that opens up at sunset top reveal itself. Also, take a trip to the second story bathrooms for a real treat and at times a bit of confusion as to where you actually enter to perform the duty.  The service is always on point and if you want some of the best pours in town make sure to have Dale as your tender.   Given that i am here at least twice a week i may be biased, but the fact remains the quality of the Pizzas and the solid pour make it an always amazing time.
