Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hi2fYJCh6J1Pa0ECIT3dUg.text: Looking for an upscale sexy pizza place with a DJ spinning some music for your date tonight? This is the place. The pizza is yummy and the atmosphere is great. DJ yes dancing No. Disclaimer: I don't recommend this place for large groups especially if you are super hungry.

1hGWf4p5Los6D7cckdcCPQ.text: I haven't removed my original 5-star review of Hanny's, replacing it with this 1-star, because I nabbed the first-to-review for it and don't feel like giving that up. But let me be absolutely clear: going to Hanny's is most definitely a 1-star experience, for reasons I will describe below. When I write a one-star review on Yelp, it means the following: I will not come here again unless I really have to (e.g., some pre-planned organizational event beyond my control). I will refuse to recommend anyone that I know to come here. I will refuse to suggest this as a venue for any event for any of the organizations I belong to. And I will tell everyone that I know, whenever it comes up, that Hanny's is a horrible place to spend any part of your evening.   Seated at a large table with about 10 or 15 people one recent night, a friend and I ordered a beer each. Everyone else ordered various drinks and some snacks, and a pizza or two, as well. After 5 or 10 minutes, everyone else had gotten our drinks but the two of us. Though this is a bit annoying, it's nothing to write home about and not a big deal. Another 5 minutes later, the pizzas came out, which we weren't eating.   But, still no beers.   Another 5 minutes later (about 20 minutes after we'd ordered them), a third friend of ours who had noticed our beer-less selves got irritated on our behalf and decided to complain to our waiter. Yes, she did so in a somewhat stern manner. But she was not rude, and she did not speak with a raised voice. She was just to-the-point, and spoke in a manner that was commensurate with the unacceptably slow service we were being provided.  A waiter who receives a complaint like this has a choice in how to respond. I dare say that the professional response, especially when (as is the case here) the customer actually IS right and the service actually HAS been unacceptably slow, is to say, "Ma'am, you're right, and I am so sorry. We've just been backed up and I will bring them out pronto." That would be the end of the story, right?  Alternatively, you could stare back at the customer with a hostile look, and then defiantly declare with a rude and aggressive tone of voice, "Yeah, I'll get them, but as you can see we had a lot of food to bring out." Which is what happened. So, Excuse me? Our friend looked back and returned the favor, "I don't really care what your logistical problems are. I'm just pointing out that they don't have their drinks and they've been waiting for 20 minutes." The response: "Yeah, I heard you the first time." He then sulked off.   That wasn't the end of it. Playing some sort of passive-aggressive game with the two of us, this waiter deliberately made us sit for an additional 5 or 10 minutes before finally bringing out our beers. He then refused to come back to our table again, even when new people joined our party and wanted to order a drink. (We wound up advising them to go directly to the bar to order, since we were being actively boycotted.) When he finally did bring us our drinks, I waited to see if an apology would accompany (keep in mind that the two of us had actually remained silent while all this was going on, since our other friend had decided to take on the service problem.) I was completely stunned to hear a wall of silence. I had done or said nothing to this man at all, other than politely order a glass of beer from him 25 minutes earlier. He could not muster up a simple, "Sorry about that, guys."   Did I mention that this wasn't a busy night, so we were one of only a few groups they had to service at the time?   As our table talked about what just happened, I learned that others have experienced this behavior from the staff in the past. And it actually has been to this level of deep and open hostility by waiters (I assume the same one). This doesn't shock me. There is no way a waiter or manager would become so emboldened to behave this way in front of customers he doesn't even know, unless it's part of a pattern. This wasn't just "having a bad night," which I let go all the time when I occasionally encounter it in restaurants. It was something deeper than that.   Not only does the rudeness appall me, but so does the sheer incompetence of not realizing how widespread word-of-mouth can be when you attack a group of customers like us. How does this waiter know who we are? Maybe some of us are long-time residents of downtown Phoenix, who have lived there for years and know a lot of people? Maybe our voices, here on Yelp and among our very large social circles, are highly influential and can have a direct impact on a restaurant's revenues? Did he consider that before deciding to attack us? Nope.  Karl Kopp, the owner of Hanny's, needs to have a serious talk with whoever is managing this restaurant. In the meantime, my opinion that I will loudly and frequently proclaim to everyone I know will remain unchanged, unless and until I receive a personal apology for this incident. I'm not holding my breath.

eUr-v5Zbi0wAu0ARkOsoSA.text: Been here a few times. The food and drinks are always great. Dirty martinis are only $5 and the prosciutto is a must have every time we come. This last Friday we (15 of us) stopped here after a baseball game thinking there would be no tables because it's super busy.. But we discovered the top floor was open seating and there's a small bar where you can order drinks and food. It was great. No wait and it's spacious. We hung out and people watched from the balcony. Love it!

78YlYixEOySAMvyKv8Sp2Q.text: Friday night...super f****** loud but I'm not 60 years old so who cares. After a night of drinking I came here for food and water. I ordered the veggie sandwich with a half and half side of onion strings and pistachio coleslaw. The sandwich was OK, but the ciabatta bread was super soft and delicious. Coleslaw was suuuper good. Onion strings were just OK. Tasted more like grease than anything else. Atmosphere and aesthetic is interesting and pleasing. I'd totally come here again but I'd probably order something else :)

q5CkDUCEtw1zSUkC_DP9-A.text: Great ambience and decor, decent food and drinks. A bit over overpriced. The staff was poor for this experience. Wouldn't recommend for a primary venue, perhaps just a round.

CURynDNXlSCYyOnhnT_SnA.text: Hanny's appears to have everything going for it: nice historic building downtown, the coolest bathrooms in all of Phoenix, elevator shafts with glass floors, and a bizarre attraction in the basement. I admit that the place is very hip and will be guaranteed to impress a date. Unfortunately the food has never managed to be good enough to justify the price, and the bar service is slow even on emptier nights. There is also no happy hour.

DdiAeqT9K2I_Y-5H70K93A.text: I'd give this place a 4.5 out of 5. Their cocktails were second to none, although the price is to be expected for the locale. Pretty much any liquor you could ask for was on hand, and I highly recommend the Caipirinha with Crystalized Sugar, or the Chartreuse Cooler.  As far as food goes, it's very good as far as a bar/lounge goes. Definitely has an Italian flair if you know the first thing about pizza (think Neapolitan style, but a tad more thin.) Even their prosciutto was above-par.  Ambiance was definitely unique. Unisex bathrooms, a lounge in an old department store...I can dig it.  Definitely worth a few visits...or many, since I love Caipirinhas.

4M1NKuuV4_Jzg1qGPklK8Q.text: Hannys always gets the job done. They are the closet thing to NYC that I know in Phoenix. Consistent hours, great servicen amazing food for the right price. Love them. Go there!

zMZNUH014wJ-quXbzoywwQ.text: I personally love this place.  I love the food, their cute DJ with the big hair and the music.  It is rare to find places like this in AZ.  If you like a diverse crowd or people who have to park their cars behind the building or in a deck so there is no chance to be pretentious, this is your place.  Pizzas... amazing.  And, I wish I could buy that building, that place is one of the coolest restaurant in Arizona.

FCzxoJAhkCh8SyBgTZub6g.text: Hanny's is ultimately my favorite place downtown. Any night out I have typically has one visit to Hanny's. I love everything about Hanny's... The atmosphere, drinks, food, food and food... There is always a DJ playing above the crowd and the music is always good.   My favorite eats...  #1 Prosciutto di Parma Pizza  #2 Side Salad  #3 Doughnuts and Chocolate Sauce   Other favorites... chocolate cake, any other pizza, snack plate... Anything really...   My favorite drinks...    I typically go with a Grey Goose on the rocks with 3 lemon wedges.. Which is a generous pour for $10 at Hanny's, but their signature cocktails are yummy too.. I like Peach Porch Tea, Huckleberry Lemonade or any martini. If I'm not drinking hard liquor, I will order a carafe of Pinot Grigio only $15 when one glass is $9.   The seats recline on the booths, if it's busy enough you can get a seat upstairs and it's always fun to sit in the window seats.   I have never had a service issue and the staff is friendly and willing to make good small talk. Hanny's is a great place to hang out any night of the week...

kXgfMPZpk-g-DhWzKGAEFQ.text: Worst service. I'm from out of the area. Very disappointed. My opinion of Phoenix was that everyone is very humble. Heard good things in yelp so myself and a group of 10 came and had worst service. The waitress had an attitude, and took 15 minutes to ask us for drinks. She hadn't stopped in a while, and I wanted to pay my tab. I walked to a waitress and asked her if it was possible to close with her, she sarcastically with attitude asked if she was my server. Obviously not, and I told her that was a stupid question. No wonder it's prime night time and it's empty.

4jE5o5D4gVzTQyUwMqwiDA.text: This is a very interesting place.  An old department store turned restaurant and bar with a cool 1940's vibe.  I wasn't around in the 40's so I'm not sure how accurately this place portrays the period but it was a hip, unique and interesting place nonetheless.  There was a very cool vibe going on and I felt like a hip urbanite even knowing about the place.     My party of 5 arrived at about 7pm on a Saturday and the place was pretty dead.  We were seated promptly by a friendly hostess.  We were told that the place gets pretty busy later in the evening as it turns into more of a cocktail lounge.  They have some pretty interesting cocktails which all seem to be 1940's inspired.  I had a classic martini which was very good and reasonably priced.  My table split 3 appetizers/salads before our meals:  * Cauliflower Calabrese - this was very unique and pretty random if you ask me.  I wasn't really a huge fan of this but the rest of my party was. * Chopped Salad - this was very tasty with lots of good ingredients, but I hate it when everything is separated.  I like my salad to be pre-mixed. * Beet Salad - this was my first beet salad so I'm not sure if it was traditional or not.  Anyway, it was excellent.  I wasn't sure if I would like beets or not because I never have them but I was a big fan of this salad.  I especially liked the goat cheese.  For our meals we split the Prosciutto de Parma (minus the prosciutto) and the Quattro.  While they were both pretty good, they weren't too memorable.  They were a good size and perfect for 3+ people to share.  I'm still not quite sure what to think of this place.  The ambiance was interesting but didn't really mesh with the food they were serving.  Is this place Italian, 1940's hipster, etc.? I just don't get it.  All-in-all the place was good and a good experience but there are several other bars and pizza places I'd like to check out before I return.

02YF8gPWXq9yfLf0OxhCvQ.text: I was looking through my reviews and can't believe I haven't posted a review of Hanny's.  I love Hanny's!  It's an awesome place to go to on a weekend evening.  It's right off the lightrail.  Drinks and food are very affordable and it has an awesome sleek uptown feel without the attitude.  Now I would like to take this opportunity to tell you about the first time my boyfriend and I went to this establishment.    We went to a Phoenix Suns game and afterwards we were looking for a place to hang out and chill.  We walked around  Downtown Phoenix for a good 20 minutes.  We weren't interested in the sports bars around the Purple Palace.  We came across Hanny's.  After we saw that they had appletinis for only $5, I was sold.  We walked in and thought that it was a really sleek place.  We also couldn't believe that the prices were so reasonable.  We loved the fact that the seats reclined and they had a DJ spinning.  It was almost too good to be True.  When my boyfriend and I were seated, I went up the bathroom.  It reminded me of a bath house.  I rushed back down with a look of panic on my face.  I thought it was a a restaurant that catered to "Swingers." We scanned the room and it was mostly couples.  We were almost convinced of it.  We started send out a barrage of text messages to find out the real truth about this place.  Only 2 people knew about Hanny's.  Luckily, they reassured us that it wasn't a hangout for swinging couples. LOL!!  Anyway, Hanny's is one of our favs in Phoenix and we are happy to have stumble upon it.  I love the fact that the owners saw such potential in making an old department store into a hip hot spot.  If you are looking for something to do on a Friday or Saturday night, I highly recommend taking a group of friends or a date and having a drink at Hanny's.

CoLU-K10eMzJImkGwpn-ZA.text: Downtown and it's late but need a place for a bite and a drink?  Hanny's is a much needed welcome addition to the area.    While the food is not bad go for the atmosphere and drinks.   Atypical from this po-dunk town this is a good place to go solo or meet up with a group.  Also, checkout the $28K meat slicer at the bar (a work of art).   Overall:  Great bar.  Great cocktails.  Great service.

8L4NE8fK7GQz4MeoEPEJ9g.text: Amazing: -sweet & attentive service -music -atmosphere for no one there on a Sun night! - prosciutto pizza -italian meat slicer -white glass christmas tree -beet salad -overall experience

2xSlAhkrhuRoh4XqA_3jVw.text: One of our go to drink spots before any event in downtown Phoenix.  The flat bread pizzas are all pretty good and big enough for 2-3 to share; I've tried quite a few and generally prefer the carne or prosciutto.  We aren't really there for the food though, as Hanny's offers a great selection of old school cocktails to choose from.  You'll see classics like Aviation and The Last Word on the menu - drinks that show up in mixology books, particularly those that dive into cocktail history, but usually result in a quizzical look at most other joints.  To be perfectly honest, I feel that these choices are mostly of novelty value - there are much better choices on the menu, and now that I've sampled most everything I tend to stick with tried and True standards like Manhattans, Old Fashioned and such.  A couple others to try:  Hanny's has a pretty interesting take on the caipirinha, allowing you to sweeten your own drink by stirring in some pink rock candy.  And last night I asked for a Sazerac (not on the menu) - bartender didn't follow the traditional recipe, but it came out quite good nonetheless.  The only drink so far that I would not recommend is the Mint Julep; the silver cup presentation is nice, but the bourbon wasn't properly balanced and taste was too harsh...probably because the default base is Jim Beam (I'm not a fan).

UIVAWl4JcfGmQ_JOfVoziA.text: Since moving downtown, Hanny's has become one of my absolute favorites! I love everything from the reclining booths to the crazy bathrooms. And even more, I love the food!   My favorites are the Hanny's Salad and the Margherita Pizza. It's plenty to share and you'll enjoy every bite!  The drinks are a little pricey, but they definitely don't skimp on the booze.   Great for lunch, dinner or late nights!

e5RXWyZ0odWELs7J17O4qw.text: My sisters and I went to Hanny's for my birthday this past weekend. After reading multiple reviews from my fellow Yelpers, I was a little concerned and not sure if I wanted to go to Hanny's after all. We walked in about 10:00pm and the restaurant was busy! We were instantly ushered to our table. Nice! Our waitress was great and our food was delicious and quickly served. $5 martinis??? Heck Yeah! We're going back this weekend!

pr713-qOJOYaHkZM21gI-g.text: Service was pretty ok. We got the pork chop which was pretty tasty, but the gorgonzola and raw red onion was over powering. The crostini on the bruschetta were burnt on the ends. And....my boyfriend ordered the roast beef sandwich. It came with an egg in it, but the egg was fried all the way through. So he asked for mayo. This did not help the sandwich as the meat was dry, and the egg still had no yolk to moisten it. The server asked if we wanted a box for the entire half he didn't eat, but we told her no because it was dry. She said she could offer us some donuts because of the sandwich, but we do like sweets so we declined. We were charged full price for the sandwich, half of which he did not eat because it was inedible. This is not right. We both have worked in the restaurant industry for over 14 years, and I've never seen such lack of concern for customer satisfaction, or attention to detail when it comes to expoing your food. The inside decor is interesting and clean, but we will not be back simply because of poor good quality, and lack of customer consideration.

3OGNXDu2peFKvomxlRPXcQ.text: Have been to this downtown gem twice now.  Once for a late lunch visit and another time for an evening rendezvous.  What a pleasure!  First, the place is magnificent inside.  Has a very classy and almost sensual feel to it.  The huge purple "tongue"couch that looks out the main window begs for you to sit in it!  The bathrooms are super cool!    The food and service were equally incredible.  The bar plate is excellent and the house salad was the best we have ever had.  Try the onion strings!  The Mrs. LOVES the Peach Porch Tea.  During the day the music was great in setting an enjoyable atmosphere...jazzy and classical stuff.  The DJ was playing some funky cool stuff the night we stopped in for drinks and a snack.  We are due for a third visit.  Need to try some of the sandwiches next

n8JjEVb78J6lIS9xdz0zaQ.text: I want to love this place -- I really, really do.  But...  The bartenders rarely seem to stray from the menu -- and this is exactly the kind of place that should allow them to. Let them shine -- I live in downtown Phoenix and I want a great cocktail, dammit! I've tried probably 70% of the drink menu, and they're all decent - but I want to be taken somewhere totally different by a bartender who knows his/her stuff and isn't afraid to share it!  As for food, the roast beef sandwich is very good, as is most of the menu. They've got a manually operated prosciutto slicer that will capture the attention of any good foodie.  Come on, Hanny's -- step up and shine!

aFI3wByB4NBtWcZrFf29Wg.text: The prosciutto incident...  So me and my buddy dropped in here thinking we would have some cocktails and enjoy the vibe. Walk in and the DJ was spinning but this place is a restaurant. We sat at the bar and got a drink and ordered food.  Good news: the roast beef and bacon sandwich was the best thing I have ever had. Legit. Say it again...legit.  Bad news: the prosciutto incident. They have this prosciutto ham or whatever behind the bar on a pedastool. Totally showcased. Piqued our interest. Asked the bartender for a sample and he declined. We have him he business over it but to know avail. He then sent over the manager. Manager held the ground and wouldn't give us a sample. After some banter we conceded and went back to eating our sandwich.  Bottom line....great roast beef sandwich. Bartender and manager are a bunch of jerk offs for not giving us any prosciutto. That's right...jerk offs!

hoLgGToDdhxX2mGn9i30nQ.text: Service was great. Cool atmosphere. Better for a date or group hangout but we had to bring our kids and it was fine. Walking distance from Phoenix convention center. I'll come here again. The food was yummy!

GAc5_As8EVXGsNiVj90KlA.text: Friday nights are the best at Hammy's, cool music from the DJ, great food (pizza and salads are awesome) the whole vibe is just really nice and welcoming.

JtAcqC87KRJHC41K7Ibs0g.text: Hanny's is interesting.  I personally prefer a warmer, more comfortable atmosphere.  It feels a bit cold and modern inside, and a little overwhelming how large the great room is.  It's a great change of pace of what you can find in Phoenix, but I wouldn't say it's my personal favorite.  The bar food is fantastic, the bar plate is a great value for the quality of food.  There was plenty of seating for our larger good,and I was a fan that they serve food late (till 2am).  So this is a place to end the night vs. start the night.  I was a little disappointed in the other patrons for being so casually dressed.  The atmosphere seems more suited for a LBD.

57CKUPftI5b5g0lFducKkA.text: Recently went to Hannys when we went to the phx. symphony hall.  we stopped in for a bite and some wine.  the pizza was great and our waiter was very nice.  the atmosphere was nice too.  One downer was the wine pours.  i honestly have not seen such cheapness. they must be getting 7 glasses per bottle.  when we jokinkgly commented to order a second glass, the comment went to deaf ears and we again received a splash of wine.

K8WLyxIInE4ih73BPk4qbg.text: I am very excited I get to write about Hanny's! We went to Hanny's before a concert at the US Airways arena. The location could not have been better. Upon entering the restaurant I was informed by my friend that this building used to house an old department store- very cool history and found out later VERY COOL RESTROOMS UPSTAIRS!!!!!!!!! Who doesn't love a cool restroom?! It was decorated beautifully with modern touches. They have a ton of tasty cocktails to choose from. I got some type of mojito or something which was out of this world. Then let's pause and take a minute to get prepared to read about their amazing flatbread pizzas! I ordered the Bianco (it was a tad spicy but other than that it was perfect). This flat bread was huge and definitely shareable. I had friends that got the Prosciutto Pizza and it was absolutely divine. I plan on getting that the next time I go back. Hanny's is a must if you live in or visiting Phoenix! I can't wait to go back!

R2IFvNdfDgC7_mM059HmPw.text: Oh Hanny's....  My only experience with Hanny's so far was the after-party of my wedding night. My husband and I, the wedding party, as well as about a dozen additional friends took cab rides from our hotel and somehow ended up there.   Kudos to the staff for opening up the 2nd floor to accommodate our huge, drunk, and obnoxious group of people. The staff was super nice and patient with us. We ordered a few pizzas and I thought they were delicious. They went fast however and they weren't too filling.  I wasn't crazy about some of the patrons. I got quite a few dirty looks on my way to the bathroom from hipster, androgynous females. Maybe it was the veil still attached to my head. Needless to say, they were quite uptight and kept me from mingling beyond my group.

X96dcFC547Z5vaqwwTWL-w.text: My crew and I were going to hit up Cibo before Margaret Cho last night, but they were already booked so we had to quickly search for an alternative. The powers of Yelp brought me to Hanny's, so that's where we went.   Conveniently located off of the light rail, we walked in and were seated immediately. The place is pretty swanky, so make sure you're dressed appropriately. We got a round table near the back and took a look at the menu. For a place that looks so awesome, the menu isn't as hard on the wallet as one might think. Most of us started off with cocktails, I had the Huckleberry lemonade ($9, and I actually had 2) which was delish. My other friends had the peach porch tea, the pomegranate julep (SO STRONG), and a Riesling. We were all starving when we got there so we got the bruschetta appertizers which is straight up bruschetta, there was no messing around with that.    Time to order: I had the carne pizza, and everyone else had the carne with red peppers, the prosciutto de parma (sp?), the standard blt, and the roast beef sandwich. Now, when I go to a swanky looking place and pay $9 for my drink, I assume that my $13 pizza isn't going to be anything to write home about, but first of all it was massive. The leftovers were enough for at least one meal. And even the salads and sandwiches that were going by our table were pretty big. The pizza was really good, not like anything I've had before, but really yummy. We swapped samples of everyone's stuff and everything was really good.  Our server was a tad slow, which we probably only noticed because we were in a crunch at the end to pay and make it to the theater in time, but he was really nice and split our checks at the end of the meal.

93pe1wEVoaQF2iieFLNqGg.text: Hannys! Since this is my first Yelp and I refuse to ever write a bad review on a place, I'm glad that Hanny's is my cherry popper for yelp.   Hanny's food is on point and it consistently served late at night. Which is nice for those of us who live downtown. The service is also top notch. Management greets me every time to see how my experience is going. I can't stop referring people to this place.---it's really cool inside and the bathrooms are pretty interesting--the foods great/served late--and it doesn't break the bank to eat there!   Drink=$5 bucks for a martini(vodka or whiskey---they serve smrinoff or makers mark)  Eats= Carne pizza, or copped salad (add shrimp)  keep it up Hanny's!

A0XMF8pR-Q4k5UH0ButuDQ.text: I really enjoyed Hanny's.  I never paid attention to the place but now that I've been, I am a fan. It is spacious inside with various types of seating - you can be at a table, a booth, by the bar or at one of the multiple social areas scattered throughout the floor.  The place looks a bit like a converted theater with a DJ on the 2nd level where you can see him through an opening in the wall.  There is some cool art around the restaurant too. There is also an old shaft-looking corner with a glass floor that looks quite cool.  I loved the modern yet low-key relaxed vibe that attracts a diverse crowd.  The food and drinks did not disappoint.  I only had a veggie pizza with a glass of wine but both were delicious.  I definitely would like to come back to enjoy more Hanny's.  The only thing that is a pain for anything downtown is the parking, but otherwise it is a lovely lovely place!

WbXM10B1yTsLJ-YeYLlyZw.text: Wow. Not a good place to go for a drink after work. I went for a work "Happy Hour" to Hanny's last weekend, and could not have been more put off  by the rude staff. I arrived and the group I was joining already had drinks, so I went to the bar to grab a drink.   I asked the bartender what their Happy Hour specials were and he looked at me as if I were an idiot and disdainfully said, "We don't have a Happy Hour (subtext: how terribly gauche of you to even ask), but here is our drink menu," and then shoved an overpriced wine list at me.  I was taken aback, but ordered a glass of pinot grigio, and then told him we were on the same ticket as the group right next to the bar. He said to me, "Well do you have a server?" and I replied, "I don't know, I just got here; can you please transfer this drink to that tab?" and he could not have been more rude or disgruntled about it. I'll add that there were a whopping two other people besides my group at the bar, so it's not like he was overwhelmed with other customers. With service like that, it's no wonder.  There are much better Happy Hour places you can check out after work - Fez, Switch, Cheuvront all come to mind - so skip the grouchy bartender 'tude and look elsewhere.

SAS_4FgwPoWLNQM2Tz2Ihw.text: WTF? I thought for sure I had reviewed this place. Whoops. Ok, I really love Hanny's. Like for real, it's almost creepy. You instantly feel cool as fuck upon walking into this bar. A huge part of that is the AWESOME FUCKING MUSIC playing on Friday's and Saturday's, but the other part is the lighting and interesting layout of the place. It's very unique and almost secretive. There's a weird basement downstairs that you can't get into, then upstairs is where the DJ spins incredible electronic music. There's another upstairs section with a separate bar and dining area, nice little spot to chill. You can overlook the restaurant, make sexual eye contact with the DJ, and flick water onto unsuspecting patrons. What! I have never done that. The bathrooms are kinda weird, at first I struggled on where I was supposed to go and how to open the door. It's even more difficult when you're hammered, but usually there's someone else up there wandering around wondering the same thing. Together, you'll probably figure it out. The drinks are very unique and strong. A good variety to choose from. A tad bit pricey, but it goes with the style of the bar. The food is great too. I've had their sandwiches, salads and pizzas. All were just delicious! I get very excited every time the suggestion of going to Hanny's come up during the weekend. I highly recommend this spot. :)  *Side note - only reason for 4 stars instead of the 5 - sometimes the staff can be a little snotty. At least 3 separate times I've had both bartenders and servers act kind of rude. Not anything terrible, especially for a person like me who isn't bothered by much, but just a tinge of an attitude. Eh, maybe it's a coincidence. I've also have several pleasant experiences, clearly. Hopefully it was just a bad day for these folks.

bLa0o3zdrn0mxLXN50LQow.text: I have been trying to will Hanny's into greatness for some time. Unfortunately, Hanny's is like a bad relationship; just because you really want it to be good doesn't mean it ever will be.  Sad sigh.   The food and service are sub-par, at best.   My most recent visit was for a friend's birthday party. Upon arriving we learned that the group would not be seated together, because her reservation was given to the owner's daughter who dropped in last minute with about 20 of her closest friends. Really Hanny's? Really?  I ordered the Roast Beef sandwich: Grilled Choice Ribeye, Nueske's Bacon, Arugula and a Fried Egg on Ciabatta Bread. Those are some of my favorite things! The result was a dry and blase sammy. We tried to order the doughnuts, hoping that something would redeem our dining experience, but the server informed us they were out of dough. Awesome.  I love the location, design elements, and drinks. However, Hanny's consistent failure to perform in the food and service categories will keep me from trying to make it work. A clean break is the best break-up strategy at this point.

-CMy_BMVPoe2zh0fVZ1bcg.text: Granted, I was smashed and had a giggle fit so bad I almost choked to death on my own tears, but I had a blast!  This guy who became my best friend, but whose name I never bothered to get, showed me around and I had an adventure!  I felt like a Goonie.  There's this abandoned elevator shaft with thick glass covering it so you can walk onto this platform and look down into this dizzying corridor like Jimmy Stewart climbing the stairs in Vertigo.  There was this totally abandoned upstairs with a bathroom area covered in mirrors.  Each bathroom or stall area was individual, so if you had to poop, you could totally do it in privacy, which for me is always a big thing because I get poopie stage fright sometimes and I really, really prefer to be alone.  The drinks I bought were cheap and not very expensive at all.  I think it was like $5.25 for a pretty strong gin and tonic.  It was such a fancy place, man, I was glad I just so happened to be wearing a collared shirt and pants without ketchupy finger stains.  After only going to dive bars or just drinking at home or at parties, Hanny's is a really great treat.  I wouldn't go there all the time, but if I had a friend coming in from out of town I would love to show them this place.

BEwm8tTxh7z9DtM-iK4S4w.text: I've always loved Hanny's and I'm going to go more often now because they cut down those trees. Screw those trees; I hope they launch a tree cutting service as a side business. We can all stand around the wood chipper toasting with our Moscow Mules. Hanny's forever!

IaSqHkUperu4vDOCCjLvSA.text: Love this place! From the neat building to the good food, and 1950s cocktails this place is a gem! Great place to go for a business dinner, date or a girls night. Gone on some nights when the Dj spins from above and have really enjoyed the ambience . My dinner there usually consists of the bar plate to start and a pizza and you can't go wrong with that. Plus do yourself a favor and order a cocktail. They always make an old fashion just right.

xS6PEvvxjAyfxs7Qw4iFpQ.text: This place is very relaxing.Great place to get some drinks and chill out. It can be expensive but not bad compared to the quality of service. I love it that the kitchen is open late night. I end up spending a lot of money here :)

MLS-4kPFVEOUseHpYDXyyQ.text: First time when I was here I really didn't like it, I guess because this place was new to all upscale look of downtown. Now I come here often with friends to grab a drink or food. Quality of food and drinks are really good, and good price. Don't be afraid to walk into Hannys this place will blow your mind

aYn0fzYU0eQ6TTq6E9281Q.text: What a wonderful place!  The atmosphere is great and the food is even better.  We dined here with some friends because of a recommendation of an out of town friend who just stumbled upon it while he was in town on business.  The service was top notch and again I cannot say enough positive things about the delicious food.  We will definitely be returning.

Abo7JJmqogjofG5kMJ0Hhg.text: Go for the old building and the history not the food. When and if you go, take a peek at the clear bottomless elevator with the endless mine shaft. ( Dizzy spell guaranteed)  and the bathrooms are a hoot. They are the old Dept store's dressing rooms. You don't even know where they are since the doors are painted with figures/pictures instead of signs. The upstairs has cool decorations on the wall. Loved the mirrored hallways. The mannequin art piece when you first walk in is pretty bizarre! Not sure the story behind that one. I wonder if it is an old store mannequin. The food is nothing to write home about. The Cauliflower App Caprese is pretty tasty and the Gongozola Cheese and Pistachio Slaw is yummers but the rest of our food was plain or terrible. Their menu is extremely limited,  Paninis and Pizza and only two entree choices. My friend got a pork Panini sandwich and she said it was so dry that it was really bad. I got a regular Panini and it was just ok.The bread was very dry and the sandwich was tasteless. The dessert menu looked good but we did not indulge. Seems like they have a pretty good drink menu so maybe a cool bar hangout instead of a meal choice pick? It does have a good location for downtown activities.

sA-7xRucbYwd0Lv9gKXF9Q.text: The sole reason for me signing up for Yelp was to comment on how amazing this place is. Wanted to do it up big for a date and I definetly dont regret chosing Hanny's over a various assortment of other date worthy spots.   Without commenting at length about the amazing vibe created by the subtle DJ spinning in the upper-deck, or the stunning visual asthetics provided by the funhouse of mirrors on your way to the bathroom lol, lets get to the food..  Decided to start the night off with a glass of the cabernet they had to offer and my god, soooo delicious. Ended up deciding to share a pizza with my date and ended up going with the prosciutto (sp?) pizza..lets just say if im ever on death row, ill have this pizza listed as my last meal. Im quite the carnivore when it comes to dining but when my waitress insisted i leave the arugala on the pizza, I just went with it and not surprisingly was blown away.   Finished the night off with a few martinis and I was in Heaven. Highhhhly recommend the pomegranate julep martini.   Overall, I couldnt speak anymore highly of this place. Part of me wants to keep this place a secret so I have a place to call my own, but whats the fun in that?! Enjoy!!!

n4g7d7YkfJwKTOWMjMVeeA.text: Really good service and food but loud hip hop music with vulgar language. I don't know if they play this type of music every Saturday night.

1Kxevsrt3YZ2pOt6FpbcMw.text: I love the ambiance of this place. The first time I came in, I felt like I was at some fancy bar in LA. They have an excellent selection of liquor and the drinks are always wonderful. I haven't tried the food. The thing I don't like is that it's very difficult to get the bartender's attention when trying to order a drink. One in particular is always rude on busy weekend nights. They also stop serving alcohol 30 minutes before bar close in Arizona, which was somewhat of an annoyance during my first visit. I had gone to the bathroom while my friends had all gone to the bar. I wasn't able to get a drink (after I had been standing there waiting to get a bartender's attention for a few minutes) because they had stopped serving. However, I noticed him then hand some other girl a beer...

wvo-phkokpMUxD031rwtGQ.text: Hanny's is the sexiest restaurant I have ever been to. It was a clothing store many years ago and has been revived as a beautiful restaurant. The food is quite good with a blend of usual and not so usual choices. Lovely wine selections and good service. The fresh flowers on the tables, cleanliness and re-purposed building give this place and A+. It is a snap to take the light rail to get there or walk to if you're downtown. It is also a magnificent place to people watch and hang out at the bar. You don't have to go to Scottsdale to hang out at a classy joint. This is it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. You can either sit in the middle of everything or hideout.
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great decor.
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious beat salad. Beautiful colors and vibrant flavor.

qjWFJTWdfFKBAMpAHm8Ijw.text: Real cocktails--like, actual cocktails. Amazing sazeracs. Delicious, fresh, gourmet pizzas. Great, happy serve staff. Trippy bathrooms.

2zqiUVoJGZK-WaaAQJMfRg.text: Great drinks , bar staff board , tired and pissed off . I didn't get a chance to try the food . To much server nose action , if you know what I mean . I,m not saying it was bad and I will go back , but hey guys make an effort .

aHmyavDXSz25YXhKoX18GA.text: It disappoints me to leave this place such a low review.  I've been coming here since it opened and this is by far the worst experience I've ever had.  I travel back and forth from Vegas to Phoenix for business, and every time I want to meet with friends we meet at Hanny's.  The food has always been the best!  Drinks are also great.  This night however was not about the dinner, it was more the service.    Our waiter Gabriel was utterly disrespectful.  It took us nearly 45 minutes to get our order in for food.  Two tables came in after we did and both received their drinks and food long before we even ordered ours.  On top of that, Gabriel only came to our table when we would call for him.  He walked past us and asked his other parties if they needed anything else while we continued to wait.  Very disappointed, I hope I never have to get him again.

l_68fJHc4jTWSFEYmwQgFg.text: My sister and I ended up here after First Friday last night, and I was surprised to find that the place wasn't packed like every other bar down town. One sip of my drink, however, and it all made sense.   Hanny's is a beautiful example of adaptive reuse and historic rehabilitation, but I think they went overboard with the modern decor. It feels cold and rather uninviting.   We were only there for drinks, which were reasonably priced but not so great. My sister's Pear-tini tasted like Nyquil, and my Ginger Creek was all whiskey and no ginger. We figured we just ordered the wrong things, so we went for dirty martinis for the second round. Priced at $5, it seems like a pretty good deal. However, I get better martinis at the Bikini, and that's with really crappy vodka and a pissed off bartender.  We had a good time exploring the place- the elevator shaft, the crazy bathrooms, the little make-out corner upstairs- but in the end, we both agreed that we should have gone to SideBar.   Lesson learned.

GkLkeSwn44b5qKMjZqdCRQ.text: I love the ambiance and the music here.  The DJ totally works the feel of the place.  They also mix up a mean Moscow Mule.  It is a bit pricy to binge drink or drown your sorrows in booze, but for a few cocktails and a bite with friends this is the place downtown.  Very chic and contemporary.     Great Date night option!

Wvz3sTFs4CzXEZu-W4oakg.text: First time trying Hanny's this past week and overall it was a nice experience. I love the building and history behind it. We received very fast and great service. The pizza's are great, I love the really thin almost cracker like crust. The roast beef sandwich was a good lunch and perfect portion. I will certainly return again.

U2isXF1bQfMLzNoixhnyMQ.text: I like everything about this place - the food, people, staff, and the atmosphere. Try the asparagus with a fried egg on top or any of the pizzas. They are all about the handcrafted cocktails here - try the moscow mule or a pimms cup.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

C1bd-267BuczREGn61MN_g.text: The owners of AZ88 and Hanny's are amazing! I only wish they would open up a third place in AZ, preferably in north Scottsdale. I love the atmosphere at Hanny's. The food is incredible. The fact that they have gluten free crust is even better. I do wish they served there amazing Az88 waffle fries or some other amazing French fry. The menu is a bit selective but wonderful. And of course they serve fabulous drinks:) Hanny's is great spot to enjoy a great time with friends with superb service, cocktails and food in a fashion focused environment

NkIUyZBTtT8YvzTc-UFETg.text: 5 stars, people! Not because we got stuff for free (we didn't) but because we had an authentic, knowledgable, and high quality experience with personality to boot. The upstairs bar is where it's at. Katie and Heather! Go see them. Katie runs a tight ship. We had cocktails, dinner, dessert, and made it to our concert in an hour. Best!

g-VTQnuWeLgUkK21ri4yhw.text: I had heard about this restaurant from a staff member at the Children's Museum!  See? This is where talking to random people can be a good thing.  My husband and I had a chance to go out on TWO date nights this week (thanks, in-laws!), and I'm glad we chose this restaurant as one of our date venues!.  The drinks are strong but good and the menu includes some cool throwback recipes from the 1940's. The appetizers were an appropriate serving size (we ordered the bar plate and the asparagus with egg), and my husband's pork milanese was fantastic- breaded and cooked perfectly. My vegetarian sandwich was okay- a little dry, so I would recommend incorporating some sort of sauce with the order.  I agree with some the reviewers who commented about the DJ and his choice of 80's music- it needs a little house electronica.

bAZfL6Kic0biA6egfw8VJg.text: I attempted to have my 50th birthday party there. No one answers the phone, and if you leave a message, no one responds. They shuffled my group of friends & family around from one corner in the back, then to the front. As more friends came in, wanting food and drink, the manager could have cared less. I was trying to get everyone in the same area instead of spread out all over the place? Nope, again, couldn't care less. My friends at the bar were ignored, or shamed by the female bartender. "Do you have Michelob Ultra?" my guest asked. The response from her..."As if!" He asked if they served anything comparable, where she promptly gave attitude, dropped a menu on the bar, and walked away. When one whole side of the restaurant opened I asked if we could all slide in there and was told, (even though they say NO RESERVATIONS), they were not available. No one sat down in the seats, so we just took them over. The food was okay, the drinks were great, the waiters were cool, and in the end, despite the manager and bartender, we made the best of it. I cannot recommend the place though because as a rule, as cool as it is, and as great as the cocktails and music are. the management sucks. If the managers cannot do their job, in a service industry, then the staff won't either.

SfX4O5WaZ724uEzkbo_IBQ.text: Gotta love a place open late in Phoenix. 2.50 petite martinis after midnite; yes please!

sybmJJcaKFbbubpZuOQ_Mg.text: I was at first impressed when we stopped in for a round of drinks on my birthday. Very swanky modern place with a fun and eclectic atmosphere and a great variety of drinks.   Our group had a $60 tab, which we paid, then moved on to another place. The next day I found out that our $60 tab got charged, as well as a second charge for $219! I called my bank and disputed the charges (which could take 10 days) and they recommended working with management at Hanny's to cancel the charges, so the funds could be returned within the hour. I found out that our server accidentally charged our card for the wrong tab, voided the transaction, and then said nothing to us (probably hoping the money would be returned to our account before we noticed).   When I called, the manager seemed nonchalant about the whole thing, never once apologized for what happened, and then said I shouldn't worry about it because they didn't actually charge my card and it would probably drop off on its own faster than he could contact his merchant services about it the following day. I still asked him to follow up, told him I'd appreciate his time, and reminded him we were talking about $220 here. He begrudgingly said he would and then didn't get back to me today. When I called, he obviously hadn't passed along the information to the other manager because he had zero knowledge of what had happened and the funds are still on hold 3 days later.   Happy birthday, right?! Hands down, a very frustrating experience and I'm not impressed with their customer service AT ALL. For the lack of concern their management and staff have for their patrons, I'd rather spend my money elsewhere.

eOFqiwQ_t0aYfTGIHLbo0A.text: Ambiance - 5. Food - 3. Service - 1. Went to Hanny's on a Tuesday night. It wasn't busy, but when we asked for a table for 8, it was like we were really putting them out. They sat us at a table for 6, so we crammed together. It's OK, we're all friends. The server didn't tell us her name the entire 2 hours we were there. She got pretty upset when one of the older people in our party (who could barely read the menu thanks to low lighting and presbyopia) didn't yet know what she wanted to drink. One member of our party ordered food while the server was taking drink orders, and that seemed to be a real inconvenience. Another member asked for a drink a certain way and was told he couldn't have it so (it wasn't a crazy request - less vermouth, please). She just seemed annoyed with us the entire time. We had told the staff that there might be a 9th person joining us, so they were apprised. When #9 did show up and sat in a chair at the next table (because there was barely anyone in the restaurant and our table was packed), I overheard the server talking about him sitting there when he "wasn't told" to do so. She then proceeded to tell the other server, "now we can't seat that table." They whisked away one of the two vacant tables, and I asked my friend to move to our table. When the server came back and I confronted her about it, telling her she simply could have asked #9 to move, she backtracked, saying that there was no problem. I replied with, "that's not the exchange I overheard." No apology, no explanation, just more backtracking. About 10-15 minutes later, they seated a party of 2 at the single table (which never had been occupied by any of us and there was plenty of room). Just really, really terrible service. I've been there a few times, have never really been blown away except by the cool old department store theme, but can't say I'll ever be back again if the decision's up to me.

ikgMLaYQ_RBUpvsg2DKlWQ.text: I love this place! We had a night out on Saturday and made the rounds at a few downtown spots. This place was our last stop before we called it quits at 1:30 a.m.  The food and drinks a great. Reasonably priced. The place has a lot of character too!   The bathrooms are interesting, so is that elevator thing. Dolls? Creepy.  Service is always good! I love that there is a place like this downtown.

0grPmE5Ly9t2roTIc3zSWQ.text: If you like store bought frozen pizza this is the place. Cause that what their pizza taste like.

Hy7dKaAINhWETqXTp2zXpg.text: Overall classy experience! Great customer service, good food menu, and amazing drink options. Located in a great central location downtown, Hanny's is a great spot to go eat, drink, and hangout.

Vfgw_L6Xk8R9sVpoI2v8fQ.text: Worst Service and staff on planet earth. Th bartender was rude, annoying and should be on a suicide watch list. "we are busy so you get what you get! take my card if you want to talk"  was the manager's response when we informed him that the bartender rejected our order of drinks. If you can't handle a Sunday evening crowd, then you probably shouldn't be in business. Nothing should warrant that type of bad service! stay at home or close your doors if people coming into your bar annoys you. As a paying customer, I expect some level of customer service which obviously you know nothing about otherwise you would be happy when you see a good crowd in your bar.   If bad service and annoying staff is your thing, then this place might be good for you otherwise stay away. If you're like the rest of us looking for a good place to catch up with friend or make new one, do yourself a favor and choose another place. McDonalds might be a better choice.    A bar should serve drinks not attitude!!!

UzVrI9NtbfulK4w5knNyUw.text: LOVE Hanny's!! I've been coming here since I moved to Phoenix a couple years ago and I have zero complaints. You ABSOLUTELY MUST try the arugula/prosciutto pizza, it is to die for, no joke, if you were to eat a pizza in heaven I'm 99% sure that's what it would taste like. Can't go wrong with the Martinis either... And if that wasn't enough the atmosphere is great... Make sure to go upstairs and also down to the basement... Trust me ;)

XGE3nxbV5mzGE3HxNbSAmQ.text: It's the place to be.   I went before heading over to Symphony Hall and seeing Ballet AZ perform Giselle. Having heard great reviews about the place, it's food and the vibe... I had to try it.  Restored into a restaurant and bar from an old department store, Hanny's has the feel straight of of New York City. The lighting is dim enough to give that sexy, intimate feelings and with long, pew style seating with individual tables, the vibe is very posh.  My roommate and I ordered the bruscetta plate and the margarita pizza. Very good choice! The bruscetta plate was on the saltier side, so be wary of that but it was delish. The pizza was much bigger than we expected. For $10 you really do get a good deal.   We each orded drinks. A orded the peach martini and a glass of giseling. Wasn't a HUGE fan of the martini and I thought it tasted like cough syrup but it was also my very first martini so I am not holding Hannys against anything. My roommate on the other hand said it was the best Manhattan he'd ever had, which I believe.  Hannys has a modern feel with a touch of Mad Men and I simply cannot wait to go back.

r6_sbH_YPFmOJFr8W1KzEg.text: If anyone ever says to me that downtown Phoenix doesn't have cool bars, I'll send them to Hanny's.  The sister restaurant to AZ 88 is chic and totally has a Manhattan vibe, with its minimalist, modern decor and live music.  The spot is comprised of several stories, with the main restaurant and bar on the middle floors.   I had a Pimm's Cup, one of the bar's specialties, and a mojito.  The drinks are smaller portions than you might be used to, but that's how Hanny's does all their cocktails.  We shared a Bar Plate ($8.50), which is great if you love prosciutto, since there's a ton of it. It also comes with bread, cheese, olives and nuts-perfect to pair cocktails with.  My side salad ($4.50) was OK, but I wish the place served ranch dressing. I wasn't super-crazy about the Dijon vinaigrette.  And despite how much I love the cool vibe of Hanny's, the regular menu is so disappointing. If you don't like sandwiches, you're stuck with a salad or flat bread pizza. We ordered one with olives  ($12), and while I loved the cheese, it tasted more like a cracker than pizza.  The pizzas are just mediocre-I could make a better one myself, and I don't even cook. I would love if Hannny's expanded its menu or made thick-crust pizzas. Maybe if it had more to offer food-wise, the restaurant would become more popular.  I absolutely love the tiramisu ($7) at Hanny's, though, and the great music by the DJ's distracted from the so-so food. I really appreciate the live music and think Hanny's has great potential to become a bustling bar.

nJCTbJG72Y3RvxGWgMev7Q.text: Well My wife and I spend ALOT of money eating out in Downtown Phoenix as we LOVE IT! But WOW...in reality some of the WORST service and dinning experience My wife and I have EVER had at a restaurant in our LIVES!!! EATER BEWARE!!!! We both were guesting at the convention center and brought first time guests there for a peaceful nice evening celebrating dinner and My birthday and was immediately ruined by patrons throwing drinks on all us and our guests and laughing it off as if it was a regular thing that occurs at this establishment and the staff couldn't have cared less! The alcoholic drinks spilled on us went all over ALL of our food and clothing and set the tone for the rest of the evening and even after speaking with the Manager seemed to not even phase their attitude towards the whole situation. They treated us as if they wanted to get us out of there as fast as possible. Our waitress was not attentive if she was even awake at all. Drinks took way too long for Bar/Restaurant in the middle of Downtown Phoenix! They need to get their act together if they are going to stay in business, in all honesty better service at Hooters(don't waste your money here). Or maybe they have an owner that just cares about how much money they are making and not about their customers. And yet still had the nerve to act as if it was acceptable. After the drinks were spilled, they had to remake ALL 6 of our meals and only removed one from our bill. I'd expect this treatment from a 1 star restaurant but Hanny's has convinced us to NEVER dine or recommend to anyone ever again! Food was sanitary at best if you want fresh-frozen pizza. Gordon Ramsey would have a field day with this place. Don't let Hanny's art decorum fool you either, it's a distraction from their REAL issues...Quality. It's Restaurants like this that make so many others look inviting to try. Thank You Hanny's Staff for showing us the real you and saving us money from your disgusting establishment.

U94AlLT5Y9WnPZsZ2LDypw.text: Really my favorite downtown restaurant.  The food is very nice, the drinks menu is awesome, the staff is unique...keep an open mind and this will be your favorite too!

Z7dBTNtz6oTBdcESFbcCTA.text: By Far my WORST dining experience period!!! STAY AWAY....   On a Sunday night to meet up with friends for drinks and apps at Hanny's downtown Phoenix, I unfortunetaly encountered a bartender who had a meltdown before my eyes.... I know it sounds like an exagerration, but literally on two seperate occassions within a 30 minute period slammed someones credit card down and stormed out of the bar area, and on the second incident his poor towel got the same treatment.  After our party picked our jaws off of the floor we called over a waitress to get some type of assistance in the matter, and so that she can get the manager for us, after rolling her eyes and screaming "WHAT", she rudely explained that she doesnt have time for us, nor does the manager... And she was right the General Manager said and I quote "I do not have time for chit chat, if you have a complaint call the restaurant" and stormed off.  By the way I am at home from work due to food poisioning from the Shrimp Prosciutto that took 43 minutes to arrive, the severe stomach cramping and diarrhea that started at about 3 am was just the icing on the cake.   And just to give you some background, I dine out frequently, over the past week Wildfish, Bungalow, Vincents, and Wendy's lol and I have a strong understaning of good customer service, and basic human interaction, and this place is lacking in all of the above.  STAY AWAY

cYpGbxgwNWE9GTN57t-52g.text: This place is fantastic! It has a fun atmosphere, great martinis, amazing pizza and fantastic salads! I also love its back store, having been a department store many years ago. The bathroom/fun house mirrors are definitely a trip and you gotta check out the widely known creepy dolls in the basement.

pWDDqiuvp8YR-5D0LI1GUQ.text: This place is awesome. Used to be an old shopping store and converted into a restaurant. Very classy feel to it and cool bar to have a drink at.   Pizza was crisp and fresh ingredients like prosciutto!   Service was amazing and very friendly and attentive. Never got low on my drink and Bianca (server) went above and beyond just to grab me some garlic powder from the kitchen.   All in all, GET YOUR ASSES HERE!

Smcf93f5OxtwQON0Pvc1qA.text: Came here with a group of 6 on a Saturday night around 10pm.  Place has a really cool vibe and was packed.  We got a reservation upon arriving and waited around 30 minutes to be seated.  Enough time to grab a cocktail upstairs and checkout a cool setup they have with mirrors.  Once seated, we split a few pizzas amongst us - the best ones were the mushroom and sausage pie and the prosciutto and arugula pie.  Service was very slow and we had to wait almost 30 minutes from the time we asked for our check and when we actually closed out.  I'll come back again but probably during a time when the service is a little more timely.

bbNO83nT0k0eYEivW0FWsA.text: My favorite place downtown! I love bringing people who haven't been here so that I can show them all of the unique touches this restaurant has! I don't think I've ever had a bad experience here. Good for big parties, great people watching too! Simple menu and reasonably priced! This place could be packed and you will still receive great service!

Ih654eXDIqhKz47_1CUEng.text: This is a refurbished department store turned trendy restaurant/wine bar. It is eclectic and even if you're not in the mood for food or drink, stop in and take a walk to the basement and/or upstairs, you will not be disappointed. On their menu, they have a great prosciutto plate, and I enjoyed the Riesling.

FhySt-SgMJ7F3EOOVZjZPw.text: Had a great time here. Accommodating and friendly staff with really good pizza! (And drinks)

1PbT5PEb4uE3xQ_LW7MYYA.text: I came here with a group of 30 people. I didn't like that they didn't take reservations.  I came 30-45 minutes early to tell the restaurant staff that our party would be coming and if they could sit all 30 of us. The hostess said sure. When everyone comes she's no where to be found and they start scrambling to get us seated. I'm not sure what happened there but you would think she would have better prepared for a large group.   The food was good. I had a mule and I did like the cucumber in it. Very refreshing.   The place is unique. Check out the elevator shaft! I was told by my coworkers to avoid the restrooms.

7Q-FrFyIdHvGHLWQ15aGBg.text: They are overpriced and they under-delivered. I ordered a gorgonzola-topped ribeye and received a gristley steak that looked liked something they would serve if you ordered a steak at IHOP. They didn't crumble the gorgonzola and let it melt onto the steak, but instead just cut of a giant chunk and threw in on the steak after letting it cool down a bit. Crumbling it myself wasn't possibly, because my server didn't have the wherewithal to even bring me any silverware.   To top it all off, my server didn't inform me that soft drinks do not include free refills, which resulted in a $9 upcharge for 3 tiny glasses of diet coke. My server's response of, "that's my bad Chief," didn't actually help anything.   My advice, go to IHOP and get a steak there. They have free refills and they will bring you silverware before calling you Chief.

LjVMrthkss8PLkkNiMkv2Q.text: Hanny's is an ideal meeting spot downtown for people that don't often visit downtown. It has a lot of character, I won't dwell on the basement, we all know about the basement (OK, well if you don't know there is a coven of creepy dolls which congregate behind a fence, why? I'm not sure exactly).   Hanny's is more than the dolls, but not much more. The food is reasonably priced and it shows in the quality. That's not to say that the food isn't good but that's not the draw. The real reason to come to Hanny's is the atmosphere and the 5$ martinis.   Speaking of 5$ martinis I had an awkward exchange with a bartender here one time when I asked for a dirty martini straight up, he went on to inquire if I wanted that "on the rocks". Confused, I bantered back with him for about 5 minutes before he finally understood, it wasn't the misunderstanding that bothered me, it was the arrogance. Over the years I have come to understand that this type of hipster service is consistent at this establishment.  Regardless, I will continue to frequent Hanny's, it's centrally located, there is usually a good DJ up in the booth and the food is decently priced (they also have gluten free options).   Take the elevator or stairs up to the bathrooms on the 2nd floor. Pro Tip: The doors to all the bathrooms open inward, PUSHING is the key here.

fsdUAC6mK3aS8QblzgZ66w.text: I love this place! The atmosphere and vibe is great. Food is a bit pricey  BUT it's worth it for such a grown and sexy spot!

f9gDGEO_qXesmv8Snaw7-g.text: Awful. I would pass on going here. The cocktails are good, and the ambiance is interesting. The food is mediocre and the wait staff is terrible. We ordered two cocktails, and a pizza for a quick bite. Our waitress was incredibly rude, and barely looked us in the eye- Very inattentive and incredibly impersonal . No one came back to our table after being served. We had to track down the manager to get our check who acted as though it was inconvenient for him. Very disappointing for us.

x3JpW_xa_RXy3g6gJPG7nw.text: Food was great. Had the margherita pizza.  I'm sorry my friend and I just sat down at a table in your section. No reason to be a rude ass for the entire dining experience.   Never heard of a "blood and sand" in your 12 years of bartending and your bartender's 20 some years of experience? The drink has been around longer than your collective bartending experience. Doesn't mean it doesn't exist.  Don't tell me you don't have cherry liqueur when it's listed on your damn menu.   This server was the worst.

qCywLropC_Fw1m41e1PQrw.text: It would be a good first date. Service was kind. The food did not take to long. I order the Marx Salad and it was incredible. My friend order the Quatro Pizza it was a good advice given to us by the waiter! It cost about 26 dollars per person. We would highly recommend Hanny's for dates.

luSkMrss9MpTi89v1-L6wA.text: This week the Jolly Diners headed over to Hanny's on 40 N. 1st St. in Phoenix. Hanny's was a men's store in the 1940s, so some of the signage on the inside of the building still has men's clothing designers and relates to men's clothing. The clothing store was also named Hanny's. They have a great menu, fantastic service, the ambiance is pretty nice, and the food delicious! My mother had a BLT which had Wisconsin bacon on it. My sister had Gorgonzola coleslaw, which came in a huge portion. I had a portobello ciabatta sandwich made vegan, and a side of string onions. For appetizers we had bruschetta which had more of a tapenade kind of topping, and cauliflowerwiith string onions that had the most delicious fired taste It was really good. As were leaving, my mom wanted a picture of the front of the building. As I snapped the photo I noticed a bluish baby sitting on the ledge of an outside window. I called later to ask what that was all about and was told that actually the building has multiple floors which we missed completely. The basement floor has an art gallery. Jen explained that it would be very difficult to explain the blue baby without first seeing the art display in the basement. We'll go back to see that sometime. The Jolly Diners rated or experience at Hanny's as a well earned five out of five.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Men&#39;s signage
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Men&#39;s signage
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BLT with bacon impoted from Wisconsin

Zcl_rm0rFcOx_tay6o7QfQ.text: Place looks nice....and thats pretty much it. So me and colleague wanted to try this place. The bar tender...man with the doctor's coat  approached and {without saying hi} asked what we would like to order. My buddy was thinking about pizza but asked the bartender's opinion. The guy in the white coat said the pizza is good...and that's it. We ended up getting pizzas  one with prociutto and the other with meat, both very mediocre. The worst part is the guy could not care less about us even though there was nobody there on a monday...what he did care is the  barback  vaping (thinking we did not see him). Alas, this proves the point, the place is mediocre at best, the service is lacking like they have never been trained. Bottom line of the story...skip this joint and go somewhere else!

DhvTgviZe52LNkFi3YDLeA.text: I got into Phoenix on a late flight and I was looking for something tasty downtown around midnight - a much bleaker prospect than I really expected. As I was regretting passing up the  Bojangles Chicken I passed while running between planes on my layover,  I saw Hanny's big silver sign like a beacon in the desert night.   I had been to Hanny's previously while in town for a friend's wedding and I remembered two things - they have good wine and they decorate with some creepy stuff. Undaunted by the displays of old dolls in cages, I headed inside and tried to remember what I had to eat the last time I was there.   They quickly seated me and after ordering my food came out soon after I ordered.  I sat  in a booth and enjoyed the dimly lit dining room with the house DJ setting a loungey vibe.   I got a veggie pizza and it was delicious. The thin was very crispy and there was the right amount of cheese sauce and toppings. There was at least enough for two people, so I wasn't able to finish it, but that left me with enough for breakfast in the morning.  Topping it off with a nice glass of Pinot noir made for a very solid meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Here&#39;s what you find if you venture downstairs.

AYwE7r98mL5TdQpdjjvOew.text: I came here a long time ago when the menu was much more extensive. Now, it's mostly lighter fare, which made me sad--I miss the mac and cheese! They offer sandwiches and pizza really. My bf had a meatlovers pizza, which was the best dish out of the 7 we had tried that night. The sandwiches were okay, nothing much to shout about, I found mine quite dry, so I had to request for a side of mayo. The side of coleslaw didn't really taste like how coleslaw should taste (it wasn't sweet) but the crispy string onions were good at least. For the price, I expected better quality of food. I don't think I'd return back here again unless they do better, food-wise or maybe perhaps if they have a good happy hour. My friends and I didn't really enjoy our food that much for what we paid.

Q9ueEvrFUKuUXpDD4j9NEA.text: Such a unique place! The food was great. Giardiniera pizza is must. The crust was crispy and the flavor just the perfect balance of sweet and spicy. The beet salad was crisp with a hearty serving of red and golden beets. I want to come back ASAP!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is all that was left from our Giardiniera pizza! Delicious!

Bnf6bIbvgJFadJsiRUqLpg.text: Hanny's was one of the more interesting establishments that we visited in Phoenix. At first glance, it doesn't seem like anything special. Apparently, it is a converted department store, which explains its relatively neutral, unimpressive exterior. When we walked in however, we were pleasantly surprised. On the ground level, modern and chic decor certainly gave off a more upscale vibe. But the restaurant's decor just kept us guessing. Walk down the flight of stairs near the entrance of the restaurant and you'll find an eerie display of dolls that frankly is enough to give you a chill up your spine. Walk up to the Mezzanine level, and you'll find walls of mirrors and bright, colorful LED lights that is more reminiscent of a fun-house themed club.  The service was pretty good. They were attentive and efficient in checking on our table of 11.  The food was moderately price for the portion sizes. I had fairly high expectations given the overall decor of the restaurant, but was underwhelmed with the Carne Pizza and the Chopped Salad. The pizza was unpleasantly oily and I found myself wishing I had several napkins to blot out the extra oil. The salad was well dressed, but nothing extraordinary. The drinks, on the other hand, were the centerpiece of the meal. I had the Moscow Mule and it was absolutely delicious! If I ever go back, I would definitely order a couple of those!

7J1PPpttt6lcMcVOWo36KA.text: Great bar, great blue cheese olives! Loved the vine. Started at the upstairs bar, ended up downstairs. Gay friendly atmosphere. Had a blassssssst!

kICr1p8Nx051NWNynhoMSg.text: Love Hanny's! Went for lunch today and had the roast beef sandwich. The egg in the sandwich really made the sandwich great. Their coleslaw is incredible. Highly recommend!

I also love the mirrors on the top floor with color changing lights. Perfect for Instagram photos.   They also have a underground basement which is creepy!!! But I recommend to stop by. You don't have to eat or get a drink. The staff are used to people viewing the dolls and beautiful art structure.   Try the broken elevator for some excitement!

q8tQh_rtSwlKJsHf9P7T2g.text: This is a very interesting restaurant that has a few eye catching displays and bathroom that is very trippy     Came here on a Sunday night and was seated right away I can see if it was a busier day a reservation will be needed. The bar in the middle seems like the main attraction of this place that also serves absinthe by the way. The server we had was very helpful but seemed to be busy.   The couch style seats caught me off guard cause when I leaned back it scared me as they reclined lol. We stared off with the egg asparagus which was really good.  For the main course we had the carne pizza which we could of had more of.  The crust was perfect and the flavors were pretty good   After eating we went and explored the place. The bathrooms look confusing to get into with the mirrors and lights.  When you get inside the bathroom it lights up a certain color inside depending which one you enter.  When you come back down there's a area that looks like a empty elevator shaft that you can stand inside and look down a few floors.   Now let's not forget the weirdest part of this place the dolls downstairs that are creepy and sitting at a table. Seems like a modern place and fun place to come back to.

One of the tables even called him out for his unprofessionalism... I'll come back again since it was my first bad experience out of so many other times

U0gr8ueLN1A7wpPNShaLgw.text: Hanny's has been on my list of places to check out for quite some time, partly because I've heard great things about it from other people, and partly because most yelp reviews are pretty positive about this place. I was downtown anyways, so I finally got to stop and check it out. It was okay. Maybe it just didn't live up to all the hype I had heard about it but my experience was simply an average one.   We stopped in around 9pm on a Saturday and only had to wait a minute or two to be seated, which was awesome. Upon being seated, it took about ten minutes for our waiter to appear to greet us and bring waters. Look, I get it's a Saturday night and busy, but the service was pretty slow for the entire meal. On the plus side, our waiter was very nice and didn't make either of us feel like second class citizens when neither of us ordered an alcoholic beverage (which sadly, I've experienced several times at other establishments).   On to the food.. while reading the menu some dishes sounded interesting, but I ended up with the grilled cheese, add avocado, and the crispy onion strings as a side. It was alright. Edible, but not worth the price in my opinion. We also had the Margherita pizza which came on super thin crust and was again, alright. Edible but definitely nothing to write home about. For close to $40 for the whole meal I couldn't help but feel like it wasn't money well spent.   The overall vibe of the place is interesting and probably depends on what kind of scene you are into. It's definitely a hip venue but it felt a little pretentious to me. Everyone was friendly enough, but I still got the feeling that maybe they didn't think I was cool enough to be there. Just my opinion.   The most notable part about this place is the unisex bathrooms, complete with neon lighting upstairs, where hoards of girls were taking Instagram photos. Hey, I'm all for finding a good IG, but I have a feeling this is what lures in a lot of their customers.   Overall, if you want a drink in a cool place or need late night food and are downtown, this place works, but I doubt I'll be returning unless someone else makes the call to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled cheese with avocado

Vov1aNOOjZs3qcxMjjPn5w.text: Try the Prosciutto pizza. Absolutely amazing. Thin crust, oven baked perfection. $7 martinis are great as is the food price point. Pizza's are big enough for two and well worth the visit. Space is a converted department store and has a cool vibe.

cCJPjPaJP7_a66x5hcxg7A.text: Hannys has a great atmosphere, food is very tasty and the price matches the quality of the food and alcohol. It's in a great location with lots of other places to check out. The staff was very polite and friendly.   The basement has caged up dolls which is creepy but fun and unique. It's a great date night place. I will definitely be returning in the near future!
