Love the HH and the people watching is usually a highlight of the night.

XO79XGIW0W-K4tVgGis2iw.text: Love kaci she's sweet! Bathrooms are crazy as well as the basement! Try the hot honey pepperoni ! Ask for kaci, some of the other bartenders are not very nice

r1K-toNiIaWLtK6uOdpgYw.text: Met several friends here after a conference. The place itself has a great vibe. A little on the loud side. Placed drink orders and ordered a appetizer. waitress asked if we were ready to order, we were not so we requested extra time. She appeared to be inconvenienced by this. She stopped back and we placed our order. We waited for about 45 minutes, still no appetizers. However about that time our meals were served. We inquired about the appetizer and the waitress stated that she didn't remember us ordering it, interesting because when we ordered the appetizer she suggested added additional items because their were five in our party. She offered to place the appetizer order again, not even an apology. We didn't reorder for obvious reasons.  All that aside, we were all completely satisfied with the quality of our meals. The food was delicious! I am not sure I will revisit here, the actual food service we received was disappointing and had a negative impact on our dining experience.

UDWP3BW1h3WQHiXtl5ASuA.text: Hanny's is like a second home. A late night second home with very strong drinks.   Food at times is a hit and miss, as well as their services. At times, servers can be very rude and don't check up very often. Other times, they are great!   Their carne pizza is my favorite and their beet salad with shrimp is awesome as well. Great spot for late night snacks, strong drinks, and good music.

kZBU4TRbKaLTXZAFT6b8qg.text: Happy we were able to find a comfortable, high-top table by the window late on a Sat. night after seeing a comedy show downtown.  Loud, bar atmosphere, but still able to converse without too much trouble.   Pizzas highly recommended...our party got both veggie & meat varieties...everyone thought they were yummy...thin crust, crispy & loaded with items...very tasty, & reasonably priced!  Drinks were decent; big disappointment  was for our designated driver...his diet Coke not only was expired, it was overpriced for one tiny bottle...NO REFILLS...The DD should get more respect!  But we love the quirkiness of the place...be sure to check out the completely random & bizarre basement display & the creepy, glass bottomed vintage elevator!

JVldhH6219YI0ibUBXI28Q.text: The sexiest spot in downtown Phoenix! This place will put you in the SCHMOOD! Drinks are on point along with the food. Superb customer service and beautiful ambiance. My favorite favorite favorite thing I loved was the non gender bathroom with the sexy lights and mirrors! I give this place 20 STARS!! Super fun date spot and thank me later.

Ob_FvhvyPX0Vn9S6IbejVA.text: If I could give negative stars, than I would give this place a fat -16 . I really couldn't tell you who our server actually was because it appeared that 4-5 different people tag teamed our table. I'm currently still waiting for my food , along with 3 others and 2 people at our table have already been served , and finished eating. I typically am one of those people who am very respectful to servers because I have spent years working in the industry but this server will without a doubt understand how I felt about my experience here when they ( whoever they are ) lay there eyes on the lack of tip on the bill. I will never come here again, I'll probably never dine anywhere on 1st street again just because of how horrible my experience was here. So I'll end with this, if you ever are invited to a birthday dinner or something along those lines and it is being hosted at Hannys, you most definitely 100% should be sick that day.

sOT1YfD3FKGL-8jizNvGqQ.text: I adore Hanny's, which is ironically why I haven't reviewed them yet. This is my go to spot for special occasions i.e. my birthday last year, my New Year's Eve last year, and for delicious meals and drinks late at night.   I can't find anything wrong with Hanny's. Their pizzas are perfect, the cocktails are superb and the ambiance is dark, moody, chic, and comfortable. I can't get enough.   Sigh... I need a dirty martini and the gorgonzola slaw, stat.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar Plate
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cosmo and Martini with a twist

Q7lExUibsxUJqyWdMSaPVw.text: Great chill Lounge vibe with occasional upbeat R&B component. I haven't eaten there yet, but the food looks decent.

qeUS-T4QFRp7XULPTiFD4Q.text: The food was special ... Carne pizza and cauliflower app.  Just tasty.   You can tell by the cracker crust on the pizza that they are paying attention to the small stuff.  The cauliflower app has shoe string onions and fried (pan) veggie.   Just a great place to stop in for a drink and a snack (or dinner).  I enjoyed every bite of the pizza.  The flavor was spot on and made me want another and another bite.   Music and atmosphere is eclectic but interesting.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne pizza
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cauliflower app

_6UE3derSXiSKizC37lbdg.text: I thought this would be a cool spot to check out since it was formerly a clothing department store. We went as a big group for a friend's birthday and we were seated upstairs in a quiet and quaint area. The booths were really unique and they lean back if you applied enough pressure.  We sat across the room from the DJ who was playing mellow deep house. There was also a really grungy looking elevator shaft which looked like it was still under construction. It made the space look very gentrified and hipster. The bathrooms were also unique as though you're walking through a modern art mirror exhibit. Downstairs in the basement was a table of creepy dolls hanging out. Chuckie's kind of party.   I wanted to try their rock candy Caiprinha because of its novelty. When I got the drink, I could barely swallow the first sip. Thinking it was just me, I passed it around the table and everyone gave a similar reaction. Not wanting to send my drink back, I just asked for some ginger beer to douse the drink which made it slightly better.  For appetizer, we had the shrimp prosciutto. The shrimp were large and very scrumptious. For entree, we ordered a margherita  pizza. It was super thin crust as though the crust was on a diet war against carbs. I wasn't particularly impressed.  Hanny's definitely has potential, perhaps I'll give it another chance in the future.

E233Pqyp_AjeKY95Pjt7Lg.text: Love Love Love Hanny's. You can't go wrong with a martini they're to die for. The place is super dark and the music there is always the best. I need to talk to the DJ and get each and every ones playlist. I had the prosciutto pizza with arugula. Pizza is thin and average size but it was overall really good. If you have to wait a while go upstairs to the hidden little bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arugula and prosciutto pizza

R7R5VAebTazUWRbKV0XE2g.text: Food was good, drinks were great. A little pricey, but they were open super late on a week night. The dolls were kinda creepy so I didn't go downstairs buy the bathroom lights were super dope and ready for the Gram.

zJgjNWWUdJxKN3-5goVvmA.text: Very weird. But in an awesome way! Great food and cocktails! Never been so confused when it comes to bathrooms before.

93D0fPLV44U-cKy6e4h90Q.text: Last night my wife and I stayed at the hotel across the street from Hanny's and I heard they had good pizza so I decided to pop over and give it a try at lunch today. Being from the Chicago Metro area, I haven't found a single pizza joint in Arizona that is more than just okay. Thank the lord I tried Hanny's. HOLY COW!!! Their pizza is fantastic. Full disclosure, Chicago is famous for their deep dish, but has tons of great NY Style pizza which is my personal favorite. This isn't a deep dish pizza review. Hanny's has incredible NY Style pizza. The cracker crust was fantastic. Just the right amount of crunch without going overboard. I don't know what kind of cheese mixture they use, but it is delicious. The sauce is equally delicious. I took the pizza back to my hotel room and they provided small containers of parmesan cheese, red peppers, and some oregano. I sprinkled a little of all three on and had pizza perfection.   Sadly, I live just outside of Tucson on the far southeast side and nowhere near Hanny's. It will now be a mandatory stop whenever we are in Phoenix. So glad to have found a legitimately solid pizza joint in Arizona.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6kOdIHOeSLM4PnakVhOVjg.text: The seating area is too open. Is a very noisy venue.  The food is unremarkable. The kitchen seems to take its duties as perfunctory. The wait staff seems preoccupied as well.  It is very "cool" judging from the number of young pretty people. I think the concept of basing it on the store that had been there previously is interesting but I don't think that the artistic execution was either all that well thought-out or well executed. The show windows are mainly confusing and there is not enough homage paid to the roots in the rest of the what should be a global presentation. Overall, I would give it a qualified meh.

UvVaZzVwYi6-tKZxO7sQZg.text: The staff was friendly to me, the drinks were great. The only reason I'm giving 4 out of 5 is because the prices are absurd for what your getting. $12 Bellini is worth it if I got more for my drink, not a small champagne flute full. The bar tenders were really nice, and it's not their fault the drinks are small, but come for the food and get the water

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZVcS4RnBQuaLnv-OnIllUQ.text: One of my favorite spots in all of Phoenix. Want a really good martini? Come here, my favorite is the st germain, holy martini is this one good! Suggested it to a handful of people, all pleased with the outcome! Only my lady friends and I like the appletini - very girl friendly! Usually is garnished with an apple slice on top which is the perfect ending of this sweet drink. The pizzas are amazing, thin crust pizza - you'll see everyone with one! So so good, if you're a meat lover like me, you'll enjoy the carne:) I also love the simple house salad they have. Dressing is light, but favorable. I usually will start with that if not the onion strings. Those are delicious! Comes with plenty! This place is modern, cool music at night, always a good vibe. I go here all the time, and I'll continue going all the time! Love it here!

cO12sijBAgGEyI2_hE2ZOg.text: Huge hit with visiting guests .  An eclectic metropolitan place in the heart of downtown Phoenix. Worth a trip, great for visitors.   What I like: the whole concept of turning a department store from the 1940's into a restaurant, but keeping or reinterpreting some of the original design features. staff is friendly, menu small but big enough to find something - it's Italianesque, think wine bar food but huge portions. They use San Marzano tomato sauce on pizza, which means they are trying to be authentic.  Why it's quirky: the glass floored elevator shaft, the last supper recreated with porcelain dolls in the basement, the unisex bathrooms in all their 1985 neon lighting and night club pounding music glory,   What's so so - the food was okay, they definitely try to be upscale, i've just had similar dishes at local places like the Vig or North, that were a notch up. My meal was under 30 and that included a drink and dessert, so overall a good deal.  And I would come back if I was downtown for a show in an upscale setting.  Unless you live downtown, I don't see there's much of a reason to become a regular, but it was a huge hit with our out of town guests.

sFLjrTxJwu06iSHGWYT2aQ.text: Late night spot, we accidentally came here to eat.. Saw it next to our hotel.. Didn't expect the place to look so trendy. And having all these cool sightseeing spots upstairs, the elevator, and downstairs where u see thaw creepy dolls. Made our trip very entertaining .. The food was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9nFlfxuXeqPrwcvoWM5mzQ.text: Hannys has gotten much better over the years.  The mushroom pizza is pretty delicious.  They do a great job of accommodating large groups.  The DJs are great and the drinks are strong.

FafvYpbptdhix99hfHCCHA.text: I'm bummed about all the poopy reviews of this place. Granted, we went on a rainy Sunday night, so the place was dead, but no complaints about the food or service. In fact, the pizza is awesome -- reminds me of Tuchetti's (R.I.P.) yummy thin crust/flatbread creation. The bruschetta consisted of big chunks of green and kalamata olives and fresh bread, not some crappy olive tampenade. Seriously delicious. The decor, as others have mentioned, is killer - so interesting and different. The upstairs, with its fun house of mirrors, is potentially confusing if you're shitfaced, but oh well. The bathrooms are unmarked and unisex and I did hear one of my female companions squealing about poop in one, but again, oh well.   I will definitely go here again, although I agree in that it's not exactly cheap -- save your binge drinking for the Bikini.

kqGHbKIT-tkLd6jY3PGBew.text: That pizza is supposed to be thin. So many of you self appointed experts really show your True colors, I swear. That pizza is delicious. I will gobble that carne harder than your mom gobbles carne on 9th st and Van Buren. All of that aside it gets fucking busy there and sometimes takes a second to get drink but that's because everyone wants to be there. If you want to have an easy time where you get more attention check it out for lunch or Sunday dinner. They even run a couple of specials on Sundays. Also $5 martinis. Also $5 martinis. Also $5 martinis. Do I need to repeat myself again? To the girl who said her martini was too strong, you should probably read up on what a fucking martini is before you ever order on a bar, especially a classier establishment, ever again. These are classic cocktails or takes on classic cocktails, they're supposed to be strong and a martini is straight fucking liquor, duh you dumb broad. Try the chopped salad it'll blow your dick off.

7e0bZYtcPG0cw1ouKlQhZg.text: What can beat an Old Fashioned cocktail and a plate of piping hot donuts? Nothing...  We came here after dinner with some friends and had a great time with a couple cocktails and dessert at the bar. The service was great and the bartender was really friendly. I mean, who suggests an Old Fashioned to someone under 60??? Yet he knew his mixes and the menu cocktail went well with the donuts.   In fact I liked the OF so much I ordered one a few days later at another bar and was looked at like I was nuts... but that is another review...  The place is pretty swanky, has a nice feel, and I also thought the upstairs bathrooms were cool. Hmmm... they must be cool to get mentioned cuz who really cares about bathrooms as long as they're clean and accessible...   Anyway, I need to go back for a decent meal. The menu looks great... wish there were more people there, though!!! It was Friday night; where are the people???

mQ_rpJyue29BBZKYMgEz4A.text: Really good hidden find in downtown Phoenix. Great Cocktails and  Food. The music and Atmosphere is something you would see in San Francisco. Such a great surprise.

rUc6uVl1lI4qfw58HRs_yQ.text: Great spot for after hours drinks and bathrooms are awesome. Pizza is great and salads are good. Seating is okay could be better but very cool downtown spot.

ShbamS4MEAFCVd_b2COffw.text: A friend of mine was staying at the Wyndham across the street and we (me, her, and another friend) were looking for a restaurant to have dinner.  The bartender at the hotel recommended Hanny's.   The restaurant is very visually striking, with high ceilings, concrete walls, and very modern seating.  We sat in a corner booth and were pleasantly surprised to discover that the backs recline!  For our appetizer, we ordered the Asparagus with Egg.  The combination is different, but it was really good!  The asparagus was cooked perfectly and the egg and parmigiano-reggiano were good complements.  For dinner, I had the Roast Beef Sandwich with a side salad, my visiting friend had the Proscuitto di Parma pizza, and another friend had the Margherita pizza.  My sandwich was a little dry, but was pretty good nonetheless.  Both of the pizzas tasted very good and were really really big!  None of us had any drinks from the bar, but I really enjoyed my experience there, and will definitely be going back there the next time I'm in Phoenix to try out the bar!

GDneTUemTeIedOFb0j-RHA.text: I enjoy going to Hanny's and will need to update this review once I go again.  I get their vegetarian items off of the menu and all have been quite good.  The drinks are fine.  This is a three star place, but has the potential (IMHO) to be so much more for such a cool environment.  I think the prices are higher than they should be, but that's what it is.  Again, will update when I go back, but wanted to get my impressions down after going a few times.

KQ0kw7O-qFjy5Mf39oxqtQ.text: Bizarre decor meets solid "Roman" style pizzas, meets a terrible wine list.  Hanny's is probably the most bizarrely decorated place I've ever eaten.  I've eaten in rural China by the way.  Phoenix is a bit of a mystery in and of itself, it's all so new, and yet there are no humans here.  The streets are abandoned both at night and during the day.  But, I digress.  The pizza for $10 was really quite good, I had the proscuitto di parma, and the beer I had from Colorado was an excellent IPA.  The side salad was also really pretty generous.  The wine list, it's terrible.  I know about wine, so I know what I'm talking about.  The 'reserve' list?  It had a $9 Pinot Gris from Washington for $37 dollars.  Stop the madness.  Great place for a bite, don't order wine. The decor was like some sort of modern Caligula meets a matador.  Strange.

6qlyB-o5fNGe5vXY_iCVUA.text: Nice, chill place right in the middle of downtown phx. Very good drinks with generous pours. This place is a great spot to go with friends or even on a casual date. You can just lounge and enjoy some drinks and have conversations. The pizzas are yummy- it's a cracker thin crust. The decor is fun from the elevator shaft to the bathrooms. Opens late so its a good spot for a late night wine down as well.

sNLusOwWCLcfliU-uhhktw.text: Hanny's is great. I love seeing these local restaurant's do it up right.  This is a converted old department store named "Hanny's". Hey, what a good idea for the name!   It's clean, hip, spacious and fun. I'm a sucker for a fresh flower and candle on my table, too. I once said if I lived in a giant warehouse-like house, this would be exactly how I would decorate. The seats are chic and even recline. It shocked me at first and I thought the booth was broken. There are two floors and a staircase up to a DJ stand on the upper wall. Cool. If you want the pants scared off of you go check out the old elevator shaft to the back with a glass bottom. It's a good time! The bathrooms might be the coolest part. Trust me here and hit them up. They are like little clean airplane lavatories! There are some tall mirrors and seating upstairs that remind me of a fun-house. I've never seen anyone actually up here, though. Maybe we just don't hit it at "happening times". The action seems to be more downstairs. Huge bar in the middle. Tons of room, and quite professional and friendly service.   The food is really good. They have a variety and Veg options available. I like the pizzas (2 people can share one if you have a moderate appetite) Drinks are good, too. It's all a slight bit overpriced, but I'm okay with that as they do serve up quality.   Prime location, diverse crowd and really like nothing else in the valley. If you are downtown looking for food or a drink, this is always my first suggestion. Now run along and play!

nyb9hRbuPhMWDnBm1sonNg.text: My girls and I decided to met her for happy hour on a Friday. It's relatively easy to find but the parking if you're okay with shelling out a few bucks.  There is a lot in the back to park but it requires you have a few dollars on you. Does anyone carry cash anymore? My word of advise DO NOT park at the meters unless you are prepared to run out on the hour. Apparently, the city of Phoenix is trying to make a few extra dollars by extending the meter hours. You have to pay at a meter until 8pm and that goes for Saturdays as well. And let me tell you, that meter maid stocked my car. I swear I went out a few times to throw in a few quarters and I think she was waiting around the corner for the time to expire. YES, I got a ticket!  Okay, enough about the city of Phoenix parking Nazi's. Hanny's is a delightfully stylish restaurant and lounge with great martinis. The drinks were a little expensive but packed a serious punch. There wasn't a huge selection of food on the menu but enough to satisfy most people. We each tried a different pizza. I had a margarita pizza and it delicious. Honestly, it was like three meals for me...very large portions once again.   If parking was a little more manageable, I think we'd go back. Hello Phoenix don't you want people to spend time downtown? If so, stop charging for parking and more will come!

Y0FMZ5Pl_Ccx9u7_imsXmg.text: Hanny's is hip!! The food, cocktails, interior design, and the whole atmosphere. We started our meal off with a couple of appetizers. One was the bar snack prosciutto, sliced right in front of you at the bar. On one of those beautiful red Italian slice machines that has to be hand cranked. Second we tried the (make it yourself) Bruschetta, which we thought was a great idea, it included cherry tomatoes and olives. The bread was nice and crispy, not soaked like most places. I ordered the roast beef panino, thick slice of roast beef with arugula, bacon, fried egg, on ciabatta bread. Yup that's right fried egg, this panino just bursted with flavor. My wife opted for the BLT panino , and could not stop talking about how good the bacon was. The server was very knowledgeable with everything on the menu and very attentive. We travel about once a month to Phoenix, and are always looking for "New" and "Exciting" restaurants. Thanks to Yelp.com we found Hanny's!!

s-mN0Ep_dPtfAL-mZEWi3w.text: This place is terrible. When u order the Moscow mule they make u turn ur drivers license in. They lost my drivers license and the manager basically told me sorry and kicked me out. Yes. He actually told me to leave. So i got the police involved who actually were very friendly and helpful. I guess One of the bartenders gave another guy my Id who looks nothing like me. The manager was a total d-bag and has the worst customer service skills possible. Not just will I never step foot in that dump again but I hope it closes down in the near future. If I could leave negative stars I would.

Q0bsGRNOOIFxPA2IH0kcvA.text: My buddy and gave Hanny's a try before last night's Suns game -- it was hit and miss for this establishment.  I expected more from the same guy who brought us the venerable AZ88.  What I liked:  $5 martinis and a robust wine list made for a nice pre-game watering hole for non-beer drinkers like myself.  The glasses are smaller than those at AZ88, but just as filled to the brim and at less than half the price.  The food was OK.  I ordered the chopped salad, but was surprised to discover that it wasn't really "chopped." Large chunks of red-leaf lettuce accompanied by cherry tomatoes, chopped onions, and a few other ingredients.  It could have been larger and more complex.  The prices are fantastic. Brad ordered the roast beef sandwich for around $9, which came on fresh focaccia bread and was stacked with bacon and a fried egg.  He said that it was OK, but could have benefited by some more flavor -- perhaps a nice sauce.  My chopped salad was around $8, so also a healthy bargain.  What I did not like:  The service.  Our server admitted to forgetting to place our appetizer order (the bruschetta), so our entrees arrived first.  When she realized her mistake, she apologized and said that the bruschetta will "be right out." However, she still charged us for it.  Not good.  The atmosphere.  Sterile and cold, with a monochromatic color scheme and too many clean lines.  It reminded me of a hotel bar in Manhattan, with minimalist intentions taken to the extreme.  There was nothing warm or inviting about Hanny's, and it's not the type of place I would have stopped in had I been simply walking through the neighborhood.    All in all a nice option for a pre-game drink or snack, but not the type of place I'd make my destination on a Saturday night.  A decent addition to the downtown neighborhood, but lacking the vibrance of a place where someone would be happy to call his or herself a regular.

eMi0GwUs9kZupnALOuc5GQ.text: What a cool space!  We needed nourishment on St Pats, as the corn beef and cabbage they were serving at the Irish pub didn't exactly float our boats. We found ourself at Hannys and had a great experience.  Their pizzas are light and tasty.  They looked like too much when they arrived, but they turned out to be the just the base we needed to get through a heavy night of drinking. The reclining booths took a second to get used to, but they just added to the laid back atmosphere once we mastered them.  OK, two friends go the tiniest 'tinis that didn't seem like much of a value, so its probably not the place for hard core drinking (I know, but these are the things I look for)  But for a relaxing cool place to start your evening off, I can still give it the thumbs up.

emzJVU5MXcoWESvUxSHrvA.text: I dig Hanny's. It's a great addition to the downtown Phoenix scene, both for during the day and at night. There is plenty of parking around Hanny's, albeit at meters, but if you go at night the meters turn off at 8 pm. The space is open, so you can definitely tell it was a department store in its previous life. The elevator shaft still freaks me out everytime I go and I am still confused a bit by the bathrooms, although I am not sure if it's because they are trendy or if because I usually have been drinking when I need to go upstairs for the bathroom.  I've had lunch twice now at Hanny's and have sampled both one of the sandwiches - the BLT Supremo (it is a BLT with hard boiled egg and cheese)- and a pizza - Bianco. While I loved my sandwich, I was very underwhelmed by the pizza. However, I am not a fan of thin crust pizza, so that is probably the reason why. The sandwich was a nice size and they cooked the bacon perfectly for me. The sandwich came with some onion straws, so that satisfied my fried food guilty pleasure.   Prices at Hanny's are, for the most part, really reasonable. The pizza, which is a nice size, was $11, and the sandwich was around $8 or so. I've only bought beer to drink, but my Stella Artois on Friday night was $5. Domestic beers looked to run around $3-4. I have found the service at the bar to be fast, but table service during lunch to be pretty slow and non-attentive. It's definitely a good spot to check out when you are downtown!

MDF7659f_msrldPp4ISFpg.text: Okay I'll admit I'm a little late to the Hanny's party. It's been on the list for a while but until last night I hadn't been able to cross it off.  The boyfriend is a huge fan of pizza (what guy isn't?) so I suggested we finally check this place out before the show we were going to. We arrived at about 6:30 (it was a Friday) and the place was packed. Not one open table. Apparently it's popular with the business crowd for happy hour as there were lots of suits. Luckily there were a couple seats at the bar so we settled in there.  We ordered two pizzas - one with pepperoni and onion and one with prosciutto (my addition lately) and apple, sans tomato sauce. They came out relatively quickly and were nice and hot. The crackery crust makes them very different than other pizzas around town. Both pizzas were very flavorful and there was an ample amount of toppings on both. The pizzas aren't huge but there were a few slices left over so we were full and happy.  The atmosphere at Hanny's is pretty cool. Modern with kind of a retro vibe. But the best part is the bathrooms. Just check them out - trust me. It's worth going there just for that.

-KHKcYZVIY0PrDbRdooXcw.text: Sit at the bar and ask for Sean. Great drink prices considering the atmosphere and very strong drinks. This is also an Absinthe bar if your in for something different. In addition to the drinks they have great local DJ's throughout the week and on weekends. Good vibe, good drinks, great service...

sBqk3HiCWnEONi68gQMyLg.text: Hanny's has potential - AZ/88 is one of my favorite places in town.  The building, design, and decor at Hanny's are amazing.  The menu and service, not so much.  I'm pretty sure it was our waiter's first night serving tables - many awkward uncomfortable moments.  I ordered a $5 martini and received a half full martini glass.  Next time I will ask if I can order two at the same time and just pour them in the same glass.  We ordered the bruschetta appetizer.  The topping came in a bowl with some thin dry strips of bread around it.  The topping itself was tasty - my recommendation is for the Hanny's chef to take a trip to Postino and check out their bruschetta bread - thick and soft with crusty edges.  I found the dinner menu to be lacking in choices.  Nothing really looked good so I ordered a pizza which left me underwhelmed.  Soggy and flavorless.    My suggestion to Hanny's is to think about the successful AZ/88 combination of good simple meals combined with strong fancy drinks.  Get somebody who knows how to make an Italian style wood oven pizza with crisp burnt edges.  And I don't think anybody will mind if a few of the menu items are the same as at AZ - in particular some good burgers.  Good luck with the changes - the debt service on that building must be enormous, and I would hate to see it shut down.  ***UPDATE***  Been back several times since initial review - Pizza was much better (i.e. crispy) and the $5 martinis have grown on me - two drinks at AZ88 and I need a cab - not so at Hanny's.  I would still like to see some more options on the menu, though.

4OrIaoOwokYf5NNLjZk8cg.text: Hanny's is cool.  The look and feel of Hanny's is sleek and sophisticated.  Concrete, marble, leather/ vinyl, and glass make up the surroundings.  I am quite comfortable in Hanny's among the edgy materials.  I started the evening with a champagne cocktail, the Bellini.  There are four or five choices.  I did enjoy it.  I ordered the Roast Beef for my main dish.  I was a good sandwich.  I actually enjoyed the garnish more than the sandwich.  It was a simple salad with Gorgonzola.  Delicious.  The pizzas at Hanny's are great.  Paper thin crusts and fresh toppings make for good eating.  I can eat a whole pizza myself and still walk out the front door.  The DJ is always spinning the coolest house..  Take your time at Hanny's, enjoy the great cocktails and good food.  Lounge for a while.

PsBb9doXMinnPQHc_3FIYQ.text: First, let me say that I highly recommend the "under the sheet" cocktail!  I have been here a couple times and have been very pleased each time.  Bianco pizza with added mushrooms is wonderful. The carne pizza is very good. Standard BLT on ciabatta was simply delightful!

ICaCKTWNosh9q2zk0CHCQQ.text: I really like this place.  There are 1 million bathrooms to choose from.   It used to be a department store... The dressing rooms are now all bathrooms.   There is a huge mirror that captivates you until your friends come looking for you.  The cocktails are pretty and strong but perfectly proportioned so you don't realize it.   There is black light and a DJ in a square cutout in the wall spinning tracks.  Maan...  looking back, I've had a lot of fun here. Mostly with people I know.  ...But one time I went on a first date here. I drank 4 cocktails--2 mojitos and 2 moscow mules. By the time we left, my legs had turned to wobbly noodles as it was described to me the following day. The date said he was on his best behavior because he thought he was being tested.. "Because no one could get that drunk off of that."  I wasn't testing though, I don't even remember that happening. I do remember the drinks tasting delicious!  I lost my favorite sweater there though, bummed about that.

C6APY2aBTPp6P1Xl7EYsDg.text: Hannys is SUCH a great bar for so many reasons. It's an old men's department store-and I can only imagine what is was like back in the day... it has a very classy and trendy atmosphere. There are some creepy things that you should seek out while you are there... go downstairs and checkout the old glass floor elevator... oh and good luck getting lost finding the bathroom... (you'll be okay with being lost). The food is great! Salads are huuuuge portions. The prosciutto pizza is my absolute favorite! The snack plate is great, and the onion strings are also a huge portion that can be shared by a table. Love all the drinks I've had here as well... champagne Bellini and French 75 are my favs :):) they serve food til 1, drinks til 1:30 and  at midnight they serve delish lil martinis..!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. cool sequined mannequin

5zJr2qZjbIFWwAQoGmyBcw.text: Maritini's were good, food was good, service was awful! Our waitress was snarky and bordered on rude. I might have been okay with it had it been busy and she was slammed but there were maybe 20 people in the place. There are so many great places to go in DTP with much better service and Happy Hour specials so I won't be going back or recommending it to friends.

cVuMANP87Yt1SwhDqYHY7Q.text: We went there for lunch, quite disappointing. There was a lot of hype about this place but it wasn't any more than average. The BLT with egg was okay. The atmosphere was quiet and the service was good.

2iDtT_-5mYM4g4zEH6KUEQ.text: Horrible!! Ordered a french 75 and it tasted of soured lemons, then tried a classic martini ,dirty, and it was pure olive juice nothing else!  Really gross, very bad we stumbled into this place because of all the stars it has, at least the cocktails were kind of cheap.

CXdvhwEet0Xwofq57q8WWQ.text: Prosciutto e mela pizza was delicious! Danielle was are server...super friendly.

fOHh8sGuA8oAKO_A8OEEKA.text: I find it odd that they don't have chicken, but still tried this place. We split the bar charcuterie plate which was ok, but we all agreed it felt like they forgot something - a jam or butter or chutney or SOMETHING. Then for the salad - again, I'd have preferred chicken but we took our server's advice and got the salads with the "thinly sliced beef" she suggested. We were both expecting something along the way of thinly sliced beef. It wasn't until after the meal that we realized she hadn't asked how we wanted the meat prepared - probably because we wouldn't have had a choice as they obviously just have a vat of GREASY slices of beef to throw on the salads. I'll give them points for it being a lot of meat, but that doesn't matter much when you can only stomach 25% of it.  I'm being nice with the three stars, my 3rd party loved the pork entree he ordered and the prosciutto really is terrific. Oh I also went once for happy hour and they were hands down the worst old fashioneds I've ever had.

CgUAnsS2w6oUnVT_DHTAQQ.text: For a place to have happy hour and pretend you live in an actual metropolis, Hanny's will help get you there. Swank and fun.  The food is decent overall, but I do love the carne pizza.

PCXDQceW9aLUH0Va-PS8WQ.text: Hip spot! I love this place. $5 martini's. yes. Gluten free pizza. A DJ putting out solid vibes. I am game. I really enjoy this place very time I go. I have nothing bad to say.   I always have received solid service every time I have patronized Hanny's.

vVPp4NkPsRWcttbSfrmdlQ.text: Nice layout. Was seated but never served. With rap playing the ambiance was less than ideal so we grew impatient t with the lack of service and left. We were glad we left and went to Bliss Rebar.

CAG9YElmJKLoNGdRrgWJGQ.text: Rude bartenders, staff, servers. Take your drinks before you finish. I can honestly say the servers seem bitter. If you dont want to be here then stay home. So dissapointed. Came here for years but never again.

YgLM2F6J5L1qIuzsUk5HYg.text: Uhhhhh god I am really racking my brain for something negative to say about Hanny's....there's just nothing.  THIS PLACE IS THE BALLS.  For some reason it reminded me of Clockwork Orange. NSFW announcement:  This is the type of place where you could imagine people doing a ton of blow.  I'm not saying anyone does, I have no clue, it just gave me that vibe.   They have $5 martinis that will get you fired up if you're a value shopper.  Go checkout the bathrooms upstairs too, it's quite the room.  This is kind of a boring review huh.  Being positive just isn't as fun.

hNfDBqtXlyNYIMGvQyY3ig.text: Dakota and Derrik are some of the best bartenders in the city. Come get a martini!  The Bianco pizza is one of the best in the valley, I HIGHLY reccomend it. They have great DJs here late in the week and On the weekends. Be sure to check out the basement.

DIBEOiKF9x9mlnWWUz352Q.text: Hanny's is a little different. We went on a Saturday night for a drink but they weren't overly busy. After waiting at a bar with two bartenders for 15 minutes (with very few customers) I ordered my drink. It wasn't made correctly and the bartender held on to my card even though I wanted to close out. That took another 5 minutes to get back. Overall, not impressed.

vy_bYsdVw9BJYCIZ-c9PUA.text: I can't really say too much about the food because we didn't have a chance to eat here.  We waited so long at the front without even being greeted that we just walked away instead.

FE6l6BIbG3CIFaGi183eNw.text: This was a really cool bar!  Came here with a bunch of co workers during a work trip.  Drinks we're really stiff and a cool vibe throughout the bar/restaurant.  But what's up with the creepy dolls in the basement???

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Give your money to the dolls

lj36gwi7Nli4K6L8FImlBQ.text: Love this place! My husband and I were looking for dinner after a show at The Orpheum Theater, and this was the perfect spot! There was a solid crowd on Saturday night, but we were quickly seated. We shared the Rocket Salad, Carne Pizza, and Symphony Chocolate Crisp Cake. All the food was delicious! The drink menu is also quite impressive. I got the Peach Porch Tea, which was light and refreshing. The atmosphere is fun, but also grown-up. Loved the DJ mixing Biggie Smalls into his playlist. This is a great place for a date or a night out with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Symphony cake
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne pizza
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rocket salad

h_R2ahaYe4FX2s0gqe6eHw.text: Don't waste your time. I am giving 1 star because The DJ was good. Food tasted like salty bar food, servers looked and acted as if their lives are miserable. We attempted to joke and lighten up the mood. No smiles, not one by our two servers. Instead of engaging with us, the servers were more concerned with cleaning up our table while we are eating dinner (taking flowers away). The flowers weren't so bad! Worst service we have ever experienced in a restaurant or whatever it is.

ksYWLX1tfb7kwpitkRFgWg.text: If I could give this place minus five stars, it would happen. The pretension and rudeness is absurd for a moderately busy restaurant in downtown Phoenix. The food and drink menu is decent, however, the staff cannot seem to get over themselves and their self-importance despite the fact that this place is mediocre at best these days.

bFcd122vyTK8u3qnIw9hfw.text: Go for the drinks, go for the food, go for the architecture and most importantly the impeccable service. Their cocktails are some of the best downtown and the building itself is amazing and conceptual. I've never had a bad plate of food there and they serve late. Great place.

AYUCoCWKAh5iSPrEi292MQ.text: I  went here twice over All Star weekend, as we were searching for something not commercial and a little bit more low-key.  We found Hanny's and were pleasantly surprised.  The pizza was good and filling,  the snack plate was perfect with a martini.  Overall, the staff was friendly, and attentive, the prices were reasonable and the food, well it was pretty good.  I didn't walk out of there feeling like we got hosed like I had a couple nights ago at the Tilted Kilt....

ddy4HcZe0k-voxw6Ofcjbg.text: So we went for an office lunch here sometime about a week ago. It must have been good because I am still thinking about it!!   The ambiance was amazing, even at lunch. It really is my kinda place with the very clean and modern. Something I think Phoenix really lacks. Being a proud Yelp'er, I did my research beforehand and found out there a few "Do Not Miss" items outside of the food. Soon after we were seated and had our drinks on the way, I headed off for the "bottomless" elevator shaft... Alright, alright, it was pretty cool. Look a little close and you will realize that its actually only about 20 feet down and there is a mirror at the bottom which makes it seem much longer than it actually is. I won't lie though, I still didn't step all the way in...lol.   We had onion strings for the appetizer. AMAZING!! There were a few people that ordered the pizzas. I would say this is probably the best value, dollar for dollar. I had the Pork Milanese. Often times I will go for the less traditional item on the menu. It was an interesting combination to say the least. A white marbled pork loin, that is pounded down, breaded and fried, then served with an array of fresh veggies and even more onion strings. A little salty however.   I shouldn't go without mentioning the service... Phenomenal!!   I will go back.

sWp9NxMchnsxFRX_-Uv7PA.text: I live downtown, so this place is a walking distance for me. I have been here so many times and have brought so many of my friends to come try this place out.  The food has always been so good (been during lunch, dinner, and late hours). Pizza and sandwiches are my favorite! Drinks are strong and good. Servers and bartenders have always been so friendly and helpful with suggestions. Prices are so reasonable, too. I am happy to have this as a nearby place to come grab food and drinks!

YcyHznoBUZjLaaJWyW74FA.text: I'd heard some positive buzz, but was rather unimpressed. We hit Hanny's on a Friday night and it struck me as one of those places that try to do too much and end up not doing much very well. My salad was okay but nothing I'd make a special trip for, my friend who ordered the Shrimp Pancetta appetizer said it was yummy, but the third in our party had the Pork Calabrese sandwich and it was so greasy I my skin almost broke out just sitting next to it. The too-loud (and "too cool") DJ and overpriced drinks didn't help the situation. It is a cool space and perhaps I just wanted too much, but I was simply disappointed.  I would give it another try, but only if other people were going and it was an "I'll meet up with you there" kind of thing. It definitely wouldn't be my pick. I hear the pizzas are a tasty option and I would give them a try if I find myself back there. Maybe they will win me over then.

da5_kr4YXwo-tAaTzDI24w.text: Great atmosphere, you must use the restrooms.  Place has a club feel and great music.  Great food and service....I love this place!

s3xuiq7K9x7fzkpVqJKZ_g.text: Hanny's is a fun place to go, but really only for one drink and one appetizer. It has a nice set up, with the upstairs overlooking the bar area and the downstairs with a nice street view. But really, this place is just an overpriced bar. Johnny Walker Blue is $65 for a 1.5oz glass. The same drink, but only 1oz, is $25 less than a block away at Seamus's (you do the math, you're getting ripped off). These type of prices go all the way down to their light beers. While this is a great place to take a date before an evening in downtown Phoenix (only because it is nice inside), it's a horrible place to grab a drink with friends or co-workers.   Anyway, I will probably continue to go here for a single drink on a date, but it's not a reason to come to downtown Phoenix.

9NnMn83u4fOHb9XZnK2cKw.text: fun lounge. despite the $20K prosciuotto machine, pros. was just ok. But like that they had the plates with pistachios and melon slices. I heard the roast beef was really good.

ohjp8iKb2k_qbghAJ-ibyw.text: I understand the night time crowd is more lively and that the place becomes more of a bar/restaurant.   For those of us in downtown for lunch every day, however, it is kind of an oddity.  The loud classical and jazz tunes seem out of place as does its substantial mixed drink menu.   The pizzas/flat breads are very good, though a tad overpriced.  The other items on the menu have left me wanting more, though.  For example, build it yourself bruschetta that seems to be nothing more than toasted slices of a baguette with a bowl of olive tapenade.  It is a decent place to change up your business day lunch routine, but don't count on it for a spectacular meal.

Zm0k87beX_hWUW3PuBfZ_Q.text: Watch out for the stupid redhead at the bar. Has no manners and respect. Kicked and told on us like a little girl for waiting at the bar since it was full. I want to punch him in the face and take his tip jar next time. Anyways beside him it's an alright place.

12kQghlprVBIk7ib0EgiuQ.text: Where can you eat at a historic building in downtown Phoenix after 12 am? At Hanny's that's where! The pizza's are out of this world with their thin crispy crust and rich cheeses that tickle the palate. If you want to have some great drinks then come here too! If it's a weekend and you're not with a group you probably want to show up early for a spot at the bar, but be sure to come either way because the staff is extremely friendly. Take it from someone that works in hospitality and sends people here on a daily/nightly basis. Hanny's is an experience where there's hipness, class, elegance, ambiance, and no feeling of regret afterwards. Regardless of you're "scene" you are sure to enjoy the environment here.

M93spG64Q-FXMY_Iear_3Q.text: Consistently horrible service (very rude manager and several servers).  Awesome drink menu.  Mediocre food (except the bar-plate).  Brought a party of 10 here and and the waitress didn't know what to do with us, we seated ourselves and had to flag someone down ever 15 minutes to get refills or place new orders. She was very rude but I don't blame her. They were "short-staffed"... as they always are. The establishment doesn't know how to treat customers very well in general. No better service when I come in with smaller parties. I've been tempted to walk out after several occasions of waiting for our check 20+ minutes (regardless of number of other customers).   I will no longer be attending Hanny's. If you go, sit at the bar and don't ask for too much, they get tired of "needy" customers quick and quickly stop showing you any service at all.

CBvEN0EcsNKngq0a4FQwjQ.text: Had the best time and food! Wood fire pepperoni pizza with a great salad... Fresh greens with parmesan slivers on one side. The other, avocado, artichoke hearts, fresh cut mushrooms, seasoned cherry tomato halves, pickled hearts of palm, diced red onions and hard boiled egg slices topped with a dijon mustard vinaigrette. Not to mention a Paulaner Hefeweizen to complete this amazing meal! Absolutely heavenly!

H4tgv2WSm9hzns267Ttzcw.text: Wow I can not wait to go back. The last time I was in this building was 40 years ago.  This place had a great vibe, great DJ's. Next time we will have dinner there.

pUtmmuyHhgdqAYXvsFTleQ.text: I went to Hanny's on a Thursday evening for dinner.  They were really busy with events happening downtown.  It took the waitress 30 mins to return to our table to inform us the bar said they had no time to make our appetizer and she didn't know if we'd get it before our dinner.  Another 15 mins later, we finally got our app, followed shortly by dinner.  The people next to us got their app AFTER they finished dinner.  The service was awful, the food mediocre, and the cost over-priced.  I had high hopes, but was disappointed.

tZPjZ1YlydirN0mrR7EMtw.text: I went back recently after a D backs game. It wasn't our first choice but every other restaurant was swamped with other baseball fans. However, my BF remembered that we enjoyed our food last time had seen other things on the menu we would try. That being said, the menu had changed since the last time we visited. We struggled to find something interesting to order. We were starving so we stayed. We both ordered one of their specialty cocktails since they seemed unique. My BF drink was not mixed well, all the alcohol was on the bottom. The drink was served in a tall skinny glass which made stirring a bit difficult causing him to spill his drink. Our server was busy with other tables so we cleaned up the mess ourselves. When our server reappeared I told him what happened and asked for a fresh drink. He looked around at our clean table as if he didn't believe us! I had to explain that we had already cleaned it up and the food runner took away the garbage in his absence. He said he would talk to a manager and walked away. Although I was offended by his insinuation, I almost felt bad for him. I thought, what kind of clientele does he deal with that he would assume we were lying about a spilled drink. He did return with a fresh drink. Overall, our experience was average at best. With so many cool restaurants downtown I probably wont go back.

gGITbSbsNnSs4mRslYCPAA.text: I am really glad I tried it last weekend on our anniversary. The price is surprisingly affordable for a sophisticated place like Hanny's. I would recommend it to people that love to hang out after late night movie or game. They have $2.50 martini after midnight. Isn't it crazy? and they taste good and the music is awesome. You have to visit the bathroom, they used to be changing room for the old department store in the 70s. It is really cool. and also you have to check out the elevator also..

kOvdYw9B3NcPE8MlTrhbcQ.text: I came here for some drinks with my cousins and I wasn't sure what to expect. But I can honestly say, I liked it. The decor was right up my alley. It had that artsy, creepy, interesting vibe. You have to check it out for yourself. There is a creepy kind of dungeon feel downstairs, with porcelain dolls around a table behind a wire fence. Wth is up with that? But once I saw that, I instantly liked the place even more. There is also this other room, or elevator shaft not quite sure, but it has a glass bottom and you can see all the way down. It's interesting and scary if you're not fond of heights. Our waitress/server was great. I wish I could remember her name. She was very attentive and friendly.   I ordered a Midori Sour way too sweet. I almost went into a diabetic coma, well not really but just so u get my drift. Everyone else seemed to enjoy their drinks, mine was just probably not the bartenders specialty. Overall, it was a nice place to go  and have drinks with your friends. It felt intimate. I would go again.

SLVVMv8bJjWCrdmf_MPNVA.text: Beautiful trendy setting with beautiful people and great music on a rainy Saturday evening.  Our foursome had the Bar Plate appetizer (easily enough for 3-4), Carne thin crust pizza, Pork Calabrese sandwich and a Chopped Salad (big enough to feed several people).  High marks to all of the food. Wine pours were a little skimpy but good.  Service was outstanding from the Host to the waitress to the servers.   It was so good, after the show at the Orpheum, we went back, asked for the same waitress and had dessert.  The Symphony Chocolate Crisp Cake with Haagen-Daz Vanilla ice cream was marvelous.  Don't pass up the house donuts (holes if you will) with chocolate or strawberry sauce (or both). Be sure and read about the history of the building.   The restrooms on the mezzanine are worth the "bio-break". A great place for very reasonable prices.   It is a place to see and a place to be seen in.  We will return many times.

ig3nJvIKhcZG9YAGrB2tdA.text: I held a group lunch for 30 people here a few weeks ago and the food was fantastic!  I hear they are losing a lot of business since The Arrogant Butcher opened, but I hope this place makes it too.  Very cool atmosphere, great food and good drink selection!

_KWg7x_Cx2-REYNkYQ9DNw.text: Don't waste your time watered down drinks and overcharged with no warning. I will not be back to many other places to have a good cocktail. Really wish my experience was better!!!

Am_wb-TLwEICoEJyF-83PA.text: If your looking and searching for a perfect pizza place that emphasizes minimal clutter to maximize taste then this is it!  Let's start with my fav's.  The prosciutto pizza.  And how does Hanny's pull off one of the better pizzas in the valley simply with great dough, sauce and cheese, on top of  delicious prosciutto (very generous helping I may add), arugula and parmigiana cheese?  Just know what you specialize in, keep the quality and freshness high and know how to bake a great pie.     For a side I have always ordered the asparagus with a fried egg and you guessed it, shaved Parmesan cheese!  Asparagus is always crunchy, egg cooked perfectly and to finish it off the cheese and a sprinkle of black pepper.    Liked the Gorgonzola slaw, which the cheese does add to the taste but $7.00 for coleslaw that is basically good coleslaw with Gorgonzola is a tad bit over priced.  Lastly, had the Prosciutto shrimp.  Okay I must be on some Prosciutto kick but when it's fresh sliced off right in front of you, tender and lean, one will agree that it's probably the thing to bring some joy to the day!.  Shrimp was cooked perfectly with,  you guessed it arugula and Parmesan cheese as garnish.     And before  I forget, let's talk cocktails!  Hanny's takes you back to the old gangster era with Absinthe, Chartreuse and of course their 1940's inspired cocktails.  They make a damn good Old Fashion, with a solid pour and a wallet friendly $9.00 price tag.  Oh yeah- and that means two of them for me!  My significant other loves wine and had the Sean Miner Pinot Noir, which is good and moderately priced.  Overall a great experience the many times I went and one must check out the basement (yes, just do it) and the restrooms (can't give any clues but very neat).

u15ybK9W3bouFI2WrO5xDw.text: Food is a 5 star Service is a 1 star  Went out for a couple drinks and seemed like this was the spot for the night since this is usually our go to spot. Good thing I was with great company otherwise I would have moved on to the next spot. Walked in & the host was pleasant, found a spot at the bar and that's where it all went bad. The only female bartender is normally Somewhat friendly, but not tonight. She must have let someone get to her because she made No eye contact, short with words, and never cracked a smile at us (smiled & friendly with some of the men tho). We realized it was busy and she may have been covering other tables, but that's not my problem. We came in polite, smiled, said our please and thank you's....I asked for wine - can't mess that up, simple & quick for her, right? I asked for their house Chardonnay which I've never had & thought it'd be pretty easy and fast. I took a few sips, didn't like it and asked for something else. We were there to drink and I'm not paying $10 for 3 OUNCES of wine w/a side of attitude ("Oh, so, you've never had Chardonnay before..." ... "uh, YES I have, I just don't like THIS Chardonnay") So I ordered beer. Thankfully another bartender from the opposite side of the bar came to help her take our drinks and food order. He was friendly and apologetic. We decided to close the tab and move to a table to lighten the mood back up. The server was super nice! He seemed new, and may have forgotten to check on our drinks BUT his happy attitude made up for the $hitty attitude & service from the bar. We are done with this place. Inconsistent service outweighs the food. Thankfully downtown Phoenix has options! Take Care Hanny's! Let me know when you clean house.

NWcZ2RU9G7li8TUMTGGkhA.text: This place is the best!!!! The music is amazing and the environment is perfect. The pizza is good for dinner or a 1am cure for you soon to be hang over from their amazing drinks! Get a martini for sure or a mule.

pDtpP3-eCSmlo6TOIuWw7g.text: Not what it used to be. Bartenders are pretentious and rude...even when they've given you the completely wrong drink and you just need them to fix it we got more attitude. You used to be a place I'd introduce friends to but not anymore

X5TtLj-rkyUYCzZN0q_gyA.text: Hanny's has an awesomely trendy yet creepy vibe. It used to be an old department store in the 40s. Definitely worth visiting for the atmosphere and eerie doll art exhibit in the basement. I give them 4 stars because it's unexpected and unlike any other place in Phx.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dressing room bathrooms
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Go in the basement

LJcKdpmC1GSwAUoy-wp6JQ.text: Excellent atmosphere and Great Customer Service. Food is reasonable priced and lots of good flavors. This place makes you feel like your in another City. Check it out :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interesting artwork inside
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Snack Bar plate

vBcfqjtHLMaEcFUXs1pcQg.text: Great place to grab a good strong drink and some light food options. Hanny's is very modern and contemporary. Quirky bathrooms. Same owner as AZ 88 ;))) Great for groups that are about to hit the downtown nightlife. Cheers to Hanny's ;)))

WOTEwr0sIX6obiySzKemOg.text: To be quite honest, I only come here when I'm attending  any concerts or basketball game and I  just walk over here for dinner. They don't have two selection for vegetarian which is cheese pizza and a cheese board. I got the cheese board, but meat was all over the cheese so I couldn't eat it. And the girl was not accommodating at all.. I was disappointed on the service.

OEt3WMaQjeLDXB-I5k1hPg.text: I am extremely disappointed that Hanny's  decided to cut down the mature shade trees outside of their restaurant.  They took years to grow and were part of the growing sustainability and pedestrian-friendly aspect of the downtown community. Unless the trees are replaced I will no longer be patronizing this business and will discourage my friends to as well.  Shame.  To read more about this :http://downtowndevil.com/2014/09/24/61096/hannys-shade-trees-cut-response/

Zy_KsxiTMoNNeMeUUREm_w.text: I was invited to Hanny's for my first time by good friends that wanted to show us a good time. At first glance walking in, it felt fresh and new with class. First I needed to use the restrooms which is an experience with a mirror hallway and swank lighting, yet the bathroom lighting is so dark that I really wondered how clean it was in there. Which is odd because the area right outside the bathrooms is very well lit. I ignored my thoughts of the dark and likely dirty bathroom and went to our table. It took way too long to bring out the drinks and thin crispy pizza that likely took 5 mins to cook. And immediately as our food was all placed in front of us, some drunks on the floor above us poured drinks on us, which went all over my wife and all over our food and drinks. The waitress and manager said this has happened before and brushed it off like it was ok just because it was common. We actually had to ask for food replacement and drink replacements because they didn't immediately offer that to us! Insane! We made it very clear how unhappy we were about the treatment and so it was even more shocking that they only removed my wife's pizza from the bill. 6 of us there, all affected by the spilled drinks dumped on our table, and that is all they did. Comp 1 item and squeak out a forced "sorry". I have personally had much better treatment from just about any other place. I have had places remove an item from my bill simply because I didn't like the food. Yet this place has patrons dumping drinks and they didn't resolve the experience in a complete and professional way. And If the balcony there is such an issue for drunks dumping drinks, they need to fix that issue. They should have been more sincere in their apology and immediately told us that there would be no charge for the entire party, while asking that we please come back for a better experience. As much as I wanted to forget what happened and salvage the rest of our time as friends on what was otherwise an amazing night, instead I just kept thinking of my wife and everyone having a drink poured on our table and the dismissive actions.

3S7pxPcX_VY89bK4mGf0lg.text: We love Hanny's!  Their desserts are amazing.  I want to try more but its so hard to stray away from the ones you are familiar with.  My boyfriend loves their pizza and I loved the pepperoni and sausage pizza.  So far we have only tried the chocolate crisp cake and the strawberry long cake but I always expect the long cake to sort of be like a short cake and the whole dessert is so cold so its kind of a shock to me every time I take that first bite.   My boyfriend loves the dirty martinis and the absinthe here.  Oh also check out downstairs for something quite different and not normal.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wB4svq9nWwU_PsFKNgadHQ.text: My first and last experience with Hannys was beyond terrible. My co-worker and I called to place a pick up order. First off the staffs knowledge of the menu, was terrible. They were beyond rude when ordering Amd when I asked questions regarding the meals. But I brushed it off. My co worker came back after picking the food up and what I saw was disturbing. I literally had a to go box full of arugula and 4 pieces of shrimp. I called them to make sure that's how it was supposed to be. And if it was then I would've dropped the issue. However the waitress that answered had an attitude out of this world. She was short and didn't apologize. Her response was " well that's how it comes i don't know what you want me to do". I wouldn't have been upset if she handled it way better and with out the attitude. So I called back requesting the manager, really personally being in customer service she was the definition of bad service. But when I called back I was on hold for over 30 mins. I had to call from my cell phone for them to answer ans be hold that time they picked the phone up in 5 mins. The manager really didn't handle the issue any better. He had an I don't care attitude. At that point it wasn't about the food but about the service. The workers I all in countered had nasty attitudes. That's the main reason I would never go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. On hold over 30 mins when asked to speak to a manager.

NDOU-ejj-TlVM7eJSk2FdQ.text: Hanny's you are speaking my language! Love the vibe here - great service on a low-key Friday afternoon during the holidays. I imagine it gets pretty busy as the day wears on. Service is phenomenal and the cocktail menu scores very highly on my hit list. Our party enjoyed sturdy old-fashioned cocktails with loads of bourbon, a lemonade mixer (sweet and easy) and a couple of beers. The snacks are delightful, and the in-house desserts were excellent. Not a fan of key-lime pie but Hanny's, you've won me over with your version and your tiramisu is scrumptious. Flatbreads were very decent and the prosciutto sampler - divine. Be sure to check out the bathrooms upstairs in the old dressing rooms and the little room downstairs too. Love this place and I'll be back!!

3uAcQJ--5F-asnSfKuvRuw.text: Amazing cocktails and great prices. Portions are great for sharing. Great chill atmosphere and always such awesome service from the bar staff.

WEkK4TPpwH0Th-Szw06Rrw.text: It had been years since I'd been to Hanny's, but after going there for lunch I think I should have waited a few more years. Maybe all of them.  I think the decor is going for industrial retro... something, but it comes across as soulless. The place would be well suited for a dystopian movie where androids come to lament their lack of humanity and try hard to be clever.  The food is okay, but not a thing on the menu seemed exciting. The servers also seemed bored and/or bothered to be there. The most exciting part of my lunch there was the elevator shaft you could look down. It has a glass floor so you can see down into the basement. The glass is probably there because past patrons threw themselves down there to escape.

__V8Hw9hFYJhsY98X1I3mg.text: After Adult Night at the Science Center, my boyfriend took me here.   I enjoyed the atmosphere of the venue and I thought it felt kinda upscale in a mysterious way... There is a weird mannequin decoration right when you walk in and I appreciated that. I wasn't aware of the basement and regret not exploring more after reading other reviews. I would go back just to do a little more exploring.   I wasn't that hungry when we went so I ordered only the Onion Strings.  I had never had more delicious Onion anything!! They were cut, breaded and seasoned perfectly, I couldn't stop eating them.   Boyfriend had the BLT and the bacon on it was phenomenal. If all bacon tasted like that, I sure would be one big girl. I never jumped on the Bacon bandwagon but if it tasted like that I sure would!  There are many features of this restaurant that make it unique, the decor and lighting, the bathrooms, etc.   I was quite pleased with the service there as well. Our server was very nice and efficient and personable.   I would go here again, should I attend another event downtown.

ZhXnd5WNK8ionK8g988NxQ.text: Hannys, Hannys, Hannys aren't you glad I said Hannys? I love this place, this is the place that makes what you call living in Phoenix a dream. It's what all city's need at night. You walk in, you wait to be seated and what do you see wonderful service, people in classic white restaurant attire it's very classic. You get more of a New York or Downtown LA feel with the dim lights and live DJ spinning above you. It has a clean and simple menu, one for drinks one for food! What you should expect is that it's very good in its portions. A personal pizza is good for two unless your greedy, then get one for yourself! Awesome sandwich choices and if you still are indecisive get one of each, like a pizza and an appetizer or a sandwich or an appetizer! Bring friends the more the merrier or sit at the bar either way is the cool way to go. I personally love their pizza and you have no wrong way of choosing definitely tho, try the onion strings so good! I always try to stop by for a martini too, the drinks are fantastic! Overall enjoy! And keep staying hungry phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roast Beef Sandwhich 13.00

gDsMrYzcK1psxjcfknQ3eg.text: I have been coming to Hanny's for years and it never disappoints.  Normally we come for drinks and a bar plate while we wait for even traffic to die down but this time we came for a sit down meal and it was AMAZING!    The boy ordered the steak and I had the Pork Milanese and they were both amazing.  The Pork Milanese was a very large portion for the price and there was no way I was able to finish it, even though I tried.  The lemon butter sauce was on the side so the pork cutlet stayed crispy and the sauce gave a great flavor to the dish, subtle but not over powering.  The boy's steak was tender and had a really nice flavor to it.  It came with gorgonzola (which he hates and opted out of) and even without the sauce, it tasted delicious.  Hanny's is a hidden gem in the down town area.  From the DJ, to the decor, to the elevator shaft, to the unisex restroom, this place is an original.  Plus it is always worth it to take a newbie to check out the basement ;)

UqeFvxa_i0Oq8AvxiRqTww.text: Stopped in for late night drinks with co-workers. Super swanky and friendly service with upbeat music. Didn't eat here but have heard from locals food is good. Lemon drop martini(s) were on point! Fun place & good atmosphere/ambiance!

-PdN0EtJvDZCrylYM_i2ZQ.text: Had a wonderful service !! 5 stars because of the impeccable service by EUGENE! So wonderful and taken care of!! Not bad for drinks $$ wise or food! Pizza was good and light! Not too heavy! Was big enough to split with people ! Will come here again! Very comfortable seating!

7ALG2MrqUgwxDq5esqdHmA.text: This was a great place for date night. I highly recommend. Check out the basement and the elevator.

saIxGhv7fYP7m1n5mHHD_A.text: I REALLY Love Hanny's; the DJ, the atmosphere, the ambiance, food and NORMALLY the service. This Saturday though has made me think LONG and HARD about if I/we will be returning. I JUST had lunch there with colleagues on Friday. Saturday, after a movie at the 3rd Street AMC, we stopped in for dessert. Geno greeted us at the door and was our waiter-THE BOMB! We ordered the 2 desserts-BOMB! Then my husband asked to see the menu for the delicious pizzas he kept seeing. So we ordered the Bianco, a white pizza but we added red sauce. What came out REALLY quick was a Margherita pizza and I say that because we saw NO signs of the cheeses of a white pizza. It was tons of red sauce, cherry tomatoes and strips of basil. The server, who even called it a Margherita, initially, was unsure if it was ours, which we said no we had the Bianco with red sauce-he left came back and said, no this is yours. So I said, no that is a Margharita pizza. He left came back, then showed me the order receipt. I don't care what the paper says this looks like a Margharita pizza or a OVERCOOKED white cheese pizza with red sauce. He GOT PISSED and performed; shoved a chair and talked under his breath loudly. Excuse me!??? Who does that? We did not try to convince him to eat some crap that was sitting in the back that he didn't order???!  Again, he comes back to the table peddling this pizza. ABSOLUTELY NOT we are not interested. He performs AGAIN! Mubbling,"I'll gladly leave..." We spotted our waiter who saw the pizza and said, no it was wrong. BUT  now the manager comes out peddling this Margharita pizza to us. My hubby was like, I will NOT eat this thing they keep bringing out because I don't know what has been done to it at this point since the server was INSENSED about me questioning him. I have been there enough times to know it was a Margharita pizza or you have baked the hell out of this white pizza with sauce pizza. The strips of basil laid across the top-Dude that is not the Bianco. I talked to the manager who insisted it was what we ordered and I expressed the issue is no longer the pizza - WE will not eat it, but that guy's behavior, which was ABSOLUTELY UNACCEPTABLE! The manager agreed, but I left there SUPER STEAMED and just highly offended. So I have some thinking to do. Maybe this was a bad night for this dude and immaturity took over and I should not paint Hanny's with a broad brush-? This rubbed me raw Saturday, so maybe I just need to heal. Geno was the BEST! He greeted us at the door and was SUPER apologetic! We tipped him more than 100% on the tab which the manger did comp 1 of the 2 desserts.  AWFUL situation! We were having such a nice evening and we were enjoying Hanny's. It is in the neighborhood, I brag about it to my neighbors in the building, but NOW...

VxU1eLZrmC787f0HWv0T1g.text: Super cool little place and really hot owner! They are very friendly and amazing food, especially for the kitchen size! Good job here!

ncGDIfTybPCIYt7JpO4dmQ.text: This place is all visual and lots of biz people from the area eat here.  Great local place to if your in the area but I wouldn't make a special trip here.   1) Menu Selection is shy and a bit small (especially the lunch)  2) Service is better at the bar than dining  3) Quality of food was sub par compared to ambiance and environment  However, if you're aiming for a coffee/drink only kind of place to host a business meeting in the area then this is a great dig!   Otherwise, there are thousands of other food options in downtown to enjoy other than Hanny's

oTPSH1D1To8sL1WVAWfutw.text: To start off with the good, the place has a very nice atmosphere and looks very pretty and romantic. Server very very rude and unhelpful. I asked about allergy menu since my son is allergic to nuts and the server could not help at all. I asked for a manager or chef for help but the server just said the restaurant was too busy at the moment. My husband ordered a pizza and it was just ok, nothing to brag or talk about. I can not recommend this restaurant

9wgvPetzCubsxbB_2mq5nw.text: I love this place. It's always a 'go-to' for friends and family. I've brought sooo many people here for their first-time and they always want to come back. The ambiance is awesome and the food (pizza) is even better! AND THE DRINKS ARE STRONG every time!

ImJHfH8jcF2bUawKXuYJww.text: Interesting atmosphere in the heart of the city. Thin Cheese Pizza and beat salad spilt between 2 people was a nice.

kaHQcsFBs-oQYzf7yo9TkQ.text: I live and die by Yelp when I travel. I almost didn't go here because of some iffy Yelp reviews...thank goodness I went with my gut because this place was fantastic!  Yes, we went on a Sunday and, yes, it wasn't busy. Service was spot on - thank you Benjamin!   We scoped out the menu ahead of time - five dollar martinis, yes please! My husband opted for a couple of classic cocktails and loved both.  The little snack plate that everyone raves about is worth it! Proscuitto is cut fresh at the bar...rare in the U.S. It was the perfect plate to snack and enjoy a cocktail. Thank you to our server for letting us pace our evening!  We ordered the Rocket salad - love they call it both arugula and rocket on the same menu! We are always ok on sharing a plate, yet our server had it split on two plates - huge salad and easy to share. I love arugula and this was probably the most perfect balanced dressing (what I strive for at home) with great shards of parmigiana...yum!  We had the prosciutto pizza. The crust is cracker thin which my husband loves and I loved the fact it still tasted like a real crust. Fantastic San Marzano tomatoes, fresh cheese and toppings - perfecto!  My husband loves dessert, but we usually skip it. I told him he should splurge and mentioned the strawberry long cake that Yelp raves about...everything on the menu sounded better, but he went for it and loved it. Imagine the strawberry shortcake ice cream bar from the the elusive ice cream man...yum.  Great environroment, great food and great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry long cake
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Proscuitto pizza
Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arugula salad

mYtBxKlFT35YV7-naimV6A.text: The Cauliflower Cabrese was very good.   Also had the shareable appetizer which was perfect for the table.  The place was busy but the service was on point.

cyDIWCXMyhpshMb3RRQg_Q.text: Been going here for years, such a cool spot, great drinks good food and open late. Formerly an old department store, this place has 3 levels that provide a unique experience. The entrance is a bar surrounded by lounge style seating/tables. The top floor is almonds like a funhouse at a carnival with a glass floor over the elevator that makes you a little dizzy looking down and a series of bathrooms that I won't ruin, you'll just have to check out for yourself. The basement can be described no other way but creepy. I won't ruin that either. The pizza is very nice especially with a cocktail, great bourbon selection btw if you're a bourbon head like me. The menu is pretty simple but the ingredients are fresh and delicious for example they slice prosciutto to order. Check it out.

_0ImLvuTQwGwzty_S0pesA.text: Delicious thin crust pizza and great cocktails.  Can't get better!

DEKenxM4naWWcdVKeXSpyQ.text: This place is one of the best values in the valley. If you want a steak & martini it cannot be beat for the price. On Sunday, they serve a "petite" steak about 60% the size of their regular one...for $11!! Add a $5 martini and you have a 1st class meal for the price of a burger and beer. If you have work to do, the bar is quite functional. My only complaint is that their wifi never works. You need to bring your own. The bartenders are completely professional as well.   1/25/17  Katy makes an amazing martini!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Katy&#39;s amazing martini! Notice the curvature! Sublime. Katy doesn&#39;t spill or splatter! You can&#39;t move it though. You have to go to it!

xtfwOkNZZ5gNagqsCzRZ5g.text: Upbeat music fast spot on service. Our crisp thin crust margarita pizza was tasty with s bit of heat. My beet arugala goat cheese salad was huge. Fresh and delicious. I really enjoyed the grilled asparagus prosciutto appetizer.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EGdQMo38SazmcuCiUiAjyA.text: Amazing drinks and eclectic atmosphere. I've been here twice and had excellent service both times. Their peartini's are to die for! Their meat and cheese board is also delicious. I can't wait to be back!

n3Q5ILv3QPjxcDNUAPt7Fg.text: First of all, let me say that I love Hanny's. I love it because it's downtown, it's an iconic art deco building and my dad used to buy his suits here when I was a kid. I've always supported this place. I've literally been coming here for years. Tonight, after leaving Symphony Hall, we met a friend at Hanny's. Upon arrival, he was asked to leave. The bartender approached us and confronted my friend regarding the ex-girlfriend waitress lying about a 'pending restraining order'. There is no restraining order against my friend. He actually hasn't spoken this person for 2 years. After ordering a beer, he was asked to pay for the beer and leave. It was very awkward and embarrassing. Good luck Hanny's.

gEbS6XQKyIyVkddaYYJeQg.text: After a great comedy show we decided to grab  some grub. The Hanny was a mile away. Why not! Plus both of my friends have been there before.    My hubby decided on the brick oven pizza.  It was huge but tasty. The waiter was okay but I wouldn't want to work on Christmas either so I understood the bland attitude.   I ordered the snack plate. It was perfect late night snack. The decor of this place was by far beautiful with a Christmas tree entirely made of money. Gorgeous!! Statues that were made of all hand bead work!!! Amazing.   I would give this place another during the day to see how much traffic comes through and people.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanny's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ready for a midnight snack!!

Q4b9K8XPzHD5DrTujqn0yg.text: The food was delicious. Try the carne pizza and the hanny's steak sandwich was perfect. The service wasn't on point but what can I say it was busy the day we visited. Definately hitting this place up again.

N0O0b7Hf9LheUiHQo8uuJg.text: Best night ever! Eric was so attentive and kind to my girlfriend who hadn't been out much! Will def come back!
